Reviews.Title: “Amazing job after Isaac”
Reviews.Author: Mike P
Reviews.Content: Stayed here September 1 & 2, just 3 days after hurricane Isaac hit the city of New Orleans. This hotel took some water and had over 150 rooms that were soaked or damaged. The hotel had workers and outside workers cleaning, repairing and drying out the damaged areas. They worked with guests to try and make their stay as comfortable as possible, even going as far as providing rooms at other properties. You would not of known a hurricane had went through otherwise. The location of this hotel is amazing in regards to seeing the French Quarter and other New Orleans attractions. All the staff were friendly and helpful and were ready to assist at any request. The only complaint we had was with the attached restaurant. The service was terrible! We can't review the food as the server lost our order. Which was a feat considering there was only about a dozen people in it. We also had used the "park and cruise" fare and would recommend this hotel for anyone cruising out of NOLA. The bellmen can get you set up with a cab to the pier for only $7 a person.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Tennischick09
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. It was updated and clean. It is one block from Bourban St and right at Canal, so it is within walking distance of most places to see while in New Orleans. Everyone was friendly and helpful. We will stay there again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Robert K
Reviews.Content: Like real estate, this Hotel is all about the location as it is tucked into the French Quarter, with all its grittiness and grime. This hotel serves as a convenient, yet friendly place to explore New Orleans. While it is certainly overdue for renovations, the friendly staff and the hotels reasonable price make it a winner. Our room was comfortable and the Wi Fi worked well. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: MiRiAmAk
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great, just one block from Bourbon Street! There was no noise and yet we were on Bourbon St within minutes. The room and bathroom were spotless and spacious. The beds are extremely comfortable, which is great after a night out. We were on the 20th floor, which meant we had to get one elevator to the 18th floor and then switch to another to get to our floor. Free wifi was great, however on the last night we couldn't get it in our room and had to stand in the hallway. Computers in the lobby are also useful. Didn't use the pool so can't comment on that. Staff were friendly enough, we didn't need to speak with them much and they posted our postcards for us. Overall, we had a great stay and would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Shocked and disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: chloeVermont
Reviews.Content: We have been a gold member for some time and typically stay at holiday inns or expresses never having any issues. Everywhere we have stayed even on this (going to be 2 weeks) trip has been excellent, clean rooms friendly staff exept New Orleans. We arrived to check in, it wasn't busy at the time so I asked if there was an upgrade available (we booked on the priority club site) I was firmly told "we don't upgrade you booked 2 double beds". ???? What does that have to do with anything? I was just asking, so we went up to our room 1406. My 20yr old son, 15 yr old daughter and me. First my son noticed the bathroom light was blinking on and off, the wall switch had a hole near it in the wall. Then he realized the bathroom door knob stuck so you couldn't get out without really twisting and moving the knob. Finally the toilet wouldn't flush all the way without several flushes and holding the handle. The shower had an old dirty wire soap holder. Just not what this trusted chain prides themselves on. I will say the front desk immediately addressed this issue and moved us to 1810. I did appreciate that but even this room was not what we have grown to expect ceiling tiles were pushed up, bathroom was not very clean, black finger prints on the inside of the bathroom door, black material in the corner of the bathroom. Very old worn and outdated. I have stayed at their other sites over the years in New Orleans and have been very pleased. This is the first disappointing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the heart of the French Quarteer”
Reviews.Author: Tr6637
Reviews.Content: The room are spacious and staff was very kind and helpful.Â  The hotel is located in the french quarter so there is no need to take a taxi or bus to visit major tourist attractions. There is also free wi-fi acess. The only drawback of this hotel was that the shower did not work so we had to take bathes instead.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Crystal M
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at the holiday inn. The rooms were clean and roomy. The blow dryer stopped working and they immediately sent up a new one. checking in and out was very easy. Located in right in the French Quarter so we could walk everywhere. Reasonably priced. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Employee Stole From Us”
Reviews.Author: Mary M
Reviews.Content: I will NEVER stay at a Holiday Inn ever again. Our trip started off great when we came in town for a wedding. Running late the next morning, we called to check out, but left our cell phone charged in the wall on the bed. After leaving the parking garage, we called the front desk to ask to hold our phone and charger until we came back through after the wedding. We were transferred to house keeping who didn't answer the phone so we ended up leaving a message. Throughout the time we spent at the wedding, we called two more times. No answer! We came back to the hotel for the staff to say that no one found or saw a phone or charger... Even the manager dismissed our concern! Would not even look at us while talking to us or listening! I was stolen from by an employee of this hotel and NO ONE cared!!! Thanks Holiday Inn!

Reviews.Title: “A very busy older property”
Reviews.Author: projectorfixer
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a reasonable property in the French Quarter, this hotel will fit the bill. The staff was excellent in their service and the room was reasonably clean. Our only complaint would be that the hotel's elevators were painfully slow. It was not uncommon to wait almost 10 minutes in the elevator down to the lobby in the AM. The hotel's restaurant is now leased out to a sports bar and the usual Holiday Inn breakfast buffet is contingent upon the number of guests registered at the time. We gave up and walked several blocks to a real restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, just 'okay' hotel.”
Reviews.Author: eyedrkris
Reviews.Content: Location is everything. It was one block from Bourbon Street but a little long of a walk to Jackson Square. It took a long time to check-in and there was a line to go up the elevators. We were on the 20th floor which isn't a big deal until you find out that the elevators only go up to the 18th and then you get off and go up another set to the 20th floor. hmmm? The room/bathroom was a little odd and weird. The door to the bathroom when opened prevented access to the toilet, you had to squeeze next to the sink and tub to close the door and get to the toilet. The ironing board cover was dirty. The staff were great and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Second room was ok, but restaurant is not”
Reviews.Author: DesertRose49
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn French Quarter for three nights. The first room we had was not acceptable because the bathroom was not very clean. We asked for another room, and Manager Elray transferred us to the 19th floor. This room was much better and cleaner, but the air conditioner was old and too loud to sleep when it was on. We saw the maintenance man in the elevator and told him about the air conditioner. When we returned back that evening, there was a new air conditioner installed that was very nice. At that point, the room experience was very good, as the beds are VERY comfortable. However, the restaurant next door, the Checkered Parrot, is disgusting. The waitress wouldnt even recommend any food, and the bathrooms were deplorable. I'm surprised Holiday Inn would be associated with it. Overall, if you don't need a restaurant, the hotel was acceptable. There is a hotel down the block, the Hotel Monteleone, that has a good restaurant. We walked there for breakfast. Also, the concierge at Holiday Inn was very helpful in finding us a city tour.

Reviews.Title: “Just...okay”
Reviews.Author: rickyrue
Reviews.Content: The employees were friendly and helpful. When the lights didn't turn on in the hotel room, I told the front desk. The problem was solved within a few minutes. The location is perfect because you really are steps away from all sorts of attractions and restaurants. The building itself is old and in need of lots of fixin'. The bathroom was ugly and dirty, and the toilet was extremely loud when flushed. The carpet was not vacuumed. If I return to New Orleans, I will not stay there. The French Quarter has many other options.

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: Beth S
Reviews.Content: This hotel was old. It took 1 1/2 hours to check in because there was a large group in front of us & only 1 person behind the registration desk which is unacceptable. They did nothing to make up for the long wait. Very disappointed, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I Have Ever Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: lauren b
Reviews.Content: Really can not recommend this hotel to anyone, frankly I would get better from a $10 a night hostel. The room was not what we had paid for, the staff were rude to the point of being obstructive, the premesis is unkempt and falling apart and our entire stay was plagued with problems. The room only had one bed despite being assured four times previously that our room would have two, and the fold out had no mattress. We had to fight to get a rollaway which they wanted to charge us for. The walls and floor were less than clean, as was the bathroom. There is also no soundproofing between the room and the hall. The staff were so rude that we put a complaint in to the hotel chain, who assured us a manager would be up to talk to us. The manager called rather than seeing us personally but assured us that the fold out bed counted as a second bed and that we should have checked in earlier in the day. There is a laundry that guests can use, however the soap dispenser ate my money, one of the two washing machines was broken and no out of order signs posted. We actually wrote out our own 'out of order' sign after having to advise other guests of the problem, which is still there 3 days later. When we asked the various staff we could find (who all assured us that the problem was being fixed) for soap to wash our clothes with we had two staff members disappear without a further trace, the front desk who advised someone would be up though 2 hours later no one appeared, and were eventually provided with a booster by the security guard, but no actual soap as he advised there was none in the hotel. We were saved by a very nice fellow guest. Every guest we talked to were having similar problems. All in all, an unpleasant stay. I will not use this hotel and would hesitate to use any Holiday Inn in the future. I have definately made my friends and family aware of the problems.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was tired but service was good”
Reviews.Author: Lenny R
Reviews.Content: Just got through with a two night stay. I will have to say that the hotel was a little tired but the staff was very nice. Every time we had a request- they were great about it. Location to the French was great, if you like that sort of thing... The attached restaurant was not good, but not owned by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: Lisa B
Reviews.Content: It is all in what you are looking for. We are a family and my top two requirements are clean and safe. It didn't meet either one. Our room and bathroom were dirty, including but not limited to dirt specks all over the floor and blood specks on the wall. Characters outside were shady and parking is overpriced for what it was. The parking garage spells like pea and other things I won't mention. We were given a king side bed for three people despite having booked two queens. When we asked abou changing rooms due to the condition of the room and the fact we had one bed for three of us, we were told the manager would contact us tomorrow. Not adequate and by the way the manager never called us. Having stayed in New Orleans before, The Omni is better and you don't have as many shady characters outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Room for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Karla C
Reviews.Content: This hotel left me and my boyfriend pleasantly surprised with the quality of room. We planned a trip to NO on a short notice. So we were on a limited budget. I booked the hotel through a bid on priceline. I was nervous about our stay at this hotel based on some negative reviews I had read about bathrooms not working, muggy smell, etc.. Also many people mentioned shady characters tend to hang out in front of the hotel. So when we arrived at 1am...they were very nice at the front desk and quick to check us in...we were in the 20th floor and when we walked into our room everything was very nice! Room was immaculate and very new decor. We thought we would spend very little time in our room, but the room was so inviting that we ended up spending a good amount of time during the day taking siestas and relaxing after our activities during the morning and afternoon. There are some interesting characters in the vicinity but i think its because the liquor store right in front of the hotel. The hotel is also the perfect walking distance from ACME restaurant a must eat place in NO...which always has a line. We walked to Bourbon street every day and night and had a really good time! I would definately stay here again...it did appear that the 18th, 19th and 20th were the newest floors because the AC was on full force...but felt really good after stepping in from the heat. We were very happy with our room!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and that's just about it”
Reviews.Author: Morten A
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, affordable and with a friendly staff. That's not bad for a hotel, and that's it for the French Quarter Holliday Inn. Small, dark and moisty rooms. No fridge or micro. A bathroom the size of a stamp The view would be great, if they ever cleaned the windows. But who cares! We were there for two nights passing by, and the location really is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Great Price. Average Hotel. Awful Restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: miami33029
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location if you don't want to drive in New Orleans and want to be right off Bourbon Street. There are much nicer hotels nearby, but they are a lot more expensive. I've stayed at this hotel a few times and have consistently been happy with the rooms and the value for the price in the area. The rooms are clean. The beds are comfortable. The lobby is small, and the elevators are slow. This is a hotel that a lot of Greyhound Bus Tours would stay at. I'll probably stay here again...just never in my life with a bus tour. The only real detracting comment I have is regarding the restaurant. On the weekends, they have a pretty decent buffet (just remember to get the discount coupon from the front desk). However, during the week, they only offer Ala Carte service. I ordered two eggs, potatoes, toast, and sausage. I swear, I could have raised a chicken, grown potatoes, milled flour, and baked bread faster than these guys made my breakfast. It was an absolute horror show, and the apathetic manager and surly server could have cared less. There is a nice Crowne Plaza right around the corner on Canal Street that has great food and service for breakfast. I can't speak for dinner because you have to be really pathetic (or drunk) to visit New Orleans and waste your time eating dinner in this restaurant. Best food in New Orleans - Have the BBQ Shrimp at Mr. B's Bistro right up the street from the hotel. Try Oysters Rockefeller at Antoine's (they created it). Have BBQ Oysters at Drago's (there's one in the lobby of the Hilton River Walk Hotel and one in Metarie). Have a Hurricane at Pat O'Briens and scream "Lucille" at the dueling piano bar.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: gj_morris
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a 5 day stay at the Holiday Inn French Quarter. This was our second time at the hotel â€“ the last being way back in 2001. At that time we were very impressed by the location, amenities, ambience and service of this hotel. So we had no hesitation in selecting it again for our return visit. Sadly, the only thing that still remains the same is the excellent location â€“ and, to some extent, the service. Overall, the hotel appears faded and in need of an upgrade. The walls and carpets in particular have seen better days. We reserved a patio room which afforded direct access to an open area on the 9th floor. Unfortunately, the downside to this was the fact that the door to the patio was frosted glass. Which, while offering privacy, did nothing to block the morning sun. Consequently, we found ourselves lifting the bedspread over the top of the door and closing in the top of the door each night in order to block the anticipated morning sunlight. The room was a generous size - which was nice â€“ but, again, it had seen better days and was looking rather tired and out-dated. The hotel has no restaurant of its own but is attached to what used to be a TGI Friday. This is now called the Checkered Parrot. Upon check-in we were reminded that we had reserved with a complimentary breakfast each morning, and were given vouchers to use at the Checkered Parrot. However, upon reading the vouchers, we found that they entitled the holder to a complimentary breakfast up to the value of $20 per room. Unfortunately, the buffet breakfast for 2 at the Checkered Parrot came to well in excess of $20. This is the first time we have ever stayed in a hotel where there have been limits placed on a complimentary breakfast that needed to be topped up with cash. Feeling that the whole â€˜including breakfastâ€™ aspect of our booking was a misrepresentation, after the first morning we chose to eat breakfast further down into the Quarter. We were happy to pay fully for breakfasts there, rather than be dissatisfied with a partial voucher at the Checkered Parrot. Overall, we found the hotel comfortable but nothing special and would not stay there again. I would suggest anyone considering this hotel based on its location, take a look at the Hotel Monteleone, just across the road. Equally well-located but much better presented.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge a 10, Desk Staff an 8.5, Bell staff and assistance 0.”
Reviews.Author: travelinondownthroad
Reviews.Content: Great Concierge (Broderick) and Desk Staff, but no bell staff and hassle at check-in. For the price it was a great location. Watch out for the across the street market. They have short change artists on the cash registers.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay weekend of Essence Festival”
Reviews.Author: oneworldall1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel the weekend of Essense Fest.-We had a King bed. Other vistors have made comments about staff/room/shady characters/Internet/hotel being dated and elevators as well as a host of other negative comments(here is my take) 1. Staff were always very friendly and helpful 2. Our room was cleaned daily and bed very comfortable and A/C cold and updated flat screen TV 3. As this hotel is in the French Quarters there are a lot of businesses (places selling liquor)open 24x7 and as such, the hotel is located across the street from a liquor store. and one would expect folks hanging out drinking in front of liquor store. 4. Wireless Internet in the rooms is a bit spotty at times and also down at times. I would agree the hotel needs to do a better job of monitoring this as it is not hard to to. 5. This hotel appears to be old, but I would say it is not dated. Room and lobby appropriate decore (not up scale). 6. The hotel has 3 elevators to the 18th floor and a single elevator from 18th to the 21st floor. We stayed on the 18th floor and never had an issue with having to wait on the elevators. However, some folks we met did report this issue. I suspect that those folks complaing were attempting to get on the elevators during check out times or the elevator was full when it got to them and they had to wait for another elevator. Only issue I had was lack of a work-out room. The small arae allocated should not be called a workout room, but a corner. This needs to be addressed as more and more people are becoming health aware and wish to maintain their health while on vacation/business This is a Holiday Inn a business/family friendly hotel,and not an upscale hotel. A good value for your dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: Pamela S
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my room on the 18th Floor with it's magnificent view. The room was spacious and clean with a very comfy bed. There were actually two King Sized beds in the room. It is also very central - you can walk pretty much anywhere within the city area. The staff are not that friendly. It is quite a busy desk. On arrival, the female clerk curtly told me the room was delayed in it's availability so I would have to come back in a few hours, another day a different clerk was yawning and acted quite bored as I was talking to him; and another charged me for 3 days parking when I didn't even have a car - luckily I picked this up on my cashcard statement. The hotel does not supply breakfast but will give you a discount voucher to have it downstairs at `The (something - Blue?) Parrot'. Don't. Twice I went there - waited an eternity - and still did not get served. The staff there are slack and arrogant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, clean, comfortable. BUT...”
Reviews.Author: okiechick78
Reviews.Content: We had a king bed that was so very comfortable. Air conditioning worked great. The wi-fi was really slow, and didn't even work the first night we were there. Front desk staff were very nice. But they told us the city trolleys never stopped running. Yeah, they stop running at 11:00 p.m. We got stranded on Frenchman street and had to walk about 14 blocks. (It wasn't too bad. We distracted ourselves by people-watching, and fending off drunk locals who think all tourists are suckers.) The lady concierge told us to go across the street to "Unique Grocery" to buy an all-day trolley ticket. We took one step in there and walked right back out. This was after I'd told her, "I don't want to go in there." She told us to pretend we were in New York. Well, if we were in New York, we wouldn't go in there, either. There was always a crowd of ne'er-do-wells standing outside, at any given time of the day. P.S. You can buy an all-day trolley ticket by getting on a trolley. Why didn't she just tell us that?! We figured it out for ourselves... Anyway, the maid service was great, the parking was very good, right off the lower floors and accessible by the hotel elevators. ($26 a night) Everywhere I looked at staying charged more for wi-fi whether you used it or not, or more for parking. All in all we had a very good stay, and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfy in the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: skeese
Reviews.Content: Very convenient for a stay in the French Quarter. The beds were super comfy. The King suite was very spacious and we had a beautiful view of the Mississippi River from our room on the 19th floor. The only downside is that you have to take two elevators to get to floors 19 - 20. The pool is located on the 10th floor. Parking costs $26 a day and it is self parking in the garage. Pat O'Brien's is just around the corner. Canal Street is less than 1/2 block away. Walking distance to Aquarium, Jackson Square, and so many great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “great affordable place to stay in FQ”
Reviews.Author: Spinniecur
Reviews.Content: Very well located, friendly staff and very nice room. No problem with the elevators

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn French Quarter Royal Street”
Reviews.Author: ginab0
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay in New Orleans. This Holiday Inn on Royal Street was in a perfect location to everything. The beds were so comfortable and the room was great. I suggest going to New Orleans in the fall as it was very hot in the high 90's everyday. The restaurants were so good and there were tons of fun bars to drink at. We had a wonderful time and I will go back again in the fall.

Reviews.Title: “The little things....”
Reviews.Author: jkshaver
Reviews.Content: Pros Cost off Hotwire Location -1 block to bourbon- next street to canal- French market 3 blocks- Walgreens on corner of block Free wifi Floors above the 10th floor need room keys to get to Cons- Really shady quickie mary out front of hotel -homeless people gather in and out of store-really rough crowd there Slow elevators Slow Internet in lobby as we left on our last day told that the water was off from 12-4pm (no bathrooms) Typical rooms- really dirty windows looking outside Lobby staff couldn't make change from a $20 to get us on a taxi

Reviews.Title: “Heart of French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Buckshot00fan
Reviews.Content: Great rooms Great price. A little musty. Take your own water Theirs tastes like dead fish. Bathroom sink and tub would not drain properly. toilet didnt flush well either. Great water pressure.Comfortable beds. Plenty of chlorine in pool. Great Staff. One block over from Bourbon St. Close to everything. $26 a day to parkbt but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Better Pass on this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tipnring
Reviews.Content: The location is good, the front desk staff was friendly. My room was large one & the king bed was comfortable. That's the good part. I stayed in room 1613. The room & bathroom needs updating and could use a good through cleaning. The air conditioner had lots of dust in the intake as well as the light fixture in the bathroom. I had no hot water & called maintenance. They sent someone up right away and he advised that you have to let the hot water run until the water gets hot. I couldn't check in until 4pm. The air conditioner was noisy when it cycled on & off. This could annoy a light sleeper. I agree with the previous reviews, the elevators are slow and I wouldn't want a room near them. I didn't use the pool so I can't comment on that. I wouldn't stay here again. Parking was $26 a day. My room rate of 119.66 cost me $ 326.44 for 2 nights.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Umm.... It's a place to rest your head I guess”
Reviews.Author: FAMU_Mommy
Reviews.Content: I am one to not sleep well when I'm not comfortable in a hotel room. My husband, son and I are only here for one night thank goodness. We are headed out for a cruise. Our check went ok, there was a little confusion over the room because we are with a family reunion group, so I'm not holding this against the hotel at all. The staff was very helpful and friendly with getting our bags to the room and we had a ton of crap. Once in the room, I needed to lay down (pregnant). I pulled the covers back and what do I see.... Hair! Gross! Now I'm a bit OCD but who wants to see hair on "clean" sheets? The thing that is the most disturbing is the sound that is coming from the old drop ceilings in our 18th floor room. I don't know what is living up there but they need to get an exterminator in here ASAP. I can't tell if it's a rodent or bugs but it's enough for me not want to fall back asleep. Yes I am writing this a 3:45am while laying in the bed at the Holiday Inn. I got up to use the bathroom and couldn't go back, to sleep and that's when I started hearing movement. I know, it's not my imagination! Speaking of the bathroom... Well, It's a bathroom. I personally will spend more for a better hotel. If we were staying in New Orleans for more than one night, I would check out can go some where else!

Reviews.Title: “Horrific experience”
Reviews.Author: Michael M
Reviews.Content: You will make a horrific decision if you stay at the Holiday Inn French Quarter. The front desk people were rude. The staff was disorganized, made mistakes on our billing, refused to return phone calls amongst other problems. While sitting in my car in the parking lot, we watched several rats running around the outside of the lobby. There was no effort on their part to correct billing issues and we only stayed ONE night!!! It would be the last place that I would ever stay if I return to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Room for Improvement”
Reviews.Author: nola08
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this property several times over the years. I had some points of real dissatisfaction this visit. We were vacationing with friends. We booked, and paid for, our friend's room. We were pleased to be able to check into our room early, but our friends weren't able to check in until after the 4pm check in time. When we went to our room, we found that the bathroom had not been cleaned . . . used soap and wash cloths on the sink and I don't know when the floor in that bathroom was last cleaned. Also, the bathroom smelled strongly of vomit, and it made the whole room smell bad. We brewed the in-room coffee to try to mask the smell. Our room was not serviced on the second day of our stay. By the time the housekeeping staff came by, it was well after 5pm and I was taking a shower to go out for dinner. We just asked for fresh towels and soap. On the third day, I decided to take our friends' child swimming, only to find her room key didn't work anymore. And, the manager refused to give us access to the room, even though I could produce the receipt showing we'd booked and paid for the room. When her parents returned, they found their room keys didn't work as well. The hotel locked our friends out of a room that was booked for several more nights. When the keys were replaced, the manager was unappologetic. The last evening of our stay, we took the child for a swim to find that the pool and exercise area were out of towels. I went to the front desk to request they send up more towels. Several patrons of the pool called multiple times to ask for towels. It was well over an hour before towels were brought up to the pool. The hotel needs to hire adequate staff to service rooms in a timely manner, and so that the staff isn't so rushed to get through all the rooms that they do a sloppy job. The manager needs a lesson in southern charm.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: tes0520
Reviews.Content: The property itself was fine. It was a typical holiday inn hotel room. It was clean and comfortable. We were on the 19th floor and had a view of the river. We had a large group check in and they were ready for us when we arrived which made it very easy. Staff were friendly. There is a store across from the hotel that draws some "sketchy" individuals that cause some concerns.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: SuzyQ903
Reviews.Content: staff were very polite and helpful, the room was clean and comfortable,we were on the 17th floor so it was very quiet.The location is good close to everything brilliant places to eat try Oceanas for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL!!!”
Reviews.Author: amigos123
Reviews.Content: They cancelled our reservation the we booked 2 months ahead and did not email or call me to advise me of this! We offered to pay cash right there for our room and they said they were sold out. No appoligies or anything. The Lady and the counter gave us a list of hotels in the area and said "Good Luck!" This was our second attempt at staying at this hotel. We swore never to go back after our first incounter of dirty rooms, and poor and rude custumer service from the front desk! But now I know I will never stay here again!! PS at least we did find a room that night at another local hotel that was definetly a higher class hotel and they totally made up for our misfortune at the H.I. with complimentary tickets to a concert and a free bottle of wine! That is what I call good custumer service!

Reviews.Title: “Home of the Hand Grenade.”
Reviews.Author: t3hnhoj
Reviews.Content: Rooms were nice. Standard Holiday inn room. Windows outside were dirty (seems to be a theme amongst hotels here.. or maybe in general.. idk.. 18 floors up might be hard to wash.) Anyway, didn't bother me. Sheets were clean, no bugs. Bathroom was nice. Shower pressure was good. Housekeeping was kind of slow.. we went out all morning and by the time we came back ready to collapse she was just going into our room.. (so we went out to Tropical Isle with groceries in hand.) We also skipped their restaurant downstairs (even with the whole 10% off coupon we couldn't be lured here due to the terrible reviews on TripAdvisor) Parking is ok.. $26/night.. make sure you get their special card from the front desk otherwise the parking guy/lady will yell at you thinking you're never coming back.. Meh. A/C is kinda noisy but not overwhelming. If you book on Hotwire, they don't let you choose the bed type. We got stuck with 2 full beds instead of a king. First world problems, i guess. I'll have another Hand Grenade please.

Reviews.Title: “HIFQ”
Reviews.Author: imres13
Reviews.Content: Recently had a wonderful stay at the Holiday Inn French Quarter. The reception staff and concierge were incredibly courteous and helpful. The location is unbeatable - walking distance to all sites in the French Quarter, and very short distance to the streetcar stop for the Garden District, etc. The room itself (king suite) was clean and much larger than expected, with a sitting area separate from the bed/bath. Overall for the price, could not have asked for a better room or better service.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation time”
Reviews.Author: Allaine R
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. It had been a while since being in NO so we enjoyed the trip. My husband has a knee problem so we ask for a lower floor and was driven a handicap accommodation.it sure made things a lot better for us. We were able to walk around in the French Quarters and atill be close to the hotel.everything and everyone was great. Nothing negative

Reviews.Title: “KEY LOCATION IN THE FRENCH QUARTER”
Reviews.Author: DomenicV
Reviews.Content: While my room seemed a bit "tired," ( an old tube TV was replaced my second day with a flat screen, and the soap dish in the shower fell off- as the glue was coming apart at the seams). Yet, the room had a second couch and "living room," and was both quiet, and comfortable. (I did not need it, but had I had friends over for a room party, ti would have been great) The staff was VERY FRIENDLY AND HELPFUL (this IS New ORleans after all.) Most importantly, the price was very reasonable, and located on ROYAL STREET- the long stretching block where many locals live. You can shop for paintings or antiques, and it is ONE block from BOURBON STREET- yet you could not hear a sound-and had access to a quick respite to freshen up or power nap, all the while the heart of the city is at your finger tips. Enjoy Canal Street a few yards from the hotel with access to the street cars, and Frenchmen Street a short walk down for terrific jazz.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and very convenient”
Reviews.Author: Darrel T
Reviews.Content: Had none of the negative issues expressed here by others. Room was clean and functional. Staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. Not much of a view but extremely convenient to French Qtr and public transportation (to/from casino, Garden District, etc.) Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I won't be returning”
Reviews.Author: aroman_1986
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights on business. Check-in I found most of the check-in staff to be quite miserable, no friendly welcoming smile, not a good start to your trip. Elevators As I was on the 20th floor, I had to take 2 elevators to get to my room. The first elevator was okay, but the second one was so dodgey I wasn't sure I'd make it through the trip alive. I had a great sense of relief when I stepped off of it. Room When I entered the room I thought it had been broken into - the lamps were so close to the wall that it looked like they'd been knocked, the air con was positioned right under the privacy blinds which made them blow around like crazy as though a window was wide open, not well thought out. The room was dark and depressing, the furniture wasn't well maintained and there was even a door in the room that I don't know where it led to, but it made you feel somewhat vulnerable. All the facilities were there however, and there was some evidence that the room was cleaned regularly, not very well though. Room Service The food comes from the Checkered Parrot restaurant which adjoins the hotel - best avoid it. I ordered a Jambalaya and recieved a sausage gumbo of okay quality. They also said that they cannot bring drinks upto the rooms - seriously? Location As soon as you step outside the hotel, you will find a number of very dodgey looking men stood opposite (outside a closed-down and graffitti-fronted shop), surveying the hotel. These people wait for a vulnerable-looking tourist or businessman, and will approach you and somehow (sometimes quite cleverly) try to get money out of you. I suggest you refuse, because you are constantly harassed by the homeless, drunks and drug users for money, New Orleans is a begging town, and I felt unsafe staying here. Comfort The bed is comfortable, but good luck getting any sleep with the constant noise of music, sirens, tram horns and drunks outside. Even in the corridors, there are swaythes of drunks. Oh, and if you think closing the door will keep the noise out, you are mistaken, because there is a 4" gap underneath every hotel room door so you do not get anywhere near the privacy you would expect in a hotel. Free Wi-fi Don't even bother trying to connect to the free wi-fi, its the slowest internet connection I've ever come across. May as well not be there. Summary This hotel is good for one thing - people who want to come to New Orleans to get drunk, and just want somewhere to sleep. If you are travelling on business, as a family, or want to sleep at night, stay somewhere else! You're probably better off in the Downtown area rather than the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “All that I needed”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler19106
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location on Royal Street, which was all that I needed to enjoy my New Orleans weekend. The hotel is nothing special and does need updating. The Front Desk staff was very friendly and welcoming at check in. Its New Orleans, so all I planned to do in the hotel was sleep. My bed was comfy, the shower was good and the air conditioning was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “It'll do - if you really want to be in the French Quarter...”
Reviews.Author: MazXX
Reviews.Content: Its a room. Not much more. Really not a very clean hotel - the room was OK I guess, but the hallways were horrible. Very strong smell of some kind of air freshener in the room - cloying. Asked for a king and got two doubles and told to suck it up by the front desk... not a really secure felling area... but I suppose that is true of being anywhere in the downtown core of a large city, especially one with a rep for being rowdy LOL. Highlights are its being convenient to the French Quarter... but for the price I think I'd be strongly tempted to stay across the bridge in Slidell if I was visiting the area again, except for maybe a night or too if you really wanted to walk the French Quarter at night. The French Quarter is probably something that you should see at least once just because its there LOL. Shrug. Overall I had more fun touring other areas in the NO area vs. the French Quarter which is really very expensive for what it is. On the plus side, parking was reasonably good and they have a very nice, heated, indoor pool on like the 10th floor. I found it relatively quiet anytime I wanted to use it and to be honest, that was one of the reasons I chose this motel over others in the area. Again, for almost double the price though, a short drive to a MUCH nicer hotel in the Slidell area seems like the way to go for me. Oh, they don't have a safe in room or downstairs, but the staff was friendly enough to give me access to one of their employee lockers which seemed a safer bet than leaving my laptop, passports, etc. in the room. Especially given the area and finding one of the chamber maids boyfriends apparently casing the joint one evening...

Reviews.Title: “No good, Horrible very bad Inn”
Reviews.Author: rbwebb25
Reviews.Content: Hotel should be closed. Management was rude. Changed rooms 3 times due to horrible chemical smells, unkept rooms. No Hot water in my 3rd and final attempt of hauling my luggage down to the lobby and standing in lines. Total disappointment and have shared pics and comments on Facebook. Do all guests shave via coffee pot for hot water??

Reviews.Title: “Close, clean and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Imagesj
Reviews.Content: We had a king room with a love seat sitting area. The room was large and very comfortable. Security was great and had gated parking. ALL staff members had smiles and were eager to help!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: adamchand
Reviews.Content: We stayed there last year also.The hotel was much improved.It was updated a little.The location is perfect.The staff is helpful.There is a coffeemaker in the room.Its in walking distance to the casino.Bourbon street is a block away.The trolley is a block away on canal street.bathrooms are a little small.

Reviews.Title: “Cruise Parking”
Reviews.Author: tnhelen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our cruise. There were 4 families with a total of 15 of us. The hotel was clean and very convenient to the French Quarter. They let us park our car for free for a week. We are definitely staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Has everything you need!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything you need from location to the best staff. We stayed during a weekend and thought it would be noisy but I heard no noise. You could ask for a better staff. Two thumbs up!!!!! You can tell the management cares about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Home base in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: geezluweez
Reviews.Content: This was our second annual stay at the Holiday Inn French Quarter, and will probably continue to be our home base in New Orleans. Great location with nice rooms. The bed was comfy and great. They upgraded us to a little bit larger room than last time. My only beef with this hotel is the slow slow elevators, but it's an older building and you can't fault them for that. A++

Reviews.Title: “Final Four Weekend”
Reviews.Author: terri d
Reviews.Content: Great location for the French Quarter. Nice big rooms and very comfortable bed. We opted for a King room with patio, that's rare in the FQ. Spent two nights during the Final Four weekend so the hotel was full. My only issue was with the elevators. Only three elevators for guest and we had to wait on average 5 to 10 minutes to catch one. Other than that it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but ...”
Reviews.Author: Istvan_101
Reviews.Content: The location just one block south of Bourbon Street is the best. The staff is also very kind but does this help when you're simply checking in? The internet access is very poor: Streaming a youtube video or even an online radio program is impossible as the internet connection breaks up continuously. You get 4 or 5 seconds and have to wait 10 secs again for continuation ... Furthermore you have also the issue that curtains can't be properly closed so sun will shine into your room as soon as it gets up. For a hotel of this price range (it's not cheap after all!!) I would really expect better services. Will not book again :-(

Reviews.Title: “Its a place to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: JimF33
Reviews.Content: If you are going to tool around the French Quarter and the Warehouse district and you need a clean place to crash a few hours a day - this is the place. Its reasonably priced but hasn't been updated in a while. Your better bang for the buck is the sister hotel Staybridge Suites on Poydras.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: PinkSurvivor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel as part of a group - - otherwise, I would not have stayed. I sometimes stay at Holiday Inns - - but they are getting "run down". Location - - walking distance to all of the sights in the French Quarter & near Canal Street. Room - - barely average. Run down, VERY WEIRD window. Had to bend down to look out - STRANGE! We came back to the room & the bathroom still had hair in the bathtub drain & on the floor. Called room service & it was barely cleaned agtain. Yuck!! Breakfast next door not very good. No safe, no refrigerator. VERY overpriced for what it is! You pay to be in the French Quarter!!

Reviews.Title: “Blindsided.”
Reviews.Author: DenverStan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn New Orleans French Quarter in late April 2012. The rooms and hotel did not meet my expectations. The property is tired and worn out. My room had trash behind the furniture, rips in the carpet, wallpaper coming off the wall, no toilet lid, dirty tub and sink and a 110 volt out in the bath that was non functional. I noticed a piece of apple in the corner of the elevator the day I checked in and it was still there 3 days later when I checked out. This property is a cash cow and is always rented so they really don't have to improve it. I should have spent a little extra money to stay at the Weston, Sheraton or the Hilton. Live and learn.

Reviews.Title: “A DUMP”
Reviews.Author: jennifer y
Reviews.Content: A dump! If you have a problem, call corporate, cause the service, and restaurant is garbage! Better off staying in a motel the price is better off spent there! Dirty, rats, roaches, and bed bugs! Old furniture and old box tv's! WHAT A DUMP!!!!!!!:-(

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Lynn R
Reviews.Content: Clean and staff above and beyond. Walked out the door and you were close to everything. Bourbon Street Canal Street. Shopping or catching a trolley to further investigate the city. Would definitely would stay there again just for longer the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good older hotel, good location, good price”
Reviews.Author: Sats67Columbiana
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed one night stay. We were allowed to check in early and the staff was very nice. Parked car for $26 where it stayed during our visit. Convenient location to most attractions including Bourbon Street. Trolleys for $3 a day user pass got us to locations further out. Back to the room. It was clean and comfortable with plenty of hot water and beds were not fancy but were adequate. There was no problem checking out and car could stay til 2 pm without further expense. I could stay again if I go back to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Business Traveler - Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: mschristinedwyer
Reviews.Content: First time visitor to NOLA, I stayed for 4 nights. This is a good place to stay if being near Bourbon St is important; however, as a business traveler, this hotel didn't work out as well as I would have liked. There are 3 elevators but usually only one was working. This led to constant lines of 15 to 25 people after 3pm in the afternoon. The hotel is used for cruise passengers, so the amount of luggage needing to get up the elevators was incredible. Wait for elevator could extend to 15 minutes at times. The onsite gym is small, and only the treadmills were in working order. There is a television in the gym but no remote so you are stuck on ESPN. No onsite restaurant. Daytime desk staff were not friendly at all. On the plus side: Evening desk staff (all males usually) were awesome, as were the bell boys and doormen. The concierge was lovely. As mentioned, the proximity to Bourbon St. make this hotel ideal for folks coming to party, super easy access. The room was adequate and clean. Television channel choices were better than average.

Reviews.Title: “Older but great location”
Reviews.Author: vjmsuma
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at this hotel. Each time it seems older and in poorer shape. The staff is very nice and the location extremely good. That said, I think the next time we head to the Big Easy, we will try a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting hotel, embarrassingly poor service”
Reviews.Author: JJ O
Reviews.Content: This is truly a one star hotel. Old, smelly, stuffy rooms. Extremely poor front desk service with poor attitude to go along with it. The lobby, or lack of lobby, doesn't even have a bathroom. I was sent next door to their restaurant with urine smelling restrooms, disgustingly bad. Across the street is a liquor store with a shady crowd to say the least, even for New Orleans standards, which makes the street feel unsafe. On top of the poor hotel, their system double booked me, and the hotel management literally did nothing to try and help me after explaining there was no way I booked two rooms just for myself, and showing proof of my confirm which showed only one room booked. I was charged for two rooms, with, "that's too bad" being the hotels answer to my problem. To say I would never stay at this hotel again is the understatement of my life, the owner and staff should feel embarrassed to put out such a poor product, and it amazes me it is allowed to carry the Holiday Inn name.

Reviews.Title: “Jazz”
Reviews.Author: jaybee1956
Reviews.Content: My Husband and i visited the French Quarter in the New Orleans and stayed at the Holiday Inn on Royal Street, it is a very nice and clean hotel and the staff are very friendly and helpful. There is lots of things to do and places to see we went on a guided tour and learnt a bit about the area and about the devestation that hurricane Katrina left behind our tour guide "Dee" was lucky to be alive today. The town is buzzing all day and night. A very nice place to go if you like Jazz music which is played in the streets. We had a wonderful evening cruise on the Natchezz. And we visited the swamps to see the Alligators that was great fun.

Reviews.Title: “awesome location”
Reviews.Author: MJTBatemansBay
Reviews.Content: good hotel. Not spotless but clean all the same. So close to Bourbon St, Subway next door and McDonalds across road. Got special rate on Expedia with mystery room. Not dissapointed.$ 28 parking per night but well worth t for the location. Easy walk to night life. Staff at reception could smile a bit more but lady at concierge desk was very helpful when booking tours with her. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping not on the ball!”
Reviews.Author: Mt-Kevin
Reviews.Content: We had to remind housekeeping to take out our trash, make up our bed, give us replacement coffee and pick up soiled towels more than once. The tv changes channels on its own.

Reviews.Title: “Great For the Area”
Reviews.Author: timp3000
Reviews.Content: Staff is attentive and accommodating. Location is excellent, away from the busiest areas of the Quarter, but close enough to walk to everything. There's a convenience store right down the block which is very.... convenient.... My major plus: The ability to self-park on site for on $26, which is one of the cheapest hotel garages I've come across in this neighborhood. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday INN on Royal”
Reviews.Author: jonbr
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Holiday Inn on Royal checked out on New Years Day 2012. We had booked our room using the saty and cruise rate so we had free parking for our entire stay including the 7 nights we were cruising with NCL on the Spirit. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. Our van had a roof top carrier and would not fit in the parking garage so they provided us with parking directly outside the entrance to the hotel under the watchfull eyes of the doormen and staff. (within the entrance to the garage area.) The hotel is located very central to everything, we walked the entire French Quarter several times. A short walk to the Aquarium of the Americas, the Casino, Acme Oyster House... If you are planning on doing any laundry be aware that they only have 2 washers and dryers for the whole hotel... The rooms were clean, slightly dated but if you want to be in the Quarter the hotel is great. The downside was that the pool was out of service during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn on Royal”
Reviews.Author: JoeybagOdonuts
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay at this hotel. Staff is very friendly and helpful especially the doormen/bellman. Room was clean but as is the case in many New Orleans hotels, the bath is small and cramped. This place is a concrete silo built in the 50's or 60's. There are no redeeming architectural characteristics to the hotel or the rooms. It is simply a decent, not great, room in a very good location near both Canal and Bourbon. They have just installed LCD TV's which is a nice touch but does not add much to the room. The biggest issue here is the lengthy wait for elevators. Way, way too long to get up and down. Adding to this is the room key access feature needed to activate the elevator. This property has first generation card keys that become demagnetized if you keep them anywhere near a cell phone or credit cards in your wallet/purse. They then will not work. Ask for a protective sleeve for your room keys and keep them separate from everything else to avoid this really irritating occurrence The in house restaurant, the Checkered Parrot is to be avoided at all costs for dining. Food is horrible, For a quick cocktail it's fine. If you just need a clean, quiet room near the heart of the Quarter this is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nothing fancy.”
Reviews.Author: ShanLando
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel 4/4 & checked out 4/7. It is an an extremely convient location with Canal Street running right behind. There is a restaraunt inside the hotel that I did not check out, a Popeyes and Arby's right around the corner for you fast food folk, and a yummy Brennan family restaraunt around the corner also called "Palace Cafe." I found this hotel to be mediocre. Nothing special about it, nothing worth writing home about. I wouldn't pay more than $100-$120 a night and would only pay that much because of the location. They have cabs available all the time. You can only access the room floors with your hotel key which can be frustrating as my key stopped working several times. For safety, at night you can only get into the lobby with your room key as well. I felt safe here even though I did not venture out at night in the area. There is a convenience store of sorts that was a little iffy right across the lobby for beer, snacks, etc. if needed. The rooms are dated and I was a little miffed with some people who were up until 4:30am laughing, yelling, and overall being obnoxious. I could hear every word they were saying through my door and had to get up to work the next morning. That was really frustrating. You also hear a lot of police sirens and other city noise. Yes, the elevators are super slow, don't be in a rush. They allowed me to check out a little late which was nice. If I got a good deal, I'd stay here again just for the location. Not a place to stay away from, but wouldn't be first on my list.

Reviews.Title: “Busiest Hotel Ever !”
Reviews.Author: FelixNottinghamUK
Reviews.Content: No complaints abour this hotel apart for the fact that it was so busy all the time! The lobby was always really crowded and the lifts packed:it was probaby so busy because it was spring break in the USA.Apart from this the hotel was fine-The room was clean and had two very comfy double beds,the staff were helpful and there was a small indoor swimming pool. The location on beautiful Royal Street was perfect, right in the middle of the the action. You had to go to reception to use the safe deposit box,I would have preferred a safe in the room but the process at reception was fast and efficient.Very good stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect French Quarter location”
Reviews.Author: dobeydoh
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about staying at this hotel after reading some of the reviews, but we had a great stay here. I think some of the things in those negative reviews were just from people that like to complain a lot. Were the elevators slow? Yeah maybe a little, but was it something that made my stay a bad experience, no. Was there a liquor store across the street? No. There was a convenience store across the street, and yeah there were a few homeless people in the area. But guess what, there were homeless people everywhere we went in New Orleans. The staff were very pleasant and yes, we did talk to them other than checking in and out. Checking in and out and getting our parking situated was a breeze. We had a room on the 12th floor. It was average. The bed and pillows were clean and comfortable. There was no fridge or microwave. The bathroom was really small. The housekeeping staff was nice as well. The pool was clean and my kids loved it. They did have to close it one night because one of the lights had detached from the side of the pool. It was fixed the next day. I used Priceline to bid for this hotel and got a good deal. Priceline called it a 3 star hotel. I don't agree with that rating. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average quality”
Reviews.Author: Ville8086
Reviews.Content: Hotel has great location at Royal & Canal/Iberville, just once street east of Bourbon St. Easy access to Canal, Bourbon, Poydras, and ok walk to Superdome, Jackson Square, etc. Hotel was clean but most amenities are dated and worn. No issues with staff, easy check in, parking and check out. Our room on 9th floor had access to 9th floor patio area, could arrange for a group to book rooms all with access to this patio. Was there for peak period, not worth the price but no options when demand is high. Hotel has some odd layout quirks, the 9th floor had steps so it was more like 1/2 floors.

Reviews.Title: “Shuttle Service Emmett Was Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rochelle M
Reviews.Content: We stayed in February. Our experience there was very nice. The lady's at the front desk were very helpful, smiling, and pleasant to work with. We wanted to shuttle downtown, Emmett was our driver, he was very informative and very nice. Emmett came back at night and picked us up. I have to tell you he was the best part of our Holiday Inn stay, Thanks Emmett!

Reviews.Title: “SCARED”
Reviews.Author: DESIZEE
Reviews.Content: I visit this location once 2 years ago but I honestly don't remember it being a bad experience. But I do remember it not being a updated hotel. Location is great. My room was clean and no problems with service. However, I just recently book a room at this location for July, 2012 but that was before seeing the reviews on this site. I am very worried now about my stay. I hope that management keep their word that they have given in the different responses to the terrible experiences past guest have already had. I have another travel to New Orleans Nov. 2012 depending on my experience in July 2012 will determine if i suggest this hotel to family and friends for the event in Nov. 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Melissa G
Reviews.Content: A good spot if you are in town for bachelor party, bachelorette party, celebration weekend....we ran into 20 such groups in the hotel. Meets all necessary requirements without much extra. The staff was decent...could have been more outgoing and personable. Beware of the 'Advance Purchase Rate' you won't be able to drop a room or alter your reservation if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - Great location”
Reviews.Author: ChefLin
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Holiday Inn French Quarter on Royal Street in New Orleans. Keeping in mind that the hotels in New Orleans take a lot of use and abuse, it's not a bad place to stay. The room was clean, though the housekeeping staff tend to try to cut corners, but we pestered them for more towels, cups and soap! They brought it right away without complaint. The bed and pillows were incredible - slept like a baby! The location of this hotel is superb! Located one block from Canal Street, one block from Bourbon Street - three blocks from the River and just a short walk to Jefferson Square. Located in the center of lots of restaurants. Reception was helpful - concierge desk was helpful and reasonably priced. Don't bother eating breakfast at their restaurant. Not worth it. If they have a large party then they only offer the buffet - runny, yet dry eggs, cold potatoes, etc. no automatic coffee refills - booo.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but...”
Reviews.Author: BeachBummin2010
Reviews.Content: We decided to make a family trip out of the wife's trip to the AORN conference. The location is in the middle of the French Quarter with easy access to Bourbon Street and all the sights. We stayed on the 10th floor (which is where the pool is located) and the room size was adequate, but cleanliness left much room for improvement (don't walk around in bare feet or they will turn black). Room had two double beds, but if you want microwave or fridge you need to request these items for an additional daily charge. Check in went without difficulty and the desk staff was pleasant and accomodated our request for a crib (which arrived to the room shortly after we retrieved our bags from the car). T.V. reception went out on more than one occasion and was generally poor (snowy and needed to be upgraded from CRT to flat screen). During our stay we did not hear any noise from the hallway or adjoining rooms, but noise from the street could be heard (sirens and traffic). Would seek other accomodations if we travel to NOLA in the future. Room rate would be acceptable if it wasn't for the additional charges for common ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth Your Money”
Reviews.Author: jeff p
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from March 16-19, we had pre-paid for a room for five people and they said that it would be no problem, that they would get us a rollout bed. However, when we got there, there was no extra bed and the girl at the front desk refused to let us have one unless we paid an extra $20 a night(which we had already paid for). All of the people at the front desk are rude and not helpful at all. The one bright spot for this hotel for us was the woman behind the concierge desk, she was very nice and very helpful. If you can stay at another hotel, dont waste your money at this one..

Reviews.Title: “Rude Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: hdwiii
Reviews.Content: Only stay here if you want to party. I had to stay on the 19th floor, which required you to take 2 elevators just to get to your room, wtf. The whole floor was nothing but a party, but to be expected on spring break. Rooms were ok, Girls working the front desk need a class on professionalism and courtesy, they excel in the rude department. Would never pay full price to stay at this outdated hotel. Business center was a joke, I think the computers were on dial up. Internet connection in the room was the slowest connect I have ever been on.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, Not Great....clean and basic.”
Reviews.Author: pcsanity
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location for one night. We had a two night stay booked at the Crowne Plaza around the corner, but by the time we decided to come in one night early, they did not have any rooms left, so we choose this location to be nearby. The rate was reasonable, and based on the reviews we were not expecting much. The location was easily found by our GPS (other than dealing with the people walking around the streets in the evening having fun) and the hotel is only a half a block around the corner from all the action of Bourbon St. The only parking associated with the hotel is self service at $26. We choose to use a garage about 40 feet down the street for $20 per night with in and out privileges. Check in was speedy, but not particularly warm or welcoming. No mention of my Priority Club Platinum status, which is unusual for IHG brands. They did however allow us 2pm check out when we asked, mentioning Platinum status. There is a very small but acceptably decorated lobby with a small front desk. The hotel does not have their own restaurant on site, but there is one adjoining the hotel, but it got horrible reviews on Yelp, so we did not try it....too many good choices in New Orleans! The common areas were nicely decorated, though the lobby looks out on the parking garage. The hotel has a small but nice indoor pool. They have the smallest, most pathetic excuse for a gym I have ever seen in a Holiday Inn property. It consisted of four pieces of equipment in a small windowed off space next to the pool. Two of the four pieces were broken. Unacceptable on all fronts! The hotel has free internet access for guests, but the speed was so bad that it was nearly useless. There is a very odd setup where you take an elevator to the 18th floor, and then board a second elevator to the 20th floor. If we were there more than a night, I would have asked to change...pretty inconvenient. They do require you to put your room key in the elevator to access the guest floors which is always appreciated. The rooms are typically decorated, comfortable, clean, but a in need of updating. The beds are acceptable, but they had the most pathetic, broken down, small pillows you can imagine. They have large but old style CRT TV's with marginal channels. The climate control works and you can leave the blower motor on for white noise while the climate control is still functioning. The windows on the room kept out the majority of the noise, but as with any city hotel, you could hear some traffic. Room included a work desk (though you could not see the TV from the desk), no microwave, no fridge. Bathrooms are small but have the necessities. Plenty of storage and counter space, but rather dated. Of course this location lends itself to quick and easy access to the street cars, Bourbon Street, the French Quarter, and even Jackson Square. The night time walk from the heart of Bourbon to the hotel was well populated and felt safe. (Of course always watch out in any big city!) The staff was not cordial, but not rude either. When we are back in town, I doubt we would choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: 50swife
Reviews.Content: We had to take this room due to overbooking at the hotel we requested. We parked, then was informed that it was $27.00 a day. The lady at the front desk was very abrupt. The elevators are slow. Our room smells like urine and oranges. The hotel is outdated and not very clean. There was an employee vaccumming the halls, but unfortunately the vaccumm smelled of burning rubber. I was informed that there were vending machines for drinks on each floor. 3 floors that I checked, the vending machines did not work. The tv in the room is old, small, and seemed to have broken speakers. I will be happy to check out of here tomorrow and will never return. For the price that we paid for this room, it would seem they could afford upkeep.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Redleg006
Reviews.Content: We stayed the HDI French QTR over spring break, the staff is nice and the hotel is right in the middle of everything. It is next to the French Quarter, Canal Street, the River Walk, Jackson Square and much more. The hotel is old, the free WIFI is very slow, the rooms are average and the hotel seems safe. We only use our hotels to sleep so we do not put much stock in all the extras because we do not spend much time there. I have no allegiance to any chain, we stay at the best deal. I probably would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently Inconvenient”
Reviews.Author: Nwokc54
Reviews.Content: This Hotel amd its staff are nice, but this Hotel in incredibly inconvenient for the following reasons: -Painfully slow Internet access (albeit free) -Elevators take forever. Being on a higher floor does not help. -crowded lobby at check-in. The wait was about 20 minutes In the end, the staff is nice and location is great. But it's a slow hotel in general.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had gone to another hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Beafmaster
Reviews.Content: Came for the rock n' roll marathon. From the first day I had trouble with the magnetic key. Has not allowed me to access the elevator or room. Have had to exchange keys about half a dozen times. Wish I could go to another hotel but all others are booked. I am still here at the moment. The front staff has been unpleasant to deal with everytime I have had to exchange keys. The only reasonable front desk person is Curtis. Several people who are also staying here have complained about the same thing and stating they wished they had never stayed here. My sentiments exactly.

Reviews.Title: “Not Professional”
Reviews.Author: cookieladyANP
Reviews.Content: I agree the front desk personnel were unprofessional. They said they would split my payment then said there's no way they would've said it- and did the same to the person splitting the room with me. No matter what I asked it seemed to be an annoyance, and using "ma'am" doesn't make it polite if you're clearly ticked off. I was also offended no one could hold the door open while I was trying to get heavy luggage out to a shuttle. Noise in the halls woke me up every night.

Reviews.Title: “Mardi Gras 2012”
Reviews.Author: Marti C
Reviews.Content: Arrived to hotel at 5pm check in, instead of the 3pm time-room was still not ready for us; we had to wait while a room was cleaned for us. Unable to get to the hotel to park on site because roads were closed for parade routes-parked 5 blocks away in a parking garage and walked to hotel while carrying our overnight belongings; hotel attempted to automatically charge at check in and check out for parking garage; arrived home and found they had automatically charged my credit card for the on site parking even though they had been told twice we were unable to park on site. Full Breakfast was to have been included for (2) in room- only allowed $20.00 credit per room and each breakfast cost exactly $20.00 which included an automatic 18% gratuity-no menu items available other than buffet. Automatically deactivated our room keys so that after breakfast we were unable to get back into our room-made 5 trips to the office before getting room keys which actually worked- our room was on the 15th floor and we had to use the very slow elevator. Messing with the room keys caused us to miss the meet up with pals for a good seat viewing the ZULU parade. Concierge Service was NO HELP what so ever and excused our complaints away with "we are opperating at 100% capacity this weekend". The message we received was that this hotel can not function effectively if all their rooms are booked.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck! Great location but old and dirty.”
Reviews.Author: cybrjunkii
Reviews.Content: We paid 230 for this hotel on a saturday night. It was a great location but for the price the hotel was a dump. The door on the bathroom wouldn't even shut completely. If I had paid 90 bucks it would have been fine but for the price it sooooo wasn't worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: NJ_business_traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just skeevy. There was visible dirt (that I could move with my toe, i.e. not a stain) in the elevator lobby of my floor the whole time I was there. Even worse - there was a room service tray left in a hallway that was not moved for the entire duration of my stay (two nights). It was the same tray ... I watched the cole slaw left on the plate turn from limp to dessicated. (shudder) One day, housekeeping left a bag of trash in the elevator lobby the whole day. Disgusting! There were no "real" pillows on the bed - only some small square pillows, which were lumpy & uncomfortable. The bathroom smelled of mildew, and there were grey mildew stains on one of the towels. Everything was old, smelly, run-down. When I went to breakfast one morning, the only staff there were the bus boy & cook. They were wonderful & helpful, but much aggrieved that the hostess & wait staff had not arrived. The hostess arrived in time to give me my check ... which included an 18% gratuity (for service I never received!!!!). It was only a couple bucks so not worth making a big stink about, but it really left a sour taste in my mouth. I ate another meal there and no gratuity was added, so it is clear that this is a choice the waiter can make. Overall, it was shockingly awful. I am not one to write negative reviews in general, but this hotel was just so incredibly bad that I felt compelled to come here & warn others.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, old hotel, few amenities”
Reviews.Author: lynford100
Reviews.Content: The location of the Holiday Inn French Quarter is great, on Royal St., not too noisy but close to everything. It is clean but old, with a moldy smell in the hallways. Staff is uneven in terms of friendliness and service. No business center, so you can't print out your boarding pass before flying out. Internet directions for wireless confusing -- a "pay" site pops up, but don't do that, internet is actually free once you find the right site. With all of the choices in New Orleans, this wouldn't be my first choice, especially since I paid over $200 per night. The restaurant, the Checkered Parrot, is awful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Niquolle330
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn in the French Quarter is on the corner of Royal (one block off of Bourbon Street) and Canal, so it was an excellent place to start our Quarter viewing, as well as a great location to catch the parades that came down Canal. We got an awesome rate on our room, even during Carnival season, so I was happy with that. Our rooms were clean even during Mardi Gras. Very helpful bellmen that stored our bags when we were catching a later flight out on our last day, and even walked with us to the closest corner where we could catch a cab due to the road that was shut down due to the parades. Overall, it's a decent place to stay if you are not going to expect luxury and just want a great location to explore the Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “never again!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cantbelieveit
Reviews.Content: Firstly we arrived around noon, understandly checkin isn't until 4, I called hotel directly and asked lady who answered the phone if we could get a early check in. She quickly offered it to me (kinda in a hurry) unsure if she was rushing me off the phone or if hotel prehaps already had clean rooms. Well when we arrived Schandra (i think) Quickly, abruptly and very rudely told me there were no rooms available and quoted the hotel policy to me. she stated we dont gaurantee rooms until after 4 pm, she then put her head down and finish doing paperwork.... a young bellman walked over to us and asked if we needed to store our bags....very nice tall young fella! When we arrived back, room was ready. we were checkin by another lady who was not as bad as first desk clerk, but sounded like a robot when describing what hotel offered. My husband said he went down to the concierge's desk to book our tour for the next morning and there it was he saw all he needed to see, frontdesk agents dancing and talking very loud about what they did on last evenningt!! I'm sure my husband and I will NEVER stay here again! Oh we did love the indoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: southerncomforts
Reviews.Content: We stayed through Mardi Gras at this hotel.We were fortunate to have an end room, so were not wakened by those that came in later than we did. Was nice having a restaurant serving breakfast, lunch, and dinner on site, though we normally opted for other restaurants that were all in walking distance. Did not park at hotel, but was told daily parking rate was high. Very courteous, helpful bellmen that will store your luggage if you arrive early and room not ready.

Reviews.Title: “a decent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chaddydaddy01
Reviews.Content: decent motel. it was off the main drag. it is a great location. short walk to canal as well as bourbon. parking is expensive here, however, it is everywhere, downtown. i only used the motel to sleep in. so, wasnt sure of the hotel services. i did hear of another guest that experienced bed bugs. however, i personally was not affected and i know that many places are affected by these. the time of year i went, i would probably pick a different motel.

Reviews.Title: “Location - doesn't make up for HORRIBLE service”
Reviews.Author: sabramh
Reviews.Content: I read others reviews and booked this hotel anyway, because I was hoping things had gotten better. Our room hadn't been fully cleaned and stocked when we arrived. We had to ask 5 times to get sheets for the bed. The next day, it wasn't cleaned at all, even though we talked with management to make sure it would get cleaned. We overheard staff talking in the hallways about the jobs they were NOT going to do. We talked with one of the maids and learned that the hotel continually and intentionally understaffed. That translates to laundry not getting done and rooms only getting cleaned when you check out.

Reviews.Title: “You can find a better value!”
Reviews.Author: Christine Q
Reviews.Content: My group of friends has been traveling to New Orleans every February for the past 4 years and always stays at the Holiday Inn on Royal St. This year was by far our worst experience with this hotel. My friend called and booked 4 rooms, which were put on "hold" for us. We were told that the card would not be charged and that we would be able to pay in cash upon arrival. The hotel ran the card anyway, spelling my friends name wrong, so the card was declined. They cancelled our rooms and never notified us. When we called two days prior to arrival, to cancel one of the rooms, they told us it was too late to cancel it, but still did not say anything about us not even having a room in the first place. The second time we called to ask about early check in, and that is when my friend was notified that we didn't even have any rooms booked. Eventually that issue was resolved. We requested a handicap room, they gave us a regular room and wouldn't give us a cot because it was a fire hazard. You can have cots in handicap rooms because the rooms are bigger, and we knew this which is why we asked for one. On our second morning I was blow drying my hair and the outlet started to spark and have flames coming out from behind the outlet faceplate. I quickly unplugged the hair dryer and got burned. The hotel handled in all the wrong ways. They kicked us out of our room for hours until an electrician could come fix the outlet. Originally they told us that they couldn't get an electrician until Monday and that the hotel was booked so they were trying to figure out what to do with us.
