They wouldn't compensate us for anything because they didn't view the situation as an inconvenience and would only speak to my friend since the credit card was in her name under our room, even though I was listed on the room, made the initial complaint, and was the one that got burned. I was told by a friend that is a manager at a different Holiday Inn that I should contact guest relations and then the hotel is forced to address the issue and will be under review, This way they will question the manager since our complaint is legit and our issues should be resolved. We have the incident on video, but tripadvisor only allows photos. I felt that the rooms were clean when we arrived, but housekeeping didn't keep them clean as other hotels do. There was no outlet in the bathroom. Housekeeping kept leaving us with only two towels even though 4 guests were registered in the room and they didn't restock the toilet paper, we had to ask for it. The blankets were super thin and the pillows were really small. I'm really upset with how the manager handled our fire hazard situation, was unsympathetic, unhelpful and rude. We will be choosing a different hotel next year. There are plenty hotels with a good value and good location to choose from in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy, but adequate”
Reviews.Author: paulantx
Reviews.Content: The location was great. Their restaurant, The Checkered Parrot was ok. We had the breakfast buffett each morning and they make some great mixed drinks. After a parade on Sat. night we walked over for dinner and they said they were closed...40 minutes early. This was annoying as we had gathered a large group to dine with us and had to find elsewhere to take everyone. They offered a govt rate which gave us the free breakfast and free parking which is an amazing deal in New Orleans. Our room was on the 19th floor, which meant we had to take 2 elevators to get there, the first one stopped at 18. You had to use a room key to use the elevator which made us feel safer. The room was clean but during a heavy rain we used multiple towels to stop water rushing in our window....odd for being on the 19th floor. They had bath and body brand products which I enjoyed. The employees were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, smelly room”
Reviews.Author: Alice207
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other reviewers. Can't beat the location. But the room really did smell. The hallway outside the room reeked of cleaner and some other strange moldy smell (which the cleansing solution was trying to mask). The bathroom could be cleaner, no bath plug, and don't look down that drain! Very annoying if your room is above the 18th floor - you have to exit at the 18th floor and take another elevator. Pillows are incredibly small - half those of normal pillows. The service was very friendly however. If only the hallway and room did not have that smell... Overall, given a choice, I would not come back here - there are plenty of other hotels just as conveniently located, less expensive and cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; very dirty room.”
Reviews.Author: Gradowitz
Reviews.Content: Hair in the bed, ( dont think they change the sheets) hair on the leftover soap, last tenants half used shampoo bottle still there, no bathtub plug, filthy brownish- black grunge along side of toilet tank. Housekeeping room was filthy. Positives: no bed bugs, location, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good location...”
Reviews.Author: thedukea1
Reviews.Content: Great location for the price. You can walk to everywhere from here. The start of Bourbon Street is like a 3-5 minute walk and Acme Oyster House is literally right around the corner. The evening/night shift front desk staff were really great. Also the parking garage felt pretty safe The room itself wasn't anything great. We had the headboard come off the wall and crash onto the bed. The pillows were the smallest i have ever seen in a hotel. The couch had holes in it but I don't think we ever sat on it, just used it to store luggage. Expect to hear every noise on the floor and outside the hotel as well. The constant slamming of doors and drunks yelling in the hallways and then the drunks yelling and screaming outside (can't blame the hotel for that) did make it a little tough to sleep. And we also ran into the same issue that so many others seemed to have, no maid services for the first two days of our five day trip. If you can put up with a little noise and spotty maid service, you really can't beat the location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location.”
Reviews.Author: Oracle125
Reviews.Content: Great spot to stay just because of the location. Every thing is just a short walk away. It could use an update.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: jessica4022
Reviews.Content: First off the rooms smelled awful, like feet and smoke. There wasn't even a refridgerator in the rooms, which for $179.00 a night you would think they would have one. The manager was very rude and errogant when we inquired with him about our friends truck fitting in the parking job, he treated my friend like he was an idiot. Also we paid for parking when we checked in ($27 a day for 2 vehicles for 2 nights) but when we went to leave the very rude lady at the gate told us it showed we only paid for 1 vehicle for 2 nights. So my friend paid for his vehicle assuming that his friends vehicle would not have to pay to get out because she said that only "one" vehicle had been paid for. But after we pulled thought she stopped our friends vehicle behind us and sure enough made him pay to leave too. Thats and EXTRA $108 that was paid because we paid for it when we checked in and then had to pay for it to get out of the hotel parking garage. To tope everything off when we recieved our bill for our hotel room there was a charge for $39.00 for a movie. We went down to the front desk and asked the clerk to remove it because we did not watch an movies and she stated she would have to investigate and make sure we didn't watch the movie for more than 30 mins or she could not remove if from the bill. Sure enough it stated we watched a adult movie package from 2:42 a.m. until 4 a.m. which we did not do. Our TV wasn't even on at those times and everyone in the room was sleeping. Had we ordered the movie and watched it we gladly would have paid for it but to know that we were sleeping and the tv wasn't even on really upset me. Of course the woman at the front desk looked at us like we were just lying to watch a free porn but I assure you we didn't even have the tv on much less watching it for over a hour. So lets tally this up $108.00 that we paid at check in had to be paid again when we left and then $39 for a movie that wasn't even watched is $147.00 that hotel got us for and it wasn't even worth it. Also the elevators were so messed up at check out that we were trying to go from the 12th floor to the 5th floor and it took us all the way to the 6th floor and then took us UP to the 18th floor and made about 5 stops before we got to the 5th floor. Was so frusturating! We will not stay there again and I wouldn't recommend anyone else either!

Reviews.Title: “leisure trip”
Reviews.Author: cdntraveller12003
Reviews.Content: location location location. Walking distance to French Market Cafe Du Monde and of course Bourbon St right out your door. Lots of restaurants close by. Room was average but view of canal was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: WithSmith
Reviews.Content: There is nothing fancy about this hotel, it's what you would expect from a Holiday Inn. Where they excel though is in the customer service department. From the very friendly and informative concierge to the maintenance man who went out of his way to show us where the nicer restrooms were (other than the ones located in the restaurant off the lobby). Every staff member we encountered was friendly and helpful. The two times we called the front desk for something it was delivered with a smile to our room in minutes. Excellent location right off Canal street and one block from Bourbon.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet N Sour”
Reviews.Author: Mayaelena
Reviews.Content: Recommended by a co worker, this became the only hotel we would stay at as the price can not be matched for the location and convenience. On the corner of Royal and Canal, you are in the Quarter. You can catch the trolley at the intersection. Walk across the intersection into the Garden District or walk up Canal to the business district where you'll find Aquarium of the Americas and Harrah's Casino with numerous locale to shop and eat on the way. The room are adequate--the bells and whistles but reasonably clean. Just how much time does one spend in their hotel room while in New Orleans, anyway? HOWEVER, when we booked for our most previous vacation to NOLA, an unexpected conflict arose and the hotel refused to issue a refund OR a credit. Upon contacting the Holiday Inn Corp we were told the individual Holiday Inn where you booked decided whether or not to refund or credit your paid reservation. We ended up losing our money. This has soured our relationship with this hotel and will not stay there again. Moral of the story--if you book with them, you had better hope nothing else arises or you could end up eating your money because this establishment nor The Holiday Inn corp will help you out.

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable for a chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: SarahVier81
Reviews.Content: Balcony rooms are WORTH the price. If you don't plan on spending much time in your free, completely recommend based on the location. Rooms are very clean and decent. The pool and downstairs dining area are welcoming for families. If looking for a place to go crazy, Bourbon Street style...look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Some issues, but great for the price”
Reviews.Author: RW_Adair
Reviews.Content: I was in New Orleans overnight on business. Every other hotel along Canal Street wanted anywhere from $40 - $100 more per night, so I decided to give the Holiday Inn French Quarter a shot. It's a bit difficult getting into thanks to the one-way streets in that part of town, especially at night (you have to go one block down Bourbon Street). Once I arrived, the front desk staff was very friendly and attentive. I encountered an issue when the clerk told me I had a double even though I had a confirmation for a king. He said they didn't have any king rooms available. Since it was only one night, I didn't really complain. The room was very clean. The furnishings were pretty average, but I wasn't in the room that much. I didn't like the small, square pillows on the beds (particularly when I was sleeping). The other issue arose early the next morning. With my window facing east, I quickly discovered that the curtains lacked completely closing by about an inch. The sunlight between 6:00 - 7:00 a.m. made me regret choosing to sleep on the bed closest to the window. They did allow a 2:00 p.m. checkout for their rewards program members, which was great because my business in town was late that afternoon (their posted checkout time is 11:00 a.m.). Given the short trip and the rates being charged at the other hotels in the area, I was pleased with my stay. If you're looking to see the French Quarter, and particularly Bourbon Street (one block away), this would be a great place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap for the location, horrible sleep.”
Reviews.Author: dutchdob
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and we even got a free upgrade. Front desk staff was helpful and friendly. We are late sleepers so we put our do not disturb out, then later that around 1 we take it out as we are leaving. When we came back later, there was a do not disturb in the key thing. Guess they didn't feel like cleaning that day. Granted this was two days after the huge BCS bowl game, I'm guessing their staff was tired. After that I left the do not disturb out the rest of our stay, so they didn't get to clean our room at all not that I cared that much. Okay then there was the issue with the slamming doors. Sleeping was hard for me and my girlfriend because the doors are on the same wall as your headboard. As you were sleeping there was a constant "SLAM! then it would be quiet and you would almost be to sleep someone else on your floor would leave then SLAM! Sometimes the bed would even jar a little bit.(not even exaggerating) Between the guests coming and going and the housekeepers the SLAMMING of the doors was constant between 8am and 11 pm. There were several great restaurants, a chinese massage, and a good liquor store, and a walgreens within a stones throw. Free USA today at your door every morning. Checkout was easier than any hotel I've ever been to. The volume on our TV didn't work and it kept shutting off. Room 1232. The trolley is close to but if your going to Jackson Square or riverfront its probably faster to walk. It really was the best price for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Hey it's got location”
Reviews.Author: KGHofSF
Reviews.Content: Right there on Royal st, less than 2 blocks from the Canal St & St Charles St Street Cars. All of the Quarter Sites within walking distance. Even the Quarters cheapest liquor store (Cash only with plenty of thirsty individuals right out front) is right across the street. Of course this great location comes with the price that you're in a bit of a run-down hotel. The whole place could use an updating. Still the price is OK. As long as you're not too picky. . .

Reviews.Title: “Quality stay”
Reviews.Author: Tina T
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews here, I will admit, I was a little nervous about my hotel choice. This hotel was wonderful. GREAT location. My friends appreciated the secure parking. All the staff were so nice and helpful. Check in was a breeze. My friend and I arrived way before check in. Our room was ready for us! I was so happy. The rooms are clean. We were up at the very top and the only "noise" we heard were sirens and even they weren't loud. LOVED that it was just a block from Bourbon. Easy location to catch the St. Charles Streetcar as well. Really enjoyed our time here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Parking and Cruise location”
Reviews.Author: ARTravelmamma
Reviews.Content: We had a 7-day cruise booked 12/31/11. I had read online that you could book a room for one night and parking package at a local hotel. I found Holiday Inn French Quarter. We paid only $119 (12/30) and the parking, secure in an inclosed garage, was included for 8-days. The location right on the French Quarter attracted me because then we could walk where ever we wanted to go. The hotel was in the middle of everything. The parking was sold out due to New Years Eve (town was crazy busy). But because of our package they made sure we got a spot. The hotel is clean, the rooms very basic, nothing fancy. The staff was friendly. All in all I would highly recommend the stay and park plan plan.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laurenrt8548
Reviews.Content: This is a dirty hotel. I travel alot and have never stayed in such a dirty hotel. We will not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I was gonna rant...”
Reviews.Author: Jorge V
Reviews.Content: But Scott D, a few reviews down, wrote everything I wanted to complain about. It could be a coincidence, but everything that happened to him, happened to our family over the Christmas break. Poor service and only worth it for the excellent location

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel”
Reviews.Author: susan m
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during mardi gras last year. Beware the hotel is filthy. The staff and management are not helpfull and just rude.We stopped by the floor the pool was on and someone had puked all over the floor. It stayed that way for 2 days.......... We were definitly bitten by something which we saw crawling on the bathroom floor.The rugs stuck to the bottom of your feet so sticky yuk .If you have already paid to stay here and can't get a refund.Do not walk in your bare feet.This was our first Mardi Gras and because of this awfull hotel it was ruined.We travel alot and have been to many countries this was the worst expierance we have ever had.there are alot of nice hotels in this area do not stay here or you will regret it................

Reviews.Title: “Be ready for chaos at checkin, but save $$$”
Reviews.Author: Organs
Reviews.Content: We had read reviews so were quite relaxed when our "rooms were not ready for 30 minutes". In fact we were quite relaxed when we hadn't heard from them for 3 hours! We started getting a little concerned after 4 hours, but finally our room was ready (at about 8pm) Booking online gave us $30 off the phone reservation price and the swamp tour for an extra $5 per night saved us $94 off that. The rooms were clean and relaxing. Pity the salt pool wasn't working. And we enjoyed watching the chaos on our second night as we watched new guests queuing up, trying to checkin. Hint: Stay 2 or more nights!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a brief stay”
Reviews.Author: travel0ne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel recently as part of a â€œpark and cruiseâ€� package out of New Orleans. The best thing this hotel has going for it was itâ€™s location. It is mere steps away from all of the nightlife, restaurants, shops, etc. Yes, there is a convenience store across the street where some people hang out, but if that bothers you too much New Orleans French Quarter may not be a place for you anyway. The entire area can be scary if you are not prepared for it! The garage and the hotel guest area share an elevator. The first 7ish floors are for the garage, from there up are guest rooms. The hotel has interior corridors that had seen some wear and tear, but seemed to be kept clean. The lobby was tiny and nothing special. It was modern and well kept. The front desk staff was friendly when I arrived. They were quite busy so didnâ€™t make much small talk. But they were efficient. Our group had two rooms, both with 2 double beds, both at same price. However, one room was much bigger than the other simply because of the design on the building. Ask for the larger room if you are able. They were all clean, and the bathroom was big enough for any average person. Had the curved shower curtain rod and some counter space. I would recommend this hotel if you get a good price for a brief stay (1-2 nights). Longer than that and you may want something a bit more plush. Again, the location is what makes this hotel a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: TubesPendle
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were freindly & helpful & the hotel was in an excellent location just afew minutes away from Bourbon Street but far enough away for a peaceful nights sleep. The room was very clean had two beds with choice of soft or hard pillow , small TV , coffee maker, iron & board, hair dryer and a bath & shower,the hotel also had fee wi fi. There were lots of places to visit within walking distance & plenty of trips out you could book.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Juli143
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel randomly for a week long trip to New Orleans over the Sugar Bowl/New Years week. We chose it because it was listed as "near the French Quarter" and the price seemed reasonable. We were so happy when we checked in and realized we were right around the corner from Bourbon Street! The staff was SO friendly. We were upgraded at check in without even asking. The doormen were always very friendly and chatty, just flirty enough to make us laugh. The room we got was like a mini suite. It was beautiful and very comfortable and clean. It was a little noisy at times, which I suppose is to be expected when staying in the French Quarter. The only thing we didn't love was the hotel retaurant/bar. It was kind of run down and had a strange odor. We never ate there, so I can't tell you if the food was any good. When we go back to NOLA (and we will!) I would be very happy to stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Susan H
Reviews.Content: Location: This hotel is located in an excellent location within the French Quarter - just one block off Bourbon Street. This makes it very easy to get home after a night out. Even though Bourbon St is a little seedy (but still heaps of fun), Royal Street is lovely. The hotel is a short walk away from Cafe Beignet, a cute cafe which does descent coffee. Service: Was good. The staff were funny and helpful. Cleanliness: The lobby area always smelt nice. The room and bathroom were clean - we had no issues. Some of the reviews mention the sketchy looking people hanging out near the front - this may be because there is a bottle shop across the road. We had no problems with this - we felt safe most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but amenities can be improved”
Reviews.Author: Kcheu
Reviews.Content: We love the convenient location: in FQ, next to Canal St, across the street to St Charles St car, next door is Walgreens, 3 blocks from Police Dept where there is a Cafe Beignet which serves good coffee and breakfast. What needs to be improved are: 1: no safe deposit box in room; 2. No flat screen TV in room; 3. No business center...the desktops for internet access have screens facing elevator doors 6 ft away...no privacy

Reviews.Title: “Very average and nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: GinaM95531
Reviews.Content: We booked here to be near other family members prior to a Cruise. For the money paid, the hotel was not worth the rate, unless all you care about was how close it is to Bourbon street. The one street was intimidating with the people hanging out there at all hours. Good thing there was a Subway Sandwich shop close to it as I did not want to travel out at night to anywhere else from that location. Other than saying that, the stay was just okay and the property very average. It helped to have a food voucher for breakfast, even though the service was very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Bananaman3m
Reviews.Content: My family and I just completed a four day weekend at this hotel, and were very pleased with the customer service and friendliness. You could not do better for location. The good news was we were one block off Bourbon St., and the better news was we were one block off Bourbon St. It was great to walk out the front door, and be half a block away from some of the best seafood on earth. The only complaint I have with the hotel was related to Housekeeping. Don't get me wrong, the rooms were clean, but there were other issues. When we arrived, one of the rooms Housekeeping had told the front desk was ready, was not even started. Curtis (Great Guy) on the front desk could not have been more apologetic, and was happy to bump me up a room grade. The second issue related to the broken toilet seat and the toilet paper roll that was so loose, the roll fell off when ever you used it. Both of these were touch points for the housekeeping staff. Why did they keep it a secret? When I reported it to the front desk, before I got out the door, I heard them call in the work order to repair both items. They were done when I returned an hour later. The rest of the stay was perfect. Great people, very nice hotel for the price, and like I said, what a great location. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff, value”
Reviews.Author: Iamwherenow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a girls' getaway weekend. It's what you'd expect from a three star hotel - basic value for money accomodations. The staff was always polite and helpful, especially the concierge Broderick who gave us five star service.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel because of Location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Fjeldbar
Reviews.Content: Run down Holiday Inn in the French Quarter. Not great appearance, rooms are very spartan, lucky to get a bottle of shampoo in the bathroom. Room was clean, but the pillows on the bed were the size of the old airplane pillows. I stay at many Holiday Inns, and have stayed at 4 in New Orleans. Would not stay unless you get a fabulous deal and are very budget minded. Even with a/c on all the time, rooms are stuffy and everything is damp. The windows are tiny and there are no fans in Bath, so you have to live with humidity.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty”
Reviews.Author: Tinkerbellde
Reviews.Content: I read the great reviews and wonder where everyone is staying because it is not here. Parking its bad. Check in was courtesy went down hill after that. Elevator smells like pee. Room makes me think I will have bugs in my suitcase. Smells like mold and vents need cleaning for the air conditioner. Bed makes me want to put a hazard suit on and for the first time I feel unsafe in a hotel. If ask you want is a close hotel that is near all the bars and your not choosy this dump is for you. The rif raf that was here made me cut my vacation short. DUMP NASTY

Reviews.Title: “Close to the action - convenient”
Reviews.Author: sowestsue
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn has a great staff with fast check in and friendly customer service. The location is perfect for pre and post cruise people - many choices for dining. Beds are very comfortable. They could pay more attention to cleanliness and a potential hazard is the bathroom tile floors. I don't know if they wax them or what, but two of our four party slipped and fell on those floors. Someone is going to hurt themself badly eventually. Otherwise the service was great

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, great location, needs updating.”
Reviews.Author: akrohn
Reviews.Content: We found this on Expedia by booking it and were not able to see the name until we paid. We were pleased that it ended up being the Holiday Inn as my husband had stayed there before. Location cannot be beat! It's right in the French Quarter and close to everything, so that was great. We didn't have a car due to the great location, but it seemed the valet service was always prompt and working efficiently. We liked that it was close to attractions, places to eat, and anything you wanted to do on Riverwalk. Staff was great--always friendly when we asked questions at the front desk, and the concierge was friendly and very knowledgeable. Room decor was pretty dated so it could use updating in that respect. Shower drained pretty slow on the first night, but I think the cleaning staff realized that when they cleaned it the next morning as it seemed better the next day. Shampoo/lotion soap were the only amenities that were in the room, and they weren't consistently replenished. First night we were there the bathroom wasn't cleaned at all once we came back from being out for the day. Room size was good overall--plenty of room to move around so we were pleased with that aspect of it. We would stay here again for location and price and overlook the few downsides we found. We were on the 14th floor and every time we got off the elevator, there was a musty/bleachy smell that was very unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, good service, great location”
Reviews.Author: nycpearl
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed here for a dance event in early October. We have all been to New Orleans before and were amazed at how close this hotel is to everything in the French Quarter . It is walking distance from wonderful restaurants like Green Goddess, House of Blues, and from the Louisiana Music Factory. I was the first to arrive and checked us into our room. It was clean except for a musty smelling shower curtain, which was replaced 5 minutes after I picked up the phone and called the front desk to let them know. Cleaning staff also re-cleaned the tub and floor just to make sure that the problem was resolved. I thought the front desk and cleaning staff were pleasant and friendly, and was very happy that they immediately resolved the shower curtain issue. This hotel is a very good value for New Orleans and for the location, we'd all stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay all the time for business”
Reviews.Author: fijidaniel
Reviews.Content: I stay here all the time for business. I like to mix a little pleasure in there and eat and drink on Bourbon Street. This hotel is great because of location, cost, and the parking. I have a rental car as I work all around the surrounding area and this hotel has the best in and out service. No long waiting on valet. The downside is that there are only 3 elevators and check in/out can take some time.

Reviews.Title: “First Time to New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: ClydeKnits
Reviews.Content: We were here for a wedding. The location was great. Right off Canal St where you have easy access to trolleys, restaurants, coffee shops. Right off Bourbon but not so close that it could be loud (though one family member's room was picking up loud street music & noise in the early AM hours - but we didn't hear any.) We could walk to the Aquarium, River Boat, etc really easy. Room was not the cleanest I've been in but not the worst either. The linens, towels and bath were clean but the rugs were quickly swept with a broom not vacuumed and it was pretty dusty all around the walls. Our room was pretty small too. The TVs are the older fat ones. I mean for $140@ nite (and that was a special rate) I'd expect a bit better. The staff was very friendly and helpful. So you're really paying for above average location in a fair to average accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Arvrim
Reviews.Content: I was at the Holiday Inn French Quarter in December 2010. The hotel is located on Royal Street in a walking distance of all bars and restaurants in the French Quarter and just a block from Bourbon Street. The entire staff is very kind, the rooms are satisfactory for the value and the hotel has a pool and on site parking (paid) as differentials. At night the streets of new orleans you can find homeless asking for money, but just keep walking no problems. The police of New Orleans is always present. No doubt I will return to this hotel when I return to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room”
Reviews.Author: twopuffins
Reviews.Content: The staff is extremely friendly; we never entered the hotel without being greeted with a smile & a pleasant hello. The location is excellent. We only moved our car once while we were in town. We were able to walk to the riverfront, the French Market & even the WWII museum. (We also walked to Mardi Gras World, but that one was a bit of a haul!) Only criticisms I have are minor: there was a rubber piece at the bottom of our air conditioning unit that was hanging down & didn't look that appealing, our door was very loose in its jamb & let a lot of light in at night (although it did lock securely), it would be nice if there was more than one trashcan in the room (king deluxe, which is kind of a mini-suite), & for the price we paid per night, I think breakfast should have been included. The bright side of that is that we ate at Cafe du Monde two mornings, & I bought a box of Pop Tarts at the Walgreens on the corner for the rest!

Reviews.Title: “All about the location....”
Reviews.Author: Jim M
Reviews.Content: Very basic accommodations but if you are in New Orleans for the action on Bourbon Street you can't beat the location - a block and a half walk puts you right in the middle of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly”
Reviews.Author: Ejln123
Reviews.Content: Had a great time, other attractions were the Louisiana State Museum, Superdome, Hurricane Katrina Museum, and Steamboat Natchez

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what it could be...”
Reviews.Author: GlassBrk1
Reviews.Content: Stayed last week for two nights and the location was excellent. The staff was friendly and helpful... extra kudos for the Elijah, our bellman, he was full of info and gave great restaurant tips! The rates were reasonable for the area but the hotel is in serious need of updating... and the pillows, don't get me started. Suggest you get the highest floor available even though elevator wait can be a factor at times. We were surprised that there were no safes in the rooms and the wait for deposit boxes at the front desk is cumbersome at best. All in all though the staff and location sufficiently "mutes" the negatives enough to get you through a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Mardi Gras”
Reviews.Author: Mango4610
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in March 2011 for two nights as we wanted to experience Mardi Gras and Bourbon Street. The location for this hotel is excellent as we were walking distance to Bourbon Street and near the major parade route. We could see the parade from our hotel window. The service was very good and the people at the reception area were helpful as they directed us to many great restaurants and local attractions. The hotel is clean and with no bells and whistle but for the price and location we were quite pleased. It was quite nice to experience Bourbon Street and then just walk back to the hotel.The price was quite reasonable and we would certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “First time to New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: travelqueenorking
Reviews.Content: Great location of this hotel, but not real impressed with it. When we first checked in we were told that we had to be out on our day of check out at 8:00AM...we were like seriously? We are in New Orleans and there is no way we are going to be out of the hotel at 8:00AM....They were nice enough to put us up in their sister hotel which was right down the street...but what was concerning was that they did not offer that until we asked...It was clean and we were close to everything so it was an ok stay but I will be honest and say that their sister Hotel which was also a Holiday Inn 2 blocks up was much nicer and more convenient. All in all it was an ok hotel but not the best place we have ever stayed...

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: pair211
Reviews.Content: Was in New Orleans for a conference and decided to stay here as it was much cheaper than the conference hotel but close by, two blocks up Canal street, really handy. The position of the hotel was ideal just on Royal street & one block over from Bourdon street so you can't get much better than that. Was on the top floor of the hotel so had to take two lifts to reach my room so a bit of a pain. If you are 18 or lower you are fine just one lift ride, on 19 and 20 too steps by lift or a walk up the stairs. The lifts were rather slow and there are only three for the whole building! Itâ€™s OK most of the time but not at check in, or out or breakfast as you can wait a looooong time for one then especially if a bus of tourist arrives! The room was clean and the bed comfortable to sleep on, but the air conditioning was noisy so ended up with it off at night so I could sleep, In September that's OK but in July and August it might just be tooo hot for that!! The decor in the corridor areas was rather dire cream walls (fine), but brown doors and yellow/brown carpet, see the picture not too my taste at all! Had free internet access as part of the rate the only problem was that the wireless signal in my room was TOO weak to a) hold a lock for long before it dropped out or b) work at all some days. I spent a lot of time on the 10th floor near the swimming where the signal was really strong. The staff did not seem to mind there was no signal, 'phone the support staff its nothing to do with us, or use it near the pool or in reception, not really very helpful! One day it went really cranky and did not work at all but one of the "bell boys" was really helpful & tried to help, certainly did more that he needed too, well done! Ate in the restaurant for breakfast, the staff were really friendly but food was not very exciting. Some days had an a le carte option and others a buffet I think it depended on how full the hotel was. I fancied pancakes and "maple" syrup one day yum, only problem was that itâ€™s not maple syrup just a mixture of corn syrup, colour, flavours and preservatives, "never had any problems with our syrup before" they said! "No but I think you should change the description on the menuâ€� was my retort. In Europe they could be liable under the trade descriptions act!!! OK overall the hotel was clean and comfortable, staff were friendly and apart from the internet access helpful. Itâ€™s not a 5* hotel so you get what you pay for, I could have gone over the road for $160 a night or here for $80! So overall the important things were OK (room and bathroom clean, bed comfortable) but don't expect too much luxury but you will get good value for money! So pays your money and takes your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Clare S
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel and the staff. We would stay at this hotel again in a minute! I thought the parking deck was going to be a problem, but it is convenient to the rooms. Our room was roomy and CLEAN! On the trip down our car top carrier had leaked in the rain, so we needed to dry some of our clothes, the guest washer and dryer were right there! During a break in the sight seeing, we decided to check out the pool and had a relaxing afternoon as a family. I think this is the perfect hotel for someone wanting the "French Quarter" experience without the French Quarter noise and cost!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was good to excellent”
Reviews.Author: chase54
Reviews.Content: I booked the Holiday Inn French Quarter because it was a mystery hotel with a very good price. Once I knew which one it was and read the reviews I was apprehensive about this place. This hotel has been taken over by the Intercontinental Group. Previous complaints were poor attitude of the staff and extended waits for the elevator. We found the staff frendly, helpful and even joking at times. The evelators arrived quickly. We had a nice large room with 2 double beds. It obviously had been reciently painted, the carpet was newer as well as the frurniture. Beds were comfortable and all linens appeared to be relatively new. The guest computers were in the loby with no privacy, i could not sit down and they were difficult to see and use. There was a minor problem with house keeping one day. I mentioned it to the front desk and it was promptly taken care of by management. We even received a call from the head housekeeper at 7pm on a Saturday. I was impressed. A few minor complaints. We were on the 17th floor and the thermo pain window seal had been broken so the window was fogged over and we couldn't see out. The window sill needed to be cleaned. They do have a guest laundrey which is good but it only has 2 washers and 1 dryer for a large hotel. People had to wait a long time to use the laundry. The hotel is on the edge of the quarter so it is close to Canal St. the Casino, St Charles Ave. the queater and just about all the attractions you want to go to. Over all a good experience, I do recommend this hotel and would not hesitate tostay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ummm not fabulous...”
Reviews.Author: Picky123456
Reviews.Content: The rooms and beds were tiny. The bathroom was not clean when we arrived. This hotel is okay, but for the price you can find a better place with a better location. We went for a bachelorette party and wished we had booked hotel monteleon for $10 more a night....

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff; Good Location”
Reviews.Author: JW75_11
Reviews.Content: Perfect spot, close to Canal St, yet still in the French Quarter. The Staff where helpful. The lifts where a pain in the neck as they took forever (but that seems to be the 'norm' here) It was noisy at night which I beleive is to be slightly expected staying in the French Quarter. I had trouble with my bathroom (toliet) before I had even used it! But they got it fixed without much bother, I would have expected them to tidy up the towels that where on the floor to dry up the water, but they didn't. I didn't think it was the nicest Holiday Inn, but it shows in the price. There where a couple of cleaning things that I had issues with (one being that they didn't clean there room till 4pm, then she didn't do a great job! When the lady came to inspect her work and asked if I was happy, i said yes because I really just wanted to lye down abit and couldn't be bothered have her come back in and fit it. So good that they where checking; pity is was done at a rather poor time.

Reviews.Title: “The Concierge is The Reason To Stay”
Reviews.Author: AnxiousJerseyGirl
Reviews.Content: The reviews of this hotel were fairly accurate. It's a great price for the location in the French Quarter; close enough to the action of Bourbon Street but not so close to be a problem with noise and congestion. The lobby was clean. The room seemed marginally clean, probably because the slightly musty smell, the poor lighting and the outdated decor made me suspect it was not clean. It was very quiet, we never heard anyone in the halls and the place was full. The floors are oddly arranged; you get off the elevator and then have to walk up or down a 1/2 flight of stairs, which is a pain when you have lots of luggage. The elevators are small and slow. This is a huge problem at checkout. I heard people complaining that they had waited over an hour for an open elevator that they could board with their luggage. We gave up waiting and carried our bags down 9 flights of stairs. Tip: if you have to do this, enter the gargage when you first can so you can pull your luggage easily rather than thumping down each stair. So why stay, besides wanting a cheap, in every meaning of the word, stay? Stay for the concierge. He was working 10 am - 6 pm the weekend we were there. I think he said he worked 6 days a week and had Mondays off. He was wonderful. Although not a native to NOLA, he has been there long enough to learn a thing or two. He helped us find a restaurant that was delicious, in our price range, with music, complete with walking directions and a map. He saved us the AM walk to Cafe DuMonde for a closer cafe that had equally great beingets, which was important to us because we were pressed for time on one of our mornings. He suggested a few jazz clubs on Bourbon that were a great alternative to Preservation Hall. If you don't know NOLA and need some trustworthy guidance and you plan on spending your time exploring the city rather than hanging out in your room, I would seriously consider staying here. It was wonderful to save some money on the room and then get good advice on where to spend it in NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is not 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: 31TomS31
Reviews.Content: Hotel was rated as 3 star it is not, maybe 2 star if they fix the falling off towel racks and the lop sided toilet paper holder. Small rooms high prices. Location is right where you want to be in the French Quarter. No business center its on a wall in front of the elevators and prints at the reception desk. No real lobby kinda like a bus terminal. Parking is good right next to the hotel. If your going to go and drink and flop this is the hotel to go too. Stayed Sep. 4th & 5th

Reviews.Title: “Not Too Bad”
Reviews.Author: marctravis
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in lots of hotels in the French Quarter as I live an hour away. This is just your basic hotel, nothing really special except it's in a really good location. It has a small lobby that can get really full and busy. The staff is all business and did their job well. It's not a terribly clean hotel, but it's one of the less expensive hotels so that's to be expected. One odd thing about this hotel, if your room is above floor 18, you have to take two elevators to get there. Bottom line for me, it's not the nicest hotel, but I would definitely stay there again. It's less expensive and has a good location. The rooms are acceptable and the staff is good. Also, it has parking, which is not always available at other hotels. Oh, and there is free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, cruise package was totally worthwhile”
Reviews.Author: saroy523
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night, and booked the "park 'n cruise" package which gave us the room plus parking for up to 8 days, since we left on a cruise the next morning. At $119, which included an upgrade to an executive suite along with the parking, this was a great deal. The desk staff was polite and accommodating and the room was clean and well kept. The view wasn't much to speak of, but we were only there for the night so that wasn't a big deal. We were able to easily walk to the heart of the French Quarter for breakfast in the morning too.

Reviews.Title: “It does the job very well...”
Reviews.Author: Gator99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights and were very pleased we chose this hotel. First, the location can't be beat. You are right at the French Quarter, 2 blocks from Bourbon, and an easy walk to everything else. You are also right next to Canal Street and easy access to the cable cars. The hotel itself is good if a little dated. They have tube TV's and no fridge. I gave it 5 stars because it is what it is supposed to be; a three star hotel. The hotel staff is also very friendly and accommodating. Housekeeping skipped us on our last night, the management was informed, and the issue was resolved promptly. I inquired as to a cab number to call and pick us up as we were leaving for the airport, and they simply called for us and a cab appeared in less than 5 minutes. Again, if you are looking for a good hotel at a decent price, with a great location, and attentive staff, look no further than the Holiday Inn-French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Accurate Reviews -- It's a Solid 3-Star Hotel with Decent Amenities in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FairmindedTraveler
Reviews.Content: I'm staying at this hotel right now, and the previous reviews that are fair are very accurate. But the worst-case ones seem based on the reviewers' insecurity or lack of knowledge re basic travel. Regarding the hotel and the rooms, the hotel has a great location near Bourbon Street and Canal, i.e. the streetcar system and a gazillion great restaurants, shops, and other attractions (including the Insectarium and Harrahs). It is what it is supposed to be -- a solid 3-star hotel -- and it isn't what it isn't supposed to be (ie the Ritz). As far as the room, they are decent size, but some are older style but that's indicative of most Nola hotels (they're dealing with existing infrastructure). I could quibble with some logistics (ie the bathroom door slams into the toilet and yes there's a 20" tube tv), but the big thing is that the bed is comfy and the room is decently appointed. The elevator issue was a big "huh" -- during a busy holiday weekend it's been no issue or delay and the 18th floor connector elevator is lightning-fast (yeah they dont have AC but whats the point, you're only on them for a minute right?). Plus the staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful, from checkin to any issues or interactions. Curtis and a colleague assisted me on checkin to a pre-assigned room and re-assignment (my 1st room was ina nosier area and I politely asked if there'd be any way to move, understanding that I had a discounted room during a busy holiday weekend and that it might not be possible). I wonder how many other reviewers who had experiences acted indignant or copped an attitude -- the front desk staff was wonderful! Housekeeping was very respectful as well...I slept in and no knocks or calls, and when I didnt need service, that was it (front desk let housekeeping know and that was it). My only criticism of the hotel is its free internet, which is spotty (weak signal) and simply does not work in several rooms, with no wired internet available as a replacement or even a backup service available. The nearby Hotel Monteleone's service, which is provided by the same entity that provides the HI, has a way stronger signal than the HI's...go figure. But all in all, a very comfy room, with everything pretty much working the way it's supposed to, and location location location with a very helpful, friendly and caring staff.

Reviews.Title: “NEEDS ATTENTION: Unclean, out of date rooms, $$$ Parking/Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Road2011
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn in general has lost its standard of excellence long ago and though they are trying to step it up in various other locations this location is lacking greatly on the following: cleanliness, quality, affordability, and staff attentiveness. I suggest major improvements for furthered success. We used the mystery hotel option, don't advise Travelocity to further that deal with this hotel. Parking is $26 a day. Expensive restaurant. The rooms are not updated. Old 12" tube TV, no fridge, small beds, small bathroom with one tiny little sink. Our bathroom was dirty. Urine all over the toilet and the last visitor's foot prints were all over the bathroom tub. We asked for a room change but were denied. They also did not come to clean the bathroom as we asked. The window's are blocked by cement crossbars that block the light. Some positive thoughts: Good location. Free Internet. If you don't care about anything except being near Bourbon Street then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay as usual!”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELGIRLS46561
Reviews.Content: This isn't our first time staying at this hotel, but is the first time I've written a review. We continue to go back time after time to The Holiday Inn French Quarter because of steadfast service. Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful upon our early arrival and even let us check in 2 hours early! Hotel was always clean and fresh smelling each day and had no troubles whatsoever during our 3 night stay. Rooms were quiet and comfortable. Will definitely continue to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug6476
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights and couldn't have asked for a better location. It was far enough from Bourbon St that the noise couldn't be heard, but close enough to walk to absolutely everything. The staff went out of there way to make us feel welcome, which was a relief compared to other hotels we've frequented in the French Quarter. One block away in the direction of the French Quarter is an amazing Cuban/Spanish/Mexican restaurant with really affordable dishes and authentic food.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: Madjude
Reviews.Content: After having read mixed reviews about this hotel I did not have high hopes of it being great. We stayed 2 nights and were very happy. Firstly the location of the hotel is ideal for visiting the French quarter. You are in walking distance of all major tourist destinations. Yes the rooms are older but they are good size with all the amenities we needed. We found the elevators to be fine - no long waiting times as suggested by other reviews. Keeping in mind that this is a very busy hotel in the middle a big city - we were think the hotel is value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Jeannie Kudos to you!!!”
Reviews.Author: 826Touro
Reviews.Content: I'm staying here the end of August and I was happy to say that front desk Jeannie was was nice, informative and helped me with helping me with my reservation. More updated hotel info on the way...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: d4whatver82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location over the weekend. I have to say, that it was a great room. They allowed us to check in 4 hours early which was awesome and the actual act of check in was smooth and painless. We were annoyed with the unnamed $50 deposit we had to pay. So be prepared for that if you decided to choose this establishment. The hotel is in a great location, steps from all the action, but the busy street is a little "hood" and the smell and sounds can get kind of annoying. The room was very clean, and even had a fold out couch, which we didn't need. Our room was cleaned every day we were there which was awesome, and came with all the necessary toiletries. The hotel stored our baggage at check out since our flight didn't leave for a while, and the concierge( will try and sell you tours, and cruises) was pretty helpful. Some cons: You need your room key to access everything in the hotel. Elevators, doors, fitness, everything. It got very old very fast. The fitness "center" is a small room with 2 bikes, 2 treadmills, and some free weights. No bench to speak of to sit on, and the room is so cramped it isn't possible to use any of the equipment comfortably. There is a separate elevator to access floors 18-20, which is where we were. It was very annoying to have to take and wait on 2 different elevators each time we needed to go to and from the room. There is no lobby bathroom in this hotel. It's located next door in the restruant which serves terrible food. Do not eat at the checkered parrot. We got sick. The internet is SLOW. You might as well walk to Starbucks and use their free wifi. I think it may be slower than dial up. It took 12 minutes just to log into my Gmail account. By then I wasn't even interested in checking it anymore. Overall, our stay was great. Couldn't really ask for a better location, and that is what is most important in Nola when you are on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and not setup well”
Reviews.Author: tschmidtke
Reviews.Content: The floors have half floor u have to pull your luggage up and down stairs. It needs a remodel to make modern and handle cleanliness. The evevators are small and slow.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: armack17
Reviews.Content: We got an extremely good price for the two nights we stayed. We never needed housekeeping so I can't comment on that. We had plenty of towels, toiletries, etc. The room was a great size & the beds were very comfortable. One complaint I would have is the bathroom; although it's also a good size, something about the counter and the location of the sink bothered me....I felt like I didn't have anough arm room. Great location without the city noise. About a two-minute walk to Bourbon & a two-minute walk to Canal. The elevators were a little too crowded at times. Overall, it was an average hotel, but I would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to Everything!”
Reviews.Author: GeorjannR
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because it was a package deal with a tour I was on with 8 friends. The location was perfect. We were within walking distance to the St Charles Trolley, Bourbon Street, French quarter and all the wonderful shops and restaurant. This is a budget hotel. Nothing fancy. Basic two beds in the room and a small bathroom with leaky faucet. Ask for a room with a view of the Mississippi River. There was some type of eletrical fire one afternoon. We were not allowed in the hotel. The smoke in the lobby was horrible and it lasted for a few days. Fortunately no smoke on our floor and we could not smell it in the room. The restaurant next to the hotel was a convenience. Not the best breakfast to be had in New Orleans, but it was a free breakfast with the hotel and tour package. Wait staff was nice, helpful and quick. Especially nice when I had to take a breakfast "to go" back up to the room one morning. Overall, I would stay at this hotel again for a budget travel. We didnt spend much time in the rooms at all, so it was great. If I was coming to New Orleans with my spouse for a romantic get away there are other places nicer to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great place to park/stay prior to cruise”
Reviews.Author: 92Wanderlust
Reviews.Content: got a great deal to park and stay prior to our cruise so was able to leave my vehicle there for 8 nights. The hotel was a block off Bourbon St. and a short walk to Jackson Square. Room was clean and comfortable beds. only complaint is that the elevators were extremely slow and the lobby was small and always loud and crowded.

Reviews.Title: “The staff couldn't have been nicer, but the rooms do need some updating.”
Reviews.Author: CruisePlanner77546
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms in July as a pre-cruise stay. First of all, they had more than an ample amount of staff and they were extremely accommodating. My son and his girlfriend had one room and my husband and I had the other room. The hotel is a non-smoking hotel. When you walked into my son's room, all you could smell was cigarette smoke. We went down to the front desknto ask for another room. The staff immediately found another room for them. It's too bad because the way the room is configured, the air-conditioning was not efficient. The rooms do need some minor updates. If you are there and going on a cruise, they have a wonderful package for just an additional one time charge of $24.95. You can park for up to 8 days. The hotel is right on the outskirts of the French Quarter. The area just across the street is a little "seedy" but you have to remember it's New Orleans. There good restaurants within walking distance. It's hard to find bad food in New Orleans! If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel, I'd recommend it. But if you want a 4 or 5 star hotel this isn't your place.

Reviews.Title: “All things considered it was a good stay”
Reviews.Author: carpsonthego
Reviews.Content: I read hundreds of reviews of this and other hotels before I chose Holiday Inn. Overall I was pleased with my choice and would stay there again with my family. Being a first time travelor to New Orleans I was shocked at the cost of parking in the hotel garage ($30 per night). The ladys at the front desk were very cold and inconvienenced, the manager, conciere and house keepers were warm and friendly. Use the bellman to get your bags in and out because they have a designated elevator or otherwise the wait can be 30 minutes. The indoor pool was perfect for our 8 year old son. There is no restuarant in the hotel..the kids eat free is at the food joint next door which has good food but is slow with lousy service. If your traveling with kids this location is perfect since your off Bourbon Street but within walking distance to the street car stop and other kid friendly activities. Be aware there is a store across the street that seemed to attract a lot of activity and some very interesting characters.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoDeb
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, but a bit outdated and run down. The location is good if you want to stay mainly on Bourbon street, but we perferred the other end of town. the area by the French market on the other end of N.O. is nicer.

Reviews.Title: “We love NOLA!”
Reviews.Author: CherieHebert
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the size of the room. The view wasnt that great, but that's to be expected with so many tall buildings nearby. This hotel was close to everything we wanted to visit. The layout of the bathroom was odd and my knees hit the wall. For this price, I would expect breakfast to be included, but it was not. The service was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Stay - Would book here again!”
Reviews.Author: LisaPuzz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our needs. It was in a great location, easy to access both red and green streetcars, French Quarter, and a short walk to both RiverWalk and Bourbon Street. I traveled with a friend, and we both felt very safe in this location, even in the evening hours. The beds were very comfy and the rooms were clean (and quiet!). Breakfast was included with our rate, which is served in the restaurant next door. The food was really good, on weekends it was a buffet which was perfect to be able to grab what you want and then go. There was even an included omelet station. We had a sit down breakfast on Monday and again service in the restaurant was great. We had a great weekend in NOLA and look forward to coming back! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in the heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: writersblock
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before and returned for another break. The hotel is located in the heart of the French Quarter. From arrival and check in - staff were helpful and friendly. Room large, clean - 2 huge king sized beds. Tea & coffee making facilities. Bathroom large and very clean. Great view of the Mississippi! Leave the car in the garage and walk ... French Quarter is so lovely to walk around and there is a great trolley car system to take you to other parts of the city. (Buy an all day ticket and hop on and off!) Restaurant in the hotel is expensive, especially for breakfast but there are so many great eating places on every street that you'll want to try them all anyway! The hotel concierge is helpful when it comes to booking trips etc - always full of great advice. Would stay here again without hesitation. Check out their web site for good deals and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay when visiting the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Chicagogrl22
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel via priceline for 4 nights at the beginning of June. When we arrived we parked in their secured parking lot which was nice. We really did not like driving in the Quarter so we were happy to have somewhere safe to leave our car parked for most of the trip. When we arrived the front desk service was prompt and welcoming. After waiting almost 10 minutes for an elevator (one was broken and the others were extremely slow) we arrived in our room which was on the top floor of the hotel. We really enjoyed this floor as you have to take a separate elevator to get up there and it was really quiet throughout our entire trip. Our room was definitely amazing value for only $50 per night! It had a large bed, granite counter tops in the bathroom with a large tub, and overlooked the Mississippi River. As we walked in, there was a steamboat on the river which was pretty amazing to see! Overall, I would recommend this hotel as a decent home base for any visit to the Quarter. It is a bit of a walk to Jackson Square (Definitely walkable though) but it is also close by restaurants like Mr. B's. We didn't spend that much time in the room as there is so much to see and do in New Orleans to keep busy with but our stay here was for the most part comfortable. On a side note, we found the maid service to be pretty pushy about cleaning the rooms. On the day we were going to check out at 9 AM my fiance ran down to the car to drop off some of our stuff. After he left, I decided to take a quick shower, as I was getting out the maid tried to walk in our room! It was still 9AM! Luckily, I was in a towel but it was still a little unnerving. After a few trips to the car to load up our belongings she tried to come in several more times and this was all prior to the required check out time. This was a bit irritating but overall we had a nice stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location”
Reviews.Author: CrookedJ
Reviews.Content: It was a Holiday Inn... nothing spectacular, but quite nice and located in the middle of where we wanted to be. Staff were all very friendly. Only complaint was the poor internet service - the wifi was up and down quite a bit, so that was a bit annoying. Pool is very small but it was nice, the key is just to avoid the the evening hours when its crammed with kids. The fitness center even smaller, but I don't work out on vacation so I didn't care. Nice room, clean, and what you want in the deep south in July - reliable AC!

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel! Way better than our last trip to NOLA!!”
Reviews.Author: lisajoss007
Reviews.Content: The staff was so friendly I was stunned! The rooms were clean and neat (we took up 5 of them). The only problem any of us had was the wifi was dodgy unless you were in the lobby, but that is a common problem in hotels anywhere. We will definitely stay there next time we travel to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel at an affordable cost”
Reviews.Author: bayou babe
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a Saturday night after doing a Swamp Tour in Slidell. It was four of us: me, my best friend, her 15 yo son and my 16 yo nephew. After leaving Slidell around 12:00 noon, we stopped at Willie Maeâ€™s Scotch House for some of there delicious fried chicken. After eating, we went straight to the hotel parking garage to park so that we could go to the Aquarium of the Americas, which is within walking distance. The parking was self-park, and the parking attendant advised us to take our parking ticket with us when checking in. It was around 3:00 and check-in was at 4:00, so we left our luggage in the car and went to the aquarium. After the aquarium visit, we stopped at Sakâ€™s Fifth Avenue and shopped a bit, then headed back to check-in. The hotel is on Royal Street, one block off of Canal Street, and one street over from Bourbon Street. In my opinion, close to the action, but away from the noise on Bourbon that can go on all night long. When we got back to the hotel to check-in, the lobby was full of guests in three different lines. Not sure what that was all about, but the little lobby was packed. And it was nearly 6:00 p.m. It must have taken us nearly 45 minutes to check in, but once we got up to the counter, the employee was very polite and helpful. I asked if we had a room with a river view, and she said no. But she quickly switched us to a room with a view of the Mississippi, which made me very happy! That earned them a few extra points in my book! We were also given a parking card which we could use to go in and out of the garage as needed while there, but we didnâ€™t drive anywhere once we arrived. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. The parking fee of $26/day was added to our hotel bill. Thatâ€™s a reasonable price for hotel parking in downtown NO, plus you can self park and are not forced to valet park. Some hotels have parking in the next block or several blocks away from their hotel, and you have to wait for them to bring your car to you, plus itâ€™s a higher cost per day AND you have to tip them! We were given a room on the 19th floor, which requires two elevators â€“ one that goes to the 18th floor, then we had to switch to a different elevator that went to floors 19 and 20. We had a room with two double beds â€“ the beds were comfortable and the pillows were decent. Hot water was available at all times. Ac unit worked well and kept the room cool and comfortable. An iron and ironing board were provided in the room, as well as decent toiletries in the bathroom, and a coffee pot and coffee. The pool was on the 10th floor, not very big and the chlorine smell was very strong. The boys decided not to get in because there were quite a few smaller kids in there when we went. The pool only goes from 3 feet to 5 feet. The fitness center is right next to the pool, and is extremely small. There are a couple of treadmills and some free weights, but not much room to work with the weights. For dinner, we took the boys to Daisy Dukes, a small beer and burger joint a couple of streets over on Chartes. It was pretty good. We all left full. Later that night, BFF and I left the boys and went to the Carousel Bar in the Hotel Monteleone for drinks. Itâ€™s one block down on Royal Street, so a quick and easy walk from this hotel. Cool bar to visit â€“ it slowly rotates around like what? A Carousel! Just kinda cool experience if youâ€™ve never been before. Also, if youâ€™ve never had a Pimmâ€™s Cup, try it. Itâ€™s pretty good. I had two of them. Slurp! The bartenders were very nice and were glad to explain to you what some of the various drinks were and how they were made. On Sunday morning, we went to breakfast at Oceana Grill, once again, in walking distance on Conti Street and Bourbon. Delicious Pain Perdu or lost bread served there! If youâ€™ve never had it, try it! We also shared one of their world famous crepes â€“a wesome and huge â€“ can definitely be shared between 2-3 people. Overall, the hotel is a good place to lay your head without breaking the bank. I would stay there again without hesitation. Good location to Canal Street, the riverwalk, the aquarium, the St. Charles streetcar line, and the French Quarter. Be sure to sign up for Priority Rewards too!!! Enjoy! bb

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Not so Great Service”
Reviews.Author: southerngirl43
Reviews.Content: My daughter and two sisters spent the weekend in New Orleans recently and we decided to stay in this hotel because of the location and the price was reasonable. We began our problems with the check in process. I had reserved the room with a credit card and made arrangements with my sisters to split the bill. When I checked in the desk clerk attempted to run the credit card several times and informed me that the card had been declined. This in the very small check in area crowded with people. He explained that sometimes credit card companies will decline a credit card when it's used outside of where you live. How absurd. How do people travel? My sister then had to use her debit card to pay for the room. It came to light later that the clerk had run my card three times twice with the incorrect amount and all three times with the incorrect expiration date. I returned to the desk and explained what had happened. An aplogy was given but no more. Later in the weekend we left the room in the morning and returned several hours later to store packages. While in our room housekeeping came to clean the room, I answered the door and explained we would be leaving the room in a few minutes and could she please come back later. She looked at me like I had asked her to cut off her hand. Way too much attitude. We did leave the room 10 mintues later, walking around the cleaning cart right in front of our door, as she was cleaning the room next door. We returned to our room several hours later and our room was still not cleaned. I called down to the front desk and was told someone would clean the room and bring fresh towels. Three phone calls and one hour later someone delivered towels, wet and dirty towels. After chasing the person down the hall and requesting clean towels we received clean towels, thirty mintues later. All of this was explained to the front desk and we were credited our parking fees of $52.00. This was appreciated but still not quite enough and a bit too late.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would recommend to others”
Reviews.Author: tonee1
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend of July 14th, 2011 at the hotel to celebrate my 50th birthday and my baby's 28th birthday. We really enjoyed the hotel and the staff were extremely courteous. The rooms were really comfortable and was located in a great location. The only issue I had with the hotel was that the elevators were quite small, but that was something that could be overcome very easily. Definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, friendly staff, clean.”
Reviews.Author: nicksim
Reviews.Content: Located on the west edge of the French Quarter we found this location quite convenient. We happened to catch 2 days of the 3 day Essence Music Festival taking place at the Superdome July 1-3..So the French Quarter was PACKED to the edges. Then there was the July 4 crowds. We walked everywhere (Harrah's casino is close) the trolly is right there as is a tourist info place. Accessible to the popular sites and the RiverWalk. So location was very good. Room was adequate, the usual desk, one arm chair, NICE bedding and pillows. Coffee maker was very welcome. We were up on floor 17 and, even there, the loud street brass bands can be heard until 10 PM (which seemed to be the noise cutoff). a block from Bourbon st. (LOUD at night). The desk staff was courteous and helpful, loaning me a corkscrew once. Bellmen were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Hats off to the crew. the pool was small (3 feet to 5 feet deep) but good for a dip in the morning. The only negative: a pitiful exercise room. The two bikes did not work (one even had broken pedals). The 2 treadmills did work. there were nice free weights but NO mats, no bench, or real space to use them. Tiny room. SLOOOOWWW WiFi. Annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel...but be prepared to wait 30 minutes for an elevator”
Reviews.Author: Ebonidimplz
Reviews.Content: We decided on this hotel because it was conveniently located in the French Quarter, but within a short walk to the Convention Center and the Superdome. At check-in, it appeared that there was really only one knowledgeable person behind the front desk. She was giving instructions to everyone else. When we got to the room, it was very roomy, but our view was of the back of another hotel and wasn't clear, as the mirrored tint on the windows really needed to be replaced. Each day, we had to ask for extra towels from housekeeping and we also had to ask for toilet paper. Two things, I would think they would automatically leave when you have a room with four people in it. The worst thing of the entire trip is that the hotel's parking garage begins one floor above the lobby and takes up the second through seventh floors. The whole property is a total of 18 floors. The problem is there are three elevators that cover the garage floors as well as the room floors. It was normal to have to wait for 30 minutes for an elevator. We were on the 17th floor and would sometimes opt to catch an elevator going up to the 18th, only to find that other people on lower floors had done the same thing. This alone, was enough not to make me come back. Oh yeah, the ice maker on our floor didn't function the entire time we were there. If you stay here, be prepared to either wait a long time on an elevator or ask for a lower floor so you can take the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Older and kinda dirty”
Reviews.Author: gotazgold
Reviews.Content: I Was somewhat disappointed with this hotel. It was very dirty and the elevators were not properly working. I won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel for business travel (if you have a roommate)”
Reviews.Author: dks76
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference with several roommates. The front desk staff seemed completely unprepared for this, which is usually not the case for official conference hotels. Although all of our names were on the reservation, we had trouble checking in as we arrived separately (not the norm in my business travel experience). The billing has been an absolute nightmare; instead of taking our cards as we checked in and automatically splitting the bill equally among all occupants, instead we had to visit them several times in person at the front desk to try to get them to understand that the bill needed to be split. However, it turns out this still didn't work and we're having to handle additional billing issues via phone after our return (one person was charged twice while I was not charged, even though my card was on file for the reservation). The fitness center is a joke as well - two treadmills (the one I used was so loud it was distracting to use it), two stationary bikes, and a row of free weights without a weight bench or even any space to use them really.

Reviews.Title: “Way better then expected.”
Reviews.Author: smaragd55
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel for New Orleans on Priceline and got this one. The place is currently ranked #80 of 147 hotels so we were a bit worried at first. But we had a pleasant stay there. The room was nice and clean but could use a little upgrade. The beds were comfortable. We stayed on the 15th floor and didn't hear any noise at all from the streets below. Is this a perfect hotel then? No it isn't. * The elevators are slow and too small so often full. * The pool didn't look clean and we only used it ones during our 3 night stay. * The Staff was helpfull, but gave us wrong information that caused us to mis a jazz concert. * Wifi is slooooow. And not suitable for Skype. We are not very demanding and usually stay in ** hotels or motels. (< $75) So for under $70 a night this is a pretty decent stay. The BIG plus is the location. It's on Royal Street (one block from Bourbon) and close to all the Streetcar stops. Your just walk in The French Quarter after stepping out . Oh! there a $26 a day parking fee, but on the other hand, that common in that area. Bert

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: cndyln58
Reviews.Content: Great staff, clean rooms and everything in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for visitors”
Reviews.Author: tori007
Reviews.Content: I think the hotel was pretty decent since we only stopped at our rooms to sleep. We were roaming about the city all day. It is close to everything we needed

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: hmsbaby
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here and liked the view of the river. The pool looked nice though I did not have time to try it. The location is in the french quarter and very close to many restaurants. I would not call the hotel upscale but for the price, it was very nice. The staff were really exceptional and made us feel very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Nice Price”
Reviews.Author: curlyanne
Reviews.Content: I was so pleasantly surprised to find that this Holiday Inn, IN the French Quarter was so reasonably priced. Everyone was so nice, and it was a Holiday Inn! We both enjoyed our stay a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: pompey7
Reviews.Content: Service and location were good however the room was in desperate need of a refurbishment. The bathroom in particular was very outdated and too cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Stay”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellers123
Reviews.Content: Good evening stayed at hotel for 3 nights at beginning of June 2011. Location of hotel is really good you can not beat it. as you are right in the French Quarter. One block over from Bourbon street and part centre. your just corner of Canal Street as well. very close all areas. Hotel is good and was clean, however elevators were a little slow. On my floor where the pop and ice machines were , it smelled like someone urinated on them. only bad complaint. Front desk staff were good and fast check in. There was good service and good answers to my questions. The restaurant the hotel recommends next door is not part of the hotel even though there is a connecting door to it. food was a little poor but that review will be separate. Only other complaint was not fridge or microwave in the room/ But when your in the French Quarter your so close to many good eating opportunities so Why would on want to dine in. Thanks all

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and value”
Reviews.Author: justsue123
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this hotel. Very clean and comfortable. The pool was great. Great location- one block off of Canal. I recommend to anyone visting New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MandJ78701
Reviews.Content: This is a solid 3-3.5 Star property, so don't expect the Ritz. However, for the money, this is a GREAT place to stay to see NO. Our room was clean, plenty big, and had a great view of the River. We were comfortable at night and not bothered by noise or rowdy quests (but maybe we were just lucky - as there were plenty of bachelor party groups wandering in and out). Given the location, it's an easy walk to Jackson Sq, and the St Charles streetcar line picks up just the other side of Canal, so from this spot you really can see a LOT of the city without a car.
