Given the proximity to Bourbon the area around the hotel can be very busy, as well as the lobby, but that did not bother us. Getting to it via car is a little tricky because of the way the streets are laid out, but that is also manageable. Plan in some travel time if you need to come or go via car on a weekend night, as the pedestrian traffic clogs the area. The only negative is how expensive it is to park a car, $26 per day, but that's just something you have to live with if you drive in. We did not use the pool or the gym but both looked nice. Staff was also nice and accommodating, they moved us from a two-double bed to a king bed room no problem. All in all a great hotel for the money, and a great FQ option for a trip on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Made for an Excellent Memorial Day Weekend”
Reviews.Author: foxegurl266
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location (near the aquarium, Harrah's, the Charles St. streetcar line, the river, and not directly on, but within walking distance to Bourbon Street), tall building that you can see from a distance when you're drunk and lost, Bath and Body Works toiletries, great view of the ships passing by on the River, quiet (we were probably the loudest ones there), excellent, helpful concierge named Bill who provided ideas for dinner and drinks, maps, and opened our wine bottle when we forgot our opener at home, soft towels, cheaper parking than some of the other hotels (26 per night), two doubles comfortably accommodated four people, Rewards members received goody bag of bottled water, peanuts, and crackers. Cons: As some other reviewers commented, we did have to wait for several elevator cars passed before their was finally room for us (although it was Memorial Day weekend and the entire hotel was booked), the housekeeping staff said they didn't have enough towels, AC in hallways, stairwells, and elevators was intermittent, for us (we just shared), only one tiny trash can, and no fridge or microwave.

Reviews.Title: “Good location-shane about the rest.”
Reviews.Author: bradless
Reviews.Content: It was 4pm before we were able to get into our room. We were expecting an important message at the desk. The recepionist assured us it was not there. We later found out he was wrong. Our room was large and looked fairly clean until I saw a clump of black hair next to my pillow. I was going to report it but there was such a long queue at reception that I had to leave it until much later. In the morning the requested wake up call did not happen, luckily we did wake in time to catch our tour. The room staff refilled our room with the empty outside wrapper of our used coffee bags, and left no sugar creamer etc. Neither coffee maker or ice bucket were emptied. The room was missing a hair dryer [this had been reported to them a few days previously by a friend who was staying in the same room]. When I spoke to the manager he immediately sent up an armful of towels, shampoo, soap and creamer. I only wanted creamer AND a hair dryer [ which did arrive with another person}. Checking under the beds when we left I discovered a half empty bottle of water, minus its top, which had soaked the carpet. This was not ours and had been there for at least 4 days. The htel was quiet but the AC was very noisy, we did get used to it. Breakfast at the restaurant was not recommended by friends but outside you are spolit for choice. We did have a drink with friends in the bar but although it was almost empty we were not allowed to sit at a table, which meant you could only talk to the person next to you. On leaving we were presented with an ingratiating card asking us to give them an excellent review. This hotel is in a great location-many places of interest are within walking distance, what a shame that they cannot sort out minor details . We much preferred Country Inns in Magazine Street.

Reviews.Title: “It was loud all of the time and smelled like stale cigarette smoke, but hey, its the french quarter!”
Reviews.Author: Aundrea S
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in the hotel informed me that there were no doubles, which was requested, but they offered me an upgrade to a king suite. The decor was a little tacky, but the room was very big and everything was clean sans the carpet and drapes. Keep your slippers handy-other than that everything was satisfactory. The upgraded room could easily accommodate four adults. Beware!! The water gets EXTREMELY hot! It's shocking when you wash your hands, but feels great the morning after a long night in the quarter. The staff was very helpful. The internet speed is terrible-but free. The hotel charges you $26 a day for parking. That seems steep but its a few buck less than everywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some of these reviews lead you to believe”
Reviews.Author: Nighttwo
Reviews.Content: I'm sitting in the hotel room right now (2nd night of two night stay) and wanted to add a review after reading a lot of reviews before I got here. I want to cover some of the negative things I seen mentioned in previous reviews. First, the elevators - I used the stopwatch on the iPhone to time a few waits and it never exceeded 90 seconds. I seen a few people who didn't swipe their room key and expected it to go. (it won't) Bottom line: elevators are fine. They can get full but I never had to wait for a second one because of capacity. Second, the hallways, common areas, rooms, etc. do not stink as some have stated. Third, the AC works just fine and I actually had to turn mine off last night because it got too cold. Finally, the neighborhood is what it is and you cannot blame the hotel for that. If you don't like the area then don't stay in this part of town. For me it was not an issue as I have stayed in the downtown area of many major cities. This hotel is an average hotel for those corporate travelers who are used to staying in Marriott, Sheraton, Hilton, Doubletree, etc. All the amenities you expect as a business traveler are here but without extras that you may get at the nicer places. Staff is OK but not exceptional. Overall, I would stay here again for the right price. (Company is paying for the room this trip so its not coming out of my pocket) The one true negative I would agree with is the wireless internet. It is very slow compared to other places although it is free.

Reviews.Title: “Worth It”
Reviews.Author: Actualangel
Reviews.Content: There were so many Hotel's to choose from. I had never been to New Orleans before, I wanted a place with a balcony overlooking Bourbon St, well so I thought. I became overwhelmed trying to pick a place to stay. I chose the Holiday Inn, figuring we kinda knew what we were going to get having stayed at Holiday Inn's in the past, again so i thought. They do not have balconies and they aren't on Bourbon St, but it didnt matter. In the end I don' t think i would have used a balcony much, if at all. We used the room to sleep, shower , change and get back outside! Unless I was going during Mardi Gras, not having a balcony really didn't matter. The LOCATION was great, easy walking distance to everything, we never took a cab! The room was fine, and clean. The PRICE, very reasonable, one of the cheapest in the end. I found the staff extremely polite, friendly and very helpful. Everyone was so pleasant. Can't say enough about them, both day and night shift! I rated everything "excellent" except for the rooms, they really should install in room safes. It would have made our stay easier. I did notice other reviews that complained about the Elevators, I didn't find it a big deal. Yes they can be slow, and yes sometimes filled with people and you would have to wait for the next one, but I was on vacation, one thing i had plenty of was time! I would highly recommend this Hotel and when I return, I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Eh, Ya can't knock it”
Reviews.Author: Jessep666
Reviews.Content: You can't knock this place. Its on Royal St - beautiful street, wouldn't stay anywhere else. Staggering distance from Bourbon, 2 blocks from the river, clean and comfortable. Staff are ok, not outgoingly helpful, but there if something needs rectifying or you have a question, they are efficient. Computers by the lobby are free to use and print out - which is great. Pool is also a welcome suprise - particularly when its very hot outside and your tired legs need a break! One bugbear : no safe. Overall, for the price there's no reason to pay Â£200 more and stay elsewhere , if you're spending that much time in your hotel you shouldn't been in NOLA!

Reviews.Title: “Not a luxury hotel, but we were pleased.”
Reviews.Author: NHtraveler60
Reviews.Content: After calling around to find a hotel in the French Quarter, for the Jazz Fest, we were running out of options.We found a room at the Holiday Inn and were not sorry. It is not fancy or quaint, and the bathrooms could use some work. On the plus side, the room was quite large and comfortable and it was clean, a great location, and for that weekend, reasonably priced. Not a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Barb1963
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the second time in two years. Got a very good rate thru hotwire. Hotel was clean. Comfortable bed. Great view of the Mississippi. Front desk was nice. Concierge very helpful. It's a great location. No problem with elevator. The dudes that hang out in front of the convenience store are part of the scene, no problems with them at all. The store is a great place to pick up a newspaper, snack and a $1 beer! There's a good coffee shop up on Canal for breakfast close by. Royal is great street to stay on, better than Bourbon in fact! Lots of cool galleries and antique stores. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. If you are coming to NOLA for music, be sure to go to Frenchmen St, Mid City Lanes and Fritzells. Eat at Stanley's for the best eggs benedict, Coops for the best PoBoy.

Reviews.Title: “Why wouldn't you stay here....”
Reviews.Author: Jp1up
Reviews.Content: When I read the previous reviews of this Holiday Inn, after making the reservation, I was pretty nervous about arriving..... negative reviews about safety and cleanliness had me very concerned. Here's my take: New Orleans, in general may not be the "cleanest" city in America. So please take that into consideration. If you want a prestine hotel, I would recommend staying at a 5-star hotel. Our room was clean upon arrival, it was made up and cleaned while we were out. I had no complaints. Yes, maybe the bathroom was a bit outdated, but this is a 3-star hotel. We were always greeted when we entered into the lobby, I never saw "bums" in the lobby, or felt that I was in an unsafe area. As for the previous review regarding the elevators not working...you have to enter in your room card to press what floor you want to go on, when going up to or down from your room. Again, I never had a problem with this. It was quiet in the hallways, and never had an issue with noise. We were there over the Easter weekend. I can easily see when there would be more noise to deal with, depending on the events that are occuring while you are there. The stores across the street were convienent for grabbing snacks for the room. We were a block away from Burbon street, and very close to Canal street. We felt safe walking to and from our hotel, day and night. Yes, there are plenty of local folks that will ask you for money, but they are friendly and will leave you alone after you say no. I was very pleased with the location, and accomodations. I would definately recommend this hotel, and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mildewy, smelly, ugly, run-down, NOT 3 stars, DO NOT USE PRICELINE!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah__2000_11
Reviews.Content: Used name-your-own-price on Priceline and WILL NEVER DO THAT AGAIN! This place is infested with mildew in both the dark smelly, hallways and the shabby, outdated, smelly rooms. I would not have spent the night there if I hadn't had to check in at 2 AM because my room was not ready at 2 PM. The TV is what people leave out on the side of the road- an old model with lines and shadows on the screen during the $16 pay per view movie. Air conditioning is loud and barely cools down the room. Key cards didn't work and when we called front desk on our cell phone, they said we had to go back down to the first floor to get new ones. Checked out first thing the next morning even though I had reserved two nights on Priceline. Called Priceline to make sure they wouldn't charge me for the second night, spent 15 minutes talking/on hold with them, and they REFUSED to cancel the charge for the 2nd night that I wasn't using. They offered a "bigger room" in the same MILDEW INFESTED hotel, nothing more. When I asked the rep for his name, he would only say "Jimmy" and not give his last name or let me speak to anyone else. Don't waste your money and jeopardize your health at this hotel, and never make the huge mistake of using Priceline!

Reviews.Title: “Staff very nice, for a cheaper hotel it's quite good... but room service closes at 10:00pm!!!”
Reviews.Author: ctyson1
Reviews.Content: ...rooms are clean, staff is friendly and helpful, concierge (Broderick) very knowledgable and helpful. Hotel a bit older and dilapidated, but clean nonetheless. Main peeve is that after coming back from some of the tours - which end at 10:00pm - there is no room service available. "Room service" is provided by the restaurant/bar next door called the "Checkered Parrot" that closes at 10:00pm. Unfortunate hiccup to an otherwise acceptable stay. Would recommend hotel, with a "no frills & forget about in-room dining" caveat.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: AnnieM1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in April 2011. Room very basic and in need of refurbishment, but it was clean and the bed comfortable. Bit of mould in bathroom and overall room had smell of cigarette smoke even though non-smoking room (which, incidentally, we had to sign to say we wouldn't smoke in there or would be 'fined'). The staff were very good and allowed me to put valuables in hotel security when they wouldn't fit in small deposit box. Location was good - near to everything. Overall enjoyed New Orleans but hated Bourbon Street in the evening - very seedy - was not expecting to see strip tease joints, inappropriately dressed (or should I say undressed!) women, so many drunks and undesirables hanging about especially early in the evening. However there are many nice areas - try 'Green Goddess' - small restaurant and bar on Exchange Street in French Quarter; owner a bit OCD - so high expectations and attention to detail/standards! Also, Market Cafe really nice food, service and entertainment. Pat O'Brien's for Hurricane drink in courtyard - excellent.

Reviews.Title: “good location if you get a discount price”
Reviews.Author: travelskk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the French Quarter, and is one of the larger hotels in the Quarter. If you want fancy, romantic, quaint, etc, stay at one of the small boutique hotels (so very many 10-40 room hotels in the quarter). However, we got this hotel at an outrageous discount, and it has an excellent location on Royal, one block inside the quarter from Canal. If you get this place for a good price, and are not wanting a special or unique place, this can be a good value. Obviously its going to draw some of the party crowd (not as much of the antiques shopping crowd) and is not really a convention hotel. Anyway, rooms are simple and predictable. ours was as clean as you'd expect a Holiday Inn to be. Its big and very busy. I'd stay there again for a short stop (we stopped for one night), and we are in New Orleans frequently. There are many other places I'd rather stay, but would not pass this up for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “close to the french quarter”
Reviews.Author: coast2coast255060
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conveniently located near the French Quarter. It is walking distance to everything and the rooms are spacious with a lounge area. We had a great view. Beds were comfy and we had a great sleep. What more can you ask for ? Bill the concierge was very helpful and when my daughter could not go on a tour he refunded the money in full !

Reviews.Title: “Serious Security and Cleanliness Concern at this facility”
Reviews.Author: ecseps
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn French QTR this past week for business. Location is perfect - just on the fringe if the quarter. Said, if you are someone who values a clean facility and feeling safe - avoid this at all costs. Issues experienced: - Lobby was small, dirty and overcrowded. At 4:00PM, people were unable to check in due to rooms not being cleaned. (I got a room as a Priority Club member), but the state of the lobby told a real story to a standard traveler. - The hotel was in a general state of filth - vomit in the elevator (I get it - Bourbon street and all), but for it to be there for 4 hours??? - They offered complementary computers in the lobby...and the street people of the quarter know this as they are on them all day and night. Best part - they like to pan handle in the lobby while the front desk reads the paper! Fun! - At about 11 at night, two people from the street follow me in, ask where the bathroom is and get on the elevator...bell captain and desk ignore it. I let them take the elevator knowing without a room key they can go nowhere...and when the doors open, 3 girls go to get on and I tell them to hold on and aks the two gentlemen to see their room key...of course, they had none, so I tell them to leave the hotel...all the while, the oblivious front desk does nothing. From my experience, this hotel is a huge law suit waiting to happen. In a place where there are such great hotels, this one is to be avoided at all costs. Other than location - not a single redeeming quality to be found.

Reviews.Title: “Got the job done”
Reviews.Author: rylie2719
Reviews.Content: Here for conference, but had the whole family. Location was ideal for FQ and related action. Indoor was enough to keep kids (8,11) happy w/ seating area. Restaurant is independent place next door, not special, never ate there w/ so many other options. Room was smaller, but had table and was quiet enough up on 11th floor. Get higher if possible. Clean enough but not pristine. Wireless was shaky and no ethernet connections possible. Lobby small, staff friendly, parking expensive but convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting and Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Cavedoug
Reviews.Content: I went here for a convention and stayed 5 nights, picked it for the location, Walking Distance to the French Quarter, OMG big mistake, its a dirty filthy hotel, thatâ€™s sums it up. Pool was closed entire stay. Cigarette butts, human hair, tampons, on hallway floors in the same spot for 5 days. Mold in the sink, broken bath fixtures., smells like cheap car wash air freshener & smoke, bedding smells so bad, the bed bugs left. Gangsta Staff lost my reservation, thank god I had a printed receipt.. Across the street, Check cashing/single beer liquor store full of hoodlems, drug addicts, and criminals (yes I watched guys steeling beers, fighting, arrests everything ). They would pan handle to get 75 cents then buy another beer. Fun to watch, but a bit dangerous Oh yea, cocaine or ? wrappers in the mens bathroom stall, 2nd floor .. Full lock down after dark which probably a good thing, This Hotel is great place to hold a frat partyâ€¦. Or maybe not. PS was wife felt scared

Reviews.Title: “Was perfect for our family group”
Reviews.Author: Muffy_86
Reviews.Content: We needed rooms with two queens size beds that were under $200 a night in the French Quarter. This was perfect. Rooms were spacious and beds were comfortable. Everything was clean. The service was very friendly and did a good job. This is a busy hotel with many international travelers - so the lobby can get a little crowded and elevators are a bit small. BUT - it cost 1/3 less than the Monteleone and it is right next door, so you can't beat the location. Being right off Canal it can get a bit rough and rowdy in the late evening in this part of the quarter, but we did have any problems. I prefer smaller, boutique hotels usually - but I needed the extra beds for the kids and they really enjoyed the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Full of Adventure”
Reviews.Author: mightyt
Reviews.Content: We arrived around noon and I inquired about an early check-in, which got a chuckle from the staff because apparently an "on time" check-in was questionable. So, we went exploring in the Quarter and returned at 4pm. Our room was not ready. We waited (with others guests) in the lobby for ONE and a half hours! At 5:45 the front dest clerk said to me, "your room was ready at 4:00 but you weren't here so we gave it to guests that were on time" WOW. This was the same clerk I had spoken to at 4pm!! At this point we just needed to change and freshen up for dinner reservations at 7pm. He hands me a key to a room on the 20th floor. I paid (in advance) for a patio room, which was more costly and only on the 9th floor. After another 30 minutes, our patio room was ready. The entire check-in process was a joke, although we werent laughing! I spoke to management and received free breakfast at the Checkered Parrot right next door. That was an experience in itself (see reviews posted on this site). The plus side was our room and patio: Very spacious and clean. Downside, we booked this hotel for the indoor pool which was closed our entire 3 night stay. I am not one to complain, I dont recall ever posting a negative review but this hotel needs a more dedicated front desk staff!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: read2scd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about 6 blocks from the French Market, Riverwalk, and all other popular New Orleans attractions. However, the walls are paper-thin and it is very hard to sleep because of the noise in the halls and in the adjoining rooms. Do not stay in a room near the elevators on the 18th floor. The main elevators go to the 18th floor and people must change to ride up to the penthouse. The noise near the elevators is much worse than in rooms further away. Very little security to stop people running up and down the halls late at night. No restrooms in the very small lobby. Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible facilities. Rude staff. Creepy management.”
Reviews.Author: delphi_ote
Reviews.Content: My bad experience started with this hotel when I arrived 15 minutes after check in time. I was told by a staff member that it would be available in 20 minutes. After waiting 25 minutes in the lobby, I asked again. I was told to wait another 15 minutes. When the room was still unavailable, I asked to speak to management. Instead of offering to help, the manager tried to trick me into switching my reservation to a smaller room for the same price. He came up with the most ludicrous explanations as to why the room wasn't ready yet (asking for a two twin beds is a "special accommodation"?) When I wouldn't accept the room change, he offered to buy me a drink, like spending time with him was the most exciting thing a traveler to the French Quarter could find. The bathroom was dirty and poorly maintained. The doorknob was broken, trapping people inside. The elevators were out of service and slow. The internet connection was terrible. The staff never really apologized for anything that went wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: punkissodead
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! I couldn't have asked for a better location. The only time we had to take a taxi was to the airport. It is right in the French quarter, one street over from bourbon and much quieter. We walked everywhere- the casino, riverwalk, new Orleans arena and everywhere in the french quarter. We needed to get to audubon park one day and the st Charles streetcar took us directly there for only 1.25 and it was only a few minute walk to the streetcar. The hotel is very clean, the beds are comfortable and the concierge was helpful. The only downside us that there us sometimes a wait for an elevator. Don't take or rent a car because parking is $20/day and driving seems to be terrible! The pool is nice and there is also a small fitness center with a couple treadmills and some dumbbells. I'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for Cruisers”
Reviews.Author: vlfair
Reviews.Content: We booked the Cruise & Park package. We arrived in NOLA on Friday afternoon and parked the car in the attached garage. The location is great. A short walk to the quarter (just around the corner from Acme Oyster House). My husband lived in NOLA for a while and we visit every so often and know this was a great location. The hotel is very secure, you need a key to access the floors with rooms. Our room was great, two double beds fit our family of 4 just fine. The accommodations were very comfortable. My only complaint would be that the elevator was very slow. On Saturday morning, we walked around a bit and when we returned to the hotel they got us a cab to the cruise terminal. After seeing the massive line to get into the cruise terminal parking garage we realized we made a great choice!! Upon disembarking today, we caught a cab straight back to the hotel, loaded our stuff into the car, let the desk staff know we were there to get our car and we were gone. (The boat cleared customs at 8AM and we were on the freeway home at 9:15AM).

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mdboutte
Reviews.Content: We loved the location as it is right in the middle of everything. Parking was good because you park your own car and take the elevator straight to your room. As another poster stated, we stayed on the 20th floor so you had to take the elevator up to the 18th---get off and get on the "gold" elevator in order to get to the 19th and 20th floor. This was an inconvenience especially carrying things because you had to switch elevators. Staff was awesome! The only problem is when you exit there are two convenience stores across the street where rif-raf hang out. They are very loud and screeming at people to walk around them. Police need to patrol this area. One instance was a guy taking off his shirt to fight. Perhaps if policemen patrolled this area they could rid the area of these kinds. Beds were very comfortable. Checkered Parrot is the adjacent sports bar where we watched the Super Bowl. Very Crowded and many televisions. Food was very good for a sports bar.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, had a good experience”
Reviews.Author: spam3809
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from Jan 13-16, 2011 with a friend for Bourbon Street nightlife and walking around the city. It is very close to Bourbon Street and some restaurants so it is convenient. Also not a bad walk to the casino. At times you will have to walk a little to get places, and you may be in a very urban environment, but this is a city! Walking is expected. The area right outside the hotel looks a little shady, especially at night, so do watch your money closely!! Be careful. A friend of mine who owns a business in the city did say though that the street this hotel is on is safe, and the police station is very close. A variety of restaurants are nearby, from fast food to expensive. I loved this hotel location. Also we wanted a hotel that probably would not be haunted, so we liked the Holiday Inn for this reason as well! Our room was on the opposite side of where Bourbon Street is, (not on the side of where the hotel entrance is), so I am sure this reduced some street noise. We looked out to a small alleyway and were on the 10th floor, so while we did hear some noise (people, trucks) it was not too bad. The hotel is in the center of it all, so you will hear some trucks and other city traffic. Overall the hotel is very basic - do not stay here if you are looking for true luxury or extras, hotel history, stories, etc... It has a small, plain lobby area (it often gets busy with lots of people who have had a few drinks, but that is New Orleans!) It is not as exciting as other hotels but we got such a deal on this place we had to stay there. They have 3 computers for internet use right in front of the elevators. The hotel does not charge you, but they do not provide chairs either -interesting! The pool is on the 10th floor, with a small fitness room. We did not have a car because parking at the hotel is expensive. The front desk staff, doormen, and concierge were all helpful and friendly. We also did not bother them too much either, so I am sure this helped.... we just kept to ourselves. We asked for a 30 minute extension on check out and they said it would be ok. As far as cleanliness, I found it to be fine and I like things really clean all the time. You can request new towels each day or use them again. We checked for bedbugs immediately upon entering the room - and whew! No bugs although I did still check carefully the next few days. Only bad thing was the toilet seat was a bit wobbly. We had a little trouble getting the toilet to flush one time and I called the front desk. When they send someone up, they call you first to let you know a maintenance person is waiting outside. He was very nice, and was there to do the very unpleasant job of fixing a toilet - but he said "No problem, this is my job" and he was still smiling. When he leaves, the front desk calls you again to confirm that he fixed it to your satisfaction. They have a restaurant as well, which is fine - we ate there for breakfast when the other places were full. The service, food, etc were average to pretty good. Large meals and plenty of TV's to watch a game. It has an island theme. We had a good experience here! I know some reviews are really bad though but it was fine for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, nice stay”
Reviews.Author: JetsetTX
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn French Quarter for the first time on the long MLK holiday weekend, which also happened to be the weekend of my birthday. I've lost track of how many times I've been in New Orleans but this was my first stay at this hotel. It's a block from Bourbon Street so it is a good location. It is on the edge of the French Quarter a half block from Canal Street. I usually prefer to be a little further inside the quarter but the prices everywhere else were outrageous for this weekend so we decided to stay here. Check in at the front desk was pretty fast and very friendly. The room was average in size but did have a pretty big bathroom. We were on the 19th floor, which required an elevator transfer on the 18th floor, the main elevators stop there and you have to change to another elevator to get to the 19th or 20th. Thought that was kind of strange and by the time we left it was downright annoying, especially with a bit of a hangover. The hotel was very nice overall, parking was reasonable (for New Orleans) at $26. And if you use your car while you are there, which we didn't, you can take the elevator from the garage to your floor. The room was very clean as was the bathroom, except for the small stain on the comforter which really wasn't a comforter, I don't know what to call it actually, but that wasn't very visible. The rooms, on our floor at least, seemed to be cleaned later in the day. Once we had left for a late breakfast around noon, came back and they still weren't done. When we walked back out we asked at the front desk and they said they would contact housekeeping and later on when we got back they were done. Another day, we came back to find one of the cleaners at the end of the hall and had to ask for towels because though our room had been cleaned they had only left one towel. But hey, it's the big easy everyone's kinda laid back about things. The beds were very comfortable. I did have a problem with the curtains which did not close all the way so if light is a problem for you in the morning when you're still trying to sleep, you might bring clips or something to hold the curtains together to let less light in. Also, they could be a little longer so light doesn't come in through the bottom too. Overall it was a nice stay at a good price and I would definitely stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Beds very comfy”
Reviews.Author: ammamom
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed one night prior to our cruise because of the 7 night free cruise parking. After reading the reviews i was a little worried. Our room was on the 19th floor which required us to use 2 elevators to get there. Our room was clean and beds were great, the front desk staff was great at check in and when i used a safety depoist box, we were allowed to check in early around 2:30. The area bars and shop were good if you like to party, but with kids we were back by 8 pm. McDonalds across the street was REALLY BAD!!!

Reviews.Title: “The newly revamped rooms are great!”
Reviews.Author: VulcanProbe
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a year ago - the rooms were dingy but clean. This year I was in a recently renovated room on the 18th floor and it was excellent. Terrific location, service was good. Tremendous value overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: Micole75
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff were very friendly. Our King room on the 18th floor was very Large. I would definetly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Meh...it was okay”
Reviews.Author: Stirken
Reviews.Content: It was okay. it was loud at night (we stayed on the weekend) It was excellent excellent excellent location. I read on one of the reviews it was dirty... but our room was always nice and clean. They cleaned every day. The service was okay. Next time, i may try out a different hotel...but would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Experience”
Reviews.Author: Zhorshik
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, our room was ready and we were allowed to check-in even though it was 11 am. Staff was very courteous and professional, room was clean and acceptable. You couldn't ask for a more convenient location in the French Quarter and the concierge was knowledgeable and helpful. We requested late check out and it was granted, very appreciative for that.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel room okay”
Reviews.Author: shiptrip
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this location because we were cruising the next morning out of NOLA and they included parking for our cruise. Since parking at the pier is 16.00 a night, that was 112.00 we saved. (of course after the 20.00 we spent each way to get to the pier which is mere blocks away, the savings was really more like 72.00. We spent a Saturday night at 169.00 before tax. We were upgraded to a suite upon check in. We were also told not to drink the water as there was a problem with the city water and they gave us two bottled waters. Upon arrival to our room, there was an old, worn sofa and chair in the sitting area and an old style small TV with poor reception, The bathroom was lacking towels and had used soap in the soap dish in the shower. Yuck. We reported our lack of towels and the fact that the maid skipped some steps, and they brought us some towels. We had no other issues other than the alarm clock would not work and made strange noises periodically. Also, we had no safe in the room, so we had to go down and get a safe deposit box to use. Since we had documents such as passports, tickets, etc. I was not comfortable leaving them in the room. After a great night of dinner, music, and drinks on the town, we walked back to our room. Elevators are slow but work. Front office staff was courteous. I would stay there again because of location if they had specials like what we got with 8 nights of free parking. It is just not modern but will certainly suffice for a night in the big easy.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service SUPER!!”
Reviews.Author: vermontforever
Reviews.Content: We arrived in New Orleans late on a rainy night with no reservations for a place to stay. That's not unusual for us - we are habitually spontaneous travelers. After driving around and stopping at numerous big name hotels, checking prices and learning about the parking fees we then tried the Holiday Inn. Linda Brown who was working that night was so nice and very accomodating. After being treated not so favorably at other establishments she made us feel special. She offered us an unbelievable rate for a top floor room for 4 nights and parking was included. She was unbelievable! She deserves a bonus and kudos for her kindness and pleasant attitude. Holiday Inn is lucky to have her. She is making them look good. Our stay was wonderful. Our room was quiet and clean; we could not have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: QuipQue
Reviews.Content: A very good location but I won't go back. I often stay at holiday inns and never had such a bad experience. The hotel staff are very rude and the hotel is dirty all over the place. The smell in the room and hallways is unbearable. Very noisy also. I am a priority club member and booked a higher rate to get a bonus which I never received. Front desk claimed they 'never heard of that rate' although I showed them a printout. Still had to pay the higher rate. Don't go there.

Reviews.Title: “Great room”
Reviews.Author: tapooh
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure I'd get a room with a king size bed, but wound up with a king sized room! The room had a separate seating area. It was a very nice room. Only negatives were the wait until after 4 pm to check in, the lobby was full of people waiting, and the awful parrot restaurant attached to the hotel. I had a surly waitress and poor tasing chips, queso, & salsa in a very loud restaurant while waiting to be able to check in.

Reviews.Title: “good location, impolite staffs, dirty room”
Reviews.Author: hcc777
Reviews.Content: We stayed four days in this hotel. Location is good, close to famous restaurants and main roads. However, maybe English is not our first language, we met several front desk staff in the evening and night shifts are impolite, unwelcoming, and impatient. They were not willing to answer our very polite and easy questions or even gave us a look!! But we saw the same staffs (only several staffs, not all staffs) that they could put smiles on their faces to the other white and black people. It was very ridiculous!! Our room always had musty smell, disgusting, and dirty. They forgot to clean our room one day. Except the location, I wonâ€™t recommend to â€œyellowâ€� people unless you want to be racially treated.

Reviews.Title: “1st trip to NOLA”
Reviews.Author: eriickah
Reviews.Content: Very good customer service with everyone we dealt with at the hotel. Loved our maids, who left us many extras towels every day because we wanted so many!

Reviews.Title: “good location , disgusting hotel”
Reviews.Author: ninachris07
Reviews.Content: The only reason we stayed at this hotel was because we were meeting up with friends in New orleans and wanted to stay in the same hotel, when we arrived it was hard to park our car, then we went to our room, the whole floor we were staying on smelt bad and so did our room, so much so that it was hard to sleep! but the floor our friends stayed on didnt smell. The bathroom was dirty , the room we had was huge but the largness of the room did not make up for the fact that it was just gross. Our iron didnt work and neither did the tv. Overall not a nice hotel in our opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay what you would expect”
Reviews.Author: suphee
Reviews.Content: We traveled to new Orleans with a 6 and 3 year old for a wedding, wedding was great Hotel was ok. Room was not cleaned one day, seemed a bit dirty at times....pool was a big hit. Also seemed to have a smell of smoke thru the vents in room at night. If you can sleep thru sirens and smoke this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Room Housekeeping Not So Good”
Reviews.Author: ShortyPipes
Reviews.Content: The room was average. I was really disappointed because I thought there would be a hot tub since there was an indoor pool. No such luck. We left a tip every day and yet we got poor housekeeping service. One wash cloth one day, no coffee another. The location however was terrific. Walking distance to most attractions that we were interested in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Service”
Reviews.Author: redstickredneck
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several time and have always been very pleased. The staff are always very friendly and helpful. The hotel is a bit older and shows her age in some places but it is always very clean and comfortable. There is a security feature in the elevator which makes it difficult for someone who is not a guest to enter the guest floors and that really helps bring peace of mind. Convenient parking at the hotel and the location cannot be beat. Only a block from Bourbon Street, easy walking distance to the casino and surrounding by great places to eat for every budget. I highly recommend this hotel for those on a budget who can't quite swing the more expensive properties. It's clean, comfortable, staffed by a great people and a great bargain.

Reviews.Title: “The staff rocks.”
Reviews.Author: tfendersondhs
Reviews.Content: Thanks to all the front staff representatives who helped to make my stay most enjoyable. Much appreciation to the manager Shana for all of her help.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great courtyard pool, easy access to French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: crosscountrytrip
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed for one night and found the rooms to be clean throughout and the beds were some the most comfortable of any hotel. Our room had a shared balcony that looked over the street with a little table. The courtyard pool was perfect for a night swim. The location was perfect just a few blocks to all the sites. I chose to save a few dollars and park my car at a garage down the street one block. Everything went fine but if I had it to do over I would leave with the valet service at the Holiday Inn for ease and peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't bother unless it's your last option”
Reviews.Author: diva_enroute
Reviews.Content: I had to go to New Orleans for a convention and I didn't have a choice for hotels since my colleagues booked it for me. When I first heard I was going to the big easy, I was very worried because 2 weeks prior there were plenty of news articles on bed bugs and this was one of the hot spots. I did a bit of research and it seemed there were indeed reports at this hotel. When I arrived, I was underwhelmed with the very basic lobby area. I was put on the 19th floor and this was most annoying because you have to take 2 elevators to get there. The room was large but it was very dark and the furnishing was very old and you could see it hadn't been renovated in many years. I immediately pulled off all the sheets and mattress pads and started my bed bug inspection. After 45 minutes I concluded that the bed was safe to sleep on which I was grateful for. However, I was disgusted to see the stains, hairs, dust and food that was in and around the bed and even underneath the mattress pad. The washroom was relatively clean except for the washroom door, you could see on the light paint, all these fingerprints - you could see exactly where someone put their hands. It was quite disgusting so I had to resort to opening the door with my foot. The room was very basic, no dry cleaning service, no room security box and the TV was a regular projection style. The clock was also so bright that there was a blue aura when I tried to sleep. The following days, I would sporadically receive new towels and there was one day the tub was not cleaned as I saw my hair from the morning still in the drain. And on the third day, there was some sort of larger red bug that was crawling on the toilet seat. It prompted me to do another bug inspection but it seemed to be the only one there. The housekeeping service was inconsistent and the front desk people weren't very helpful and you shouldn't expect them to have any sense of urgency. Their attitude is almost like you are "bothering" them with your request. I paid $145/night and felt even at that price I was overpaying for what I got. The hotel restaurant, the Checkered Parrot was worse and the noise from the street was abysmal. The only thing this hotel had going for it was it's awesome location. Sorry no pictures this time...probably would have scared you to death anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: villald
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, I stayed 2 nights for the NFL game, conveniently located near a Walgreens, a grocery store, restaurants and just one block from Bourbon St.

Reviews.Title: “One star”
Reviews.Author: wballardjr
Reviews.Content: Awful! This supposed three star hotel reminded me of a Motel 6 or Best Western! Whomever chose three stars should revisit this hotel! Awful! Awful trashy looking room, trashy looking hallways, elevators, overall looked trashy, rundown just like above mentioned hotels.

Reviews.Title: “They gave us a key to someone elses room - scary!!!”
Reviews.Author: missmellysue
Reviews.Content: Slowest & dirtest lifts ever, which we had to reuse & then we had to re-queue because they gave us a key to someones room!!! How scary is that, I never felt secure there & locked everything away in my case when I went out (especially my tooth brush!) I was not suprised to read a review that someone was robbed there after what happened to us!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location and service”
Reviews.Author: g0lf73
Reviews.Content: Prior to going to new orleans i read reviews for this hotel which i was going to be staying at and was cautiously worried as some of the reviews were not very flattering towards the holiday inn. For myself and my friend who stayed here labor day weekend, those negative reviews couid not be any further from reality. We arrrived early around noon and were quickly accommodated. We were able to check in early and they honored my request of two beds that i previously contacted them about. It is not only close to all the action of the city but a great value. I paid $60/night for this hotel on a holiday weekend which was an absolute steal. The service was great and staff was friendly and helpful. I have to laugh at some ot these negative reviews pointing out a slow elevator or it had a regular tv and not a flatscreen. You have to be kidding right haha if you are that picky nothing would be good enough for you. For me at least, I can honestly say i had a wonderful experience at the Holiday Inn French Quarter and look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel with the most un-caring staff.”
Reviews.Author: traveller201003
Reviews.Content: Definitely would not recommend this hotel. As we had booked a Holiday Inn, we didn't have any doubts about this hotel. How wrong we were! The hotel is completely run down and in need of a complete renovation. The lifts were terrible and would stop randomly and go up and down on their own with doors that wobbled and didn't make you feel safe at all, especially as half of them looked as though they were part of a building site! The rooms were dated, dull and depressing! The crux of the problem though were the completely un-caring staff who were just not bothered with helping. The hotel advertises guest laundry facilities, and having been travelling for a month already, we booked this hotel primarily so we could easily do our laundry. When we checked in we were told that the laundry was on the 12th floor - perfect. So, the next day we went downstairs (from the 18th floor) to get change for the machines and double checked which floor it was on. We went up to the 12th floor with all our laundry to be greeted with a complete building site and builders who just looked at us and couldn't speak English. We thought it couldn't be the right floor, so went all the way downstairs to check. Again, we were told it was safe to walk on that floor (?!) and so went back up. Got out of the lift where one of the builders just stared at us and then replied he took the laundry machines out a week before. Covered in plaster we returned back downstairs where the staff were completely unapologetic and didn't care in the slightest. I seriously do not believe we should have been able to walk on that floor as all of the builders were wearing breathing masks and we could not believe we were told it was safe, and lied to about the laundry machines. We were so annoyed we phoned down again to ask what they could do to help us (e.g. pay for transport to the nearest launderette) but they didn't care and said there was nothing we could do. It was appalling customer service and would definitely not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “make sure your door latches”
Reviews.Author: docholiday84
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the holiday inn for 5 nights in May. When we awoke on Mother's Day we realized that we had been robbed while sleeping in our room. They were not worried about getting caught because they went through my wallet and my girlfriend's purse and only took what they wanted. They even put my wallet back in my pants. We noted that unless we pushed/pulled our door shut, it would not latch. Hotel security "investigated" and stated that there was no evidence that we had been robbed. They offered nothing, even though they knew we had no money or credit cards(not even a meal at their restaurant). Pretty scary experience. We feel it was likely in inside job, because who else is pushing on a door at the end of a hall to see if it opens in the middle of the night? Not sure why a Holiday Inn would have no security cameras in the halls. It could have turned out a lot worse(thankfully we didn't wake up), but we're disturbed about the lack of security in a large chain hotel in an area where crime is not unheard of. We'll be back in NOLA in October, but we won't be staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We had a very bad experience at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JohnelnWeldon
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms in the Holiday Inn French Quarter. When we went up to our rooms - one of the rooms was not made up and the other room was already occupied. We went back down to the reception and got 2 other rooms. These rooms were fine - but the idea that reception might make another mistake and we could have someone else walking into our room really spoilt our stay here. The hotel is in a great location - close to the heart of all the action in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and cruise parking package”
Reviews.Author: cruisewithkaren
Reviews.Content: Service was great, got to check in early as room was ready. Got the 16th floor (room 1634) in an oversized renovated room so four of us were very comfortable. Easy walking distance to major attractions and streetcar stops. Safe parking lot and better rate that pier parking.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: KC2121Texas
Reviews.Content: Elevators are horrible. There's one set of elevators that goes from the lobby, through the parking garage, and to the rooms so they're ALWAYS full of people with luggage. More than once the doors would open and they would be completely full so you'd have to wait for the next one. Did I mention there's only 3 elevators? Apparently the hotel is built in an old parking garage... that's all I can figure out. When we got off the elevator on our floor, we had to go up no less than 3 sets of stairs while navigating the halls. These aren't huge sets -- maybe 5 stairs eatch at the most -- but still a total pain when you're trying to drag your luggage around. Rooms were a decent size and the patio we had that connected the rooms was neat. However, there were 6 rooms connected to the patio and if you had neighbors out there, the sound just kind of echoed into your room. We all had trouble with our air conditioners. I realize NOLA in August is hot, but I've stayed in other hotels in the area and always managed to cool off our room. The staff (the few we saw) were very unhelpful and almost rude. Parking was $26.95 a night and we like to have not found a spot!

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: RetiredMilitary
Reviews.Content: Was in NOLA attending a conference at another hotel--the conference hotel was booked and this one was close. Not real impressed with the smells of the street when arriving, but front desk people were very nice. Hotel has 20 floors, but the top two floors are not accessible by the main elevator--my room was on the 19th floor. From the lobby, you ride the elevator to the 18th floor (have to use a room key first before selecting the floor)--that elevator is air conditioned. On the 18th floor, you exit the elevator, walk to your right, and get on another elevator for 19 & 20--that elevator is not air conditioned. The heat index was 108 and humidity was high, so the transition on the 18th floor and the elevator ride to 19 were uncomfortable, to say the least. 19th floor was hot and humid, until entering the guest room, which was air conditioned to about 68 degrees and no humidity--what a difference! Pool is not on the roof top--it's on the 10th floor. Soda machines on the guest floors are $2 for a 20 oz bottle of Coke--save your cash, go to the store across the street from the main hotel lobby doors (store's name is Unique) and buy your drinks there. Meals are available in the Checkered Parrot restaurant adjacent to the hotel. Hotel offered passes for free breakfast buffet at the CP, but I didn't take advantage of it. Lunch at the CP was pretty good--had the nachos and chicken tacos--about $10 each but not bad in quality, and ample in quantity. The air con in the guest rooms is one of the older units that continuously blows unless you turn it off--no thermostat. The beds are comfortable, good selection of cable TV channels. The door in the bathroom is a little hard to deal with and gets in the way a lot. Bring your own pants hangars--my room had none and housekeeping had no extras. Wi-fi connection is weak, and there is no wired internet in the rooms, so page load times can be slow. There are two wi-fi channels-both are slow. There is one computer in the lobby with a printer (their version of a business center) but someone was always on it, playing games. I didn't hear my neighbors, but with the air con unit going all the time (did I mention that the heat index was 108 and humidity was high?) who could hear the neighbors? In the lobby, if you want something from the hotel, TJ is your man!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: TN-610
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in August 2010 for a quick vacation. Perfect Location. Hotel sits on Canal Street one block from Bourbon Street. Both the Canal Street and the St. Charles Street Streetcars are right across the street. The French Quarter is an easy walk. The hotel itself is just "ok." The staff was friendly and efficent. The room was clean. But thats about it. The room was just the basics, cheap pillows, no refrigerator and no microwave. I'm a Priority Club Platinum Member and received no room upgrade, or free breakfast etc. For the location and the low price.. it was worth it to me.

Reviews.Title: “I would do it again!”
Reviews.Author: c3119
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right where the action is. It is one block from Bourbon and half a block to Canal. Plus if you are taking a cruise they offer a park & cruise package. The parking garage is covered and secure. We had no problems. We didn't like that our room wasn't ready but it was totally understandable. We just put everything in our travel mates room. The elevators only work if you have a room card. Very important to remember if you are racing back to your room to use the restroom and plus the hotel gets really packed in the evening before the cruise and early morning day of the cruise. There are dozen restaurants within walking distance including a 99 cent atm and conveniece store. We were not scared or treated weird and everyone was very welcoming. Our room was basic. No it isn't a 4 star but they had everything we needed. You can't ask for much in the French Quarter because all of the buildings are old. We heard n noise from the street and slept well.

Reviews.Title: “a great choice”
Reviews.Author: minimusSwindon
Reviews.Content: The many varied reviews for this hotel reflect all the possibilities- our experience was first class. Taking advantage of an excellent special offer for July, we were upgraded to a bi-level room with a queen bed upstairs and relaxation lounge on the lower level; it was comfortable, with some style. The hotel is well placed for all the sights in the French Quarter, staff are helpful, and it lives up to its published descriptions.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: ceil14011
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect. walked to all attractions and restaurants. room average, hotel stay very helpful. The biggest plus for this hotel is the location.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel and Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: ClarkeInc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel yesterday for one night and booked 3 rooms for me and some friends. We were in town for an event that was held in New Orleans. From when we entered the hotel thier were issues. The wait in the garage ranged from 10 to 15 minutes just to go down one level on the elevators. We parked on the 2nd floor and we tried to take the stairs but it said "Employees Only" just for one more level. The best part of the hotel was our check in and assistance with the guest service agent Toya, she was always smiling and willing to help out no matter how busy it was. A lot of the other workers had a horrible attutide, so not the southern hospitality you would think you would encounter in the deep south. The worst for me and my friends were when we requested another iron, the housekeeper which was a male who delivered the iron barged into our room without even asking to come in to swap out the irons. Overall I wished I would have stayed in the W Hotel on Poydras as I did before, my friends will never make me incharge of making reservations again because of this experience. On a positive note, the location was great. You are literally right around the corner from Bourbon Street, but also watch out for the roaches in your rooms because I had some as well and my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: jkbm
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 6 women - sisters and daughters - on a long weekend getaway. The Holiday Inn was just right for us. We had read several bad reviews and did not see any of the negatives referred to in those reviews. Our rooms were clean and very nice, not fancy but we didn't need a fancy room in New Orleans. Staff members were courteous and helpful. We had no trouble checking in (we did not get adjoining rooms as we had requested), we never had to wait longer than about 5 minutes for the elevator and we found the liquor store across the street quite convenient. Previous reviews had complained about that. The location was perfect - one block from Bourbon Street and within walking distance of the Riverwalk. We traveled on Amtrak so the hotel was a short cab ride from the station. We had a great time and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: lobdgt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for essence fest 2010; of ALL the places we have stalyed in N.O this is by FAR the worst; the lobby is small; The entrance doors were COVERED in finger prints; the fire alarm went off at some point EVERY day and our room.........and the decor......DREADFUL. Stains all over floor. I was scared I would catch a foot fungus if I didn't have on shoes!!! For the price we payed to stay there for an event weekend, we were grossly over charged. Wouldn't stay here again if it were free.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: mjdc0919
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one of my friend's weddings. She had a block of rooms at several hotels in New Orleans but I found the cheapest price for this one through Orbitz. While it wasn't the worst hotel out there I have definitely stayed at better. We weren't really going for a fancy room though-we just needed a safe, quiet place to sleep and get ready and the rest of the time we knew we'd be super busy so why waste the money? The positives: they are in a great location for walking around the French Quarter and to Harrah's Casino. It was also quiet which is something I always worry about when staying right in the French Quarter. And the bathroom toiletries were Bath and Body Works brand so that was actually impressive. They have a good amount of pillows on the beds which was also nice. The negatives: we checked in on a Friday afternoon and apparently so was everyone else. We didn't have a line to check in but it took a while to get an elevator b/c there were only three and everyone was using them to go from parking to their rooms, etc. They aren't air conditioned either so its pretty hot with a crowd. Our room was supposedly "no smoking" but when we got in it reeked of smoke so bad I got a headache. I told the front desk and they did come spray some air freshener while we were at dinner. The beds were hard and there was an unopened condom box under one of them-that freaked me out b/c it made me wonder how well the room was even cleaned?! The bathroom smelled like mildew and just didn't feel clean. The hair dryer had hair tangled in it as did the shower drain. On our second day-day of the wedding-they cleaned our room late and when we came back to start getting ready they took our dirty towels but did not replace them with any clean ones. When I called the front desk they said it be about 15 min. to get some to us. An hour later my husband went down to the desk and said he needed them b/c they never brought them up. That even took a while. About 15 min. after he returned, someone from housekeeping brought some up as well so we had about 10 towels! They are very unorganized. The carpets looked very dingy in the room and hallways. There is also only one way in and out of the paid parking garage (which is standard I know) but people seemed to be confused about paying and it held the line of cars up. Other than that we had a nice stay. We love New Orleans and look forward to going back but we won't ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Standard chain hotel in great condition - plus an unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: chalupacabra
Reviews.Content: I spend as much time in the area as I can, but had never tried the Holiday Inn. I found this hotel through one of those "mystery hotel" options on a travel website, and honestly, I was a little disappointed when I saw the name. I kept thinking "Of all the amazing historical spots, I end up with a Holiday Inn?!" However, the price couldn't be beat and the location is absolutely ideal. It's right there on Royal, near all these gorgeous antique shops, galleries, etc., and very convenient to literally everything cool. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the hotel, actually, especially considering how affordable it was. Make no mistake - it doesn't have the atmosphere or old-world glamour thing going, but I can't understand other reviews that say it was awful. I feel bad for those people, but our experience couldn't have been further from that. The room was spacious, very clean, with comfortable beds and it was just what we needed. If you're in a city like New Orleans, you probably don't want to spend a ton of time in your room anyway. It is popular with some rowdy folks, so expect brief episodes of loud talking as frat boys stumble down the hallway to their rooms, but that only lasts a minute or two. It certainly isn't enough to detract from the overall value. While I wouldn't choose this hotel for a romantic weekend with my husband, it was perfect for a girlfriends getaway. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Absoluetly the worst hotel in the french quarters DO NOT BE FOOLED BY THE PICTURES THAT YOU SEE”
Reviews.Author: terrimotherlove
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived the lobby was beautiful, thinking well if this is just the lobby you can only imagine what the room would look like, we were sadly WRONG! This is a hotel from hell! When we first went in we pulled the covers back to check out the bed and the comforter had pee and buggers or some type of food all over it and when we called house keeping he had the audacity to ask me if this was like this when we came in, mind you he just saw us check in 5 MINUTES AGO! the next thing was the bathroom it had hair all over the floor and it had a big whole and crack in the shower to where you could put your hand in it, then the furniture looked like an alligator had been chewing on it, just the whole room in general looked nothing like the brochure you see online! then we went to the pool and before you even enter the smell is so strong that the people who were in it had to be drunk. So we had to stay one night but after that we checked out! And straight from the taxi driver who has been living in New Orleans all her life told us "This is the worst hotel to stay in in the french quarters"

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: SoCalC8
Reviews.Content: I'm here right now (June 22, 2010) it's a Tuesday and my room was only $79.95, they gave me my parking for free as well as internet. I can't complain at all. Our view is great and it's way quiet. The location rocks and I'm absolutely happy.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: kekbaldw
Reviews.Content: decent hotel ... not great, but you can't beat the location. Nothing in this section of the city is 100% fantastic, but you're barely in your room in NOLA anyways. was cheap, and clean.

Reviews.Title: “They have Bed Bugs Here”
Reviews.Author: chayler
Reviews.Content: I think the title says it all. My room had Bed Bugs. Not the experience you want, nor that I expected. Also the elevators are horribly slow and have no AC.

Reviews.Title: “Good tourist hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Aguilas
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a good location, just one block from Bourbon Street so despite warnings of where to go and where not to go at night the area felt very safe as there were plenty of people around. Upon arrival we were given our room numbers and then had to wait almost 2 hours for our cases to be delivered. We did go looking for them but they seemed to have vanished into the bowels of the hotel. When they arrived there was profuse apologies from the porter however it seemed that we were not alone and more than half of our tour group also had to wait a very long time for their luggage. The day we were due to check out we arranged along with the rest of our party a late departure as the hotel was almost empty. Between 9.30 and 10.30 we had 3 people check what time we were leaving so the room could be cleaned. This was a bit of a joke as the room had NOT been cleaned in the 3 days we stayed there. The first day nobody came, the second day we saw a maid at 3.00 who just changed the towels as we had just rushed back in because of a thunder storm. On the 3rd day we got back to our room at 4.00 to get ready for the evening and nobody had been to make the beds or change towels. Therefore it seemed ludicrous that 3 people should want to clean early in the morning when we had a 2.00 checkout. We had not been singled out for this erratic cleaning routine, it seemed that the other members of our tour had also had their rooms cleaned at odd times or not at all !!! Our room was pleasant but the air conditioning very cold and noisy and could not be adjusted so was switched off at night which made the room hot, so no happy medium. It also smelt of cigarettes when we arrived although this is supposed to be a non-smoking hotel. I didn't have any issues with the lifts but several people complained about how slow they were. The lobby was nice if a bit on the small side and there was a guy who helped with using the wifi for printing airline tickets which we all needed for our return journey. He let us do it ourselves but was on hand to point out the quirks of their printer. Overall a pretty good tourist hotel in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: swd5
Reviews.Content: My experience at this hotel have aways been good. Rooms are clean and comfortable. The staff is friendly. Common area carpet do need to be cleaned or replaced.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Paul H
Reviews.Content: I've read all of the reivews. I get the sense that people for the most part over-pay for this hotel. I got my room on pricelines with all taxes and fees for $47.20/night. I would suggest to everyone that if youpay over $70/night then you will for the most part be disappointed. The hotel is run down but not terrible. It's somewhat dirty and dated and the staff generally isn't very helpful. BUT if you pay very little for the hotel like I did you will take all of these things with a grain of salt. I had a large room on the 12th floor. It was a smoking room with a king sixed bed & a sleeper sofa at the other end. Again, very large room. It wasn't very clean when I arrived, but I generally over look these things when paying so little for a room. I arrived at 1pm much before check-in time and had no problem getting the room right away. I didn't have any issues with the elevators. They aren't as slow as some people say and there are 3 of them. The lobby downstairs is pretty nice. The location is close to Bourbon which is a big plus. it's across the street from a cheap liquore store so the people hanging around there may make some people nervous. The wifi was very good and they have free papers downstairs. Also a note, they have washing machines & dryers on the 12th floor so if you need to do a little laundry there you go. Overall people, PLEASE don't over-spend for this hotel. It's a mainstay on Priceline and you can get it cheap. I was shocked when a gentleman in the elevator told me he paid $159.99 for his room and I paid $112.79 less per night. You will hate this hotel if you spend that much. If you get the room on priceline email the hotel direct after. They are very good about responding to your specific requests.

Reviews.Title: “Roaches in Bathroom and on Night Table”
Reviews.Author: ABC3656
Reviews.Content: I was in town for my nephew's graduation from Tulane. Folks should explore the residential neighborhoods and smaller retail districts of NOLA as well as enjoying as much of the French Quarter as you can stand. On night 2, one small roach approached me in the bathroom and I smashed it and put it in a plastic cup. Another smaller roach was walking across the night table and I smashed this one with tissue and put it in the same plastic cup. At check-out the next morning, I presented the cup and contents at the front desk. The attendant was grossed out, but the manager was only willing to take 50% off of one of my 2 nights ($159.90/night) and give me free parking ($20/day). When I told the manager this was not enough discount for finding roaches in the room, she told me that this was all they were willing to do. I don't think a guest should have to pay anything for putting up with roaches in a hotel room in a major city.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Town”
Reviews.Author: gillianp
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is ideally situated in the heart of the French quarter and was the best deal ever. We were on a driving holiday working toward New Orleans. On the Saturday we crossed into Louisiana and went to the Welcome centre best move we ever made. One we found here was a festival on in the French Quarter so obviously no hotel space for saturday night so we went up river visited the Laura plantation and stayed close by. We picked up a card advertising the hotel at $55 per night free parking. Called they had space for Sunday monday and Tuesday at this rate. Parking is normally $28 dollars a night all over the quarter so we just laid in bed and laughed at our great deal. We were speedily checked in and out and the room was just fine, no problem with the parking. We had tried priceline and got nothing cheap so we were amazed at this deal. Had a great swimming pool and little gym who new you could swim in the French quarter

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Kirsty_Glenn
Reviews.Content: Location was great - right next to Bourbon St. Staff were friendly - we overslept on our final morning and staff were fine about us checking out late for no extra cost. Bed was comfortable and room was very large - lounge, bedroom, walk in robe, vanity area and bathroom. Room was a little dated but overall we had a great stay. We didn't go to New Orleans to stay in the room so would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay for 3 nights during French Quarter Festival”
Reviews.Author: JetExum
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Friday afternoon for a 3-nite stay. At checkin, I requested a non-smoking room and to be placed on an upper floor. Our room was perfect. Were placed on the 20th (highest) floor in a non-smoking room. The room was very spacious. Had a terrific view of Monteleon's terrace pool. The hotel is convenient to everything. The room was very quiet at night; slept well. Only two downsides are (1) no outdoor pool and (2) the room rate for the third night was $138 which included breakfast for two. We were given a $20 voucher to be used for two for breakfast. When we went to the restaurant for breakfast, the hostess told us that only a buffet was offered that day. The buffet cost was $12.95 per person plus taxes, plus you had to purchase a drink. So the voucher was worthless. Upon checkout, I asked the clerk if the rate of $138 was that price because it included breakfast. She said it did. I told her that the breakfast voucher was a rip-off and I wanted my rate reduced by $20. She adjusted my folio to $118. I was very pleased that that was done. Oh, couple of other things, they do not have any hair conditioner so be sure to bring your own. And parking is expensive - $26 per day!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but would not stay again.”
Reviews.Author: RosieKaPosie
Reviews.Content: We went to New Orleans for our 1st anniversary, and bid on a 3 star hotel on Priceline. We got this hotel. Given that, we can't really complain about the hotel (it looks like we got over 50% off of the hotel rates) for the money we paid. But I would never pay more than our Priceline price for this hotel, and we may contact Priceline to let them know that this is not what we would consider a 3 star hotel. Like I said, there's nothing really wrong with this hotel. It's just old and a little shabby. Our room was clean, but it wasn't updated. They had trouble with their elevators the entire weekend we were there, and they felt a little rickety every time we rode in one. The staff was helpful for the most part and parking was good ($26/night and at least there was parking). But if we go back, I will probably not stay here again. It kind of feels like the hotel knows they are in a good location and don't care if they provide a good product because people will pay for location alone. And I think I will fork over a little more money and stay at a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: okieNashville
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and comfortable though a bit small. The room could use TV upgrades. The rooms was very quiet at night. The staff was friendly. The parking garage was well lit and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lilidalla
Reviews.Content: We weren't expecting a plush hotel, so we were not disappointed in the Holiday Inn French Quarter. Our room on the 14th floor was clean and comfortable (including the bed), and the bathroom was well lit and hot water was always available. The staff was friendly and accommodating. Our housekeepers even wrote thank you notes for the daily small tips we left for them. The location could not have been better, and the price we paid through Priceline made it a very good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Like spending the night in a drunken college frat house....”
Reviews.Author: LADodger99
Reviews.Content: Run away from this property as fast as you can! The only positive about this place is the location as you're within a short distance of Bourbon Street. The negatives... this place attracts college students who like to party. The elevator was full of drunken college age students spilling drinks all over the elevator floors and along the walls of the elevator. Our room was dirty from all aspects. The bathroom had dirt and long hair on the floors. The ceiling above the television set had black residue apparently from a television that caught on fire. The carpet in the room was sticky. The bed had sheets that had hair on the pillow cases and on the lower and upper sheets. The front desk said they had no other rooms available and I could not move and handed me clean sheets to put on my bed. They didn't have anyone available to come up and clean the bathroom or anything else. This was one of the worst experiences I have ever encountered when traveling.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay during Mardi Gras - Feb. 15 through Feb. 18, 1010”
Reviews.Author: nho451524
Reviews.Content: It would be remiss of me not to write a strongly favorable review re: my three nights stay at Holiday Inn French Quarter - as I had been apprehensive as a result of the many negative reviews online. From the moment of my arrival, I found the adverse reviews to be irrelevant in terms of my experience. On arrival, there was a long queue at the check in desk; however, the reception staff worked efficiently and courteously and my wait online lasted not much longer than 30 minutes. I found the ambiance of the hotel to be warm and intimate despite its 20 floors and the other residents were very friendly and good humored (after all, it was the Mardi Gras season !). My room was absolutely pleasing, beautifully appointed, impressive maintenance and upkeep, and the bed coverlet and linens were of excellent quality. I was on the 17th floor and I never had to wait too long for the elevators. The hotel was absolutely clean and attractive in the public areas, as well as the room. There was an ice machine and soft drink machine on each floor. It was astonishing that the hotel was quiet - despite the fact that it was during Mardi Gras. I could see the intersection of Canal Street and Royal from my window and yet I was not much disturbed by the festive sounds and noise from the streets 17 floor below. I look forward to returning to New Orleans in future - and especially for Mardi Gras 2011 and will - without a doubt - secure accommodations at Holiday Inn French Quarter on Royal Street once again. My only negative observation was the brief stretch of tawdry shops, honky tonks, & mom&pop mini-grocery shops directly across the street from the main entrance of the hotel. It could be off-putting to some prospective hotel clients and it would be in the interest of the Holiday Inn corporation to either buy up those decrepit or closed "eyesores" and perform some urban renewal on those sites. Other than this factor, I bid all persons seeking desirable accommodations, an excellent location (so close to Canal and other top New Orleans sites), and a very pleasant stay to lodge at Holiday Inn French Quarter on Royal Street.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Andersona1
Reviews.Content: Close to everything and loved the heated indoor roof top pool.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Awesome”
Reviews.Author: adadont
