Reviews.Content: I was in New Orleans last year for the essence music festival.. I had a wonderful time. We stayed at the holiday inn on royal st and it was an incrdible experience. The price was very reasonable considering we booked it like 2 weeks before we got there.All the staff were friendly.And it is like a block or less away from bourbon st.Going again this year and I will be staying there again..I highly recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE OF THIS HOTEL, THEY WILL ROB YOU.......”
Reviews.Author: vonm25
Reviews.Content: Due to flight misconnections, lost luggage, having to drive from Baton Rouge to New Orleans then arriving only to find they had give our two rooms up. Trying to get compensation is impossible, so if you book this hotel, make sure you call them 24 hours before arrival or they will give your room up. We booked this trip in Sept and they were paid for the rooms in October, so they had already been paid for these rooms whether we called them or not, but no, they gave up our rooms. Bad hotel, bad policy. I will NEVER stay in another Holiday Inn ANYWHERE!!!!! They have lost my business for life.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: 2shadow
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean and neat. We stayed on the 14th floor with no problems. The check in was a problem as we arrived about 4 pm and they had no rooms availble as housekeeping wae behind. They would not assign any rooms until they were cleaned. This meant waiting 2 to 3 hours for a room with reservations made 5 months ahead of time!. The manager was conviently gone. The staff did a good job handling what could of been a disater with a lobby packed full with many angry people.The attached resturant and bar was handy but limited choices but reasonable and somewhat tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located”
Reviews.Author: SheltieShetland
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 nights here over Christmas 09, Check in was smooth and friendly. Our room was on 9th floor and pretty noisy from Royal Street. On the second day we discovered the outer pane of glass on the double glazing was broken, which wouldn't help the noise. We never complained so guess can't moan too much. The room service was very late and not teribly thorough, there was nuts on the floor from previous guests, they were never cleared in the 7 days. Overall a nice budget hotel in a fantastic location, probably should've tried to change room but couldn't be bothered once settled. So if you get room 920 check the glass!

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: travelchicasara
Reviews.Content: This place was awful! we checked in, decided to nap... yellow spotted sheets. WE called down to get new sheets- housekeeping comes up and takes fitted sheet off... to reveal large urine stain! apparently our sheets weren't changed before checking in! then TV blows up= smoke smell, everything. Maintenance never comes! we switch rooms after being traumatized from laying on urine soaked sheets (fresh too... still wet!) new room= BED BUGS AND URINE WET AND DRY ON TOILET SEAT!! BLACK MOLD on bathroom ceiling... we told them about it and they sent someone up and PAINTED OVER MOLD!! THIS PLACE IS DISGUSTING! pay more for a different hotel ... TRUST ME! STAFF WAS UNFRIENDLY AND DIDN'T REFUND US STILL! WE CALLED BETTER BUSINESS BEAREU AND HEALTH DEPT!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Ducimus3
Reviews.Content: We had moderate expectations as one would expect the Holiday Inn chain to maintain reasonably high standards. The bathroom was poorly maintained (the towel rod fell off the first day and was never repaired) and the room was not cleaned for two days. The room service breakfast was cold and over priced and the elevators were a constant problem. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “housekeeping sucks, desk help is NO help”
Reviews.Author: hootiepine
Reviews.Content: Been here for 3 days now, yet to have any housekeeping. Still no fresh linens or clean room after 2 phone calls to the desk. Day 3 found a housekeeper in the hallway and asked if we could get our room cleaned. She said she'd get to it. We leave in the morning. We have a room on the 19th floor and it takes 2 different elevators to get here. Wouldn't think it would be that bothersome, but for 4 days its been a major pain. No microwave or fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, good location”
Reviews.Author: mWy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the staff was very good. I'd stay hear again. We had a baby with us and the crib they provided us had metal bars, and was a a bit small, but I'm not sure what hotels usually provide as this was my first time at a hotel with a baby. Be sure to request a room NOT directly across from the elevator! Also, they have a computer and printer for free guest use in the lobby -- nice addition.

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUGS-STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: fg1186
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a weekend due to the location and good price. Apparently I should have paid more and stayed somewhere else, because I apparently stayed in a room with bed bugs. Gross. When I found a bug on the first night, I brought it down to the front desk, but they "didn't want to see it". The next morning when I woke up covered in welt like bites, i knew that wasn't just a normal bug. I had to throw away all my clothes and my suitcase. It totally ruined my trip. I don't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very Positive Experience”
Reviews.Author: USTravelLover
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the reviews online, I was somewhat concerned about my choice of hotels in New Orleans. The Holiday Inn French Quarter on Royal St was a pleasant surprise and a very nice place to stay. Every member of the staff I encountered was courteous, helpful, and made me feel very welcome. The room/linen/bathroom were all very clean and I saw no evidence of any insect problem. I would gladly stay there again. As stated in almost every post, the location is perfect for any traveller to New Orleans wishing to see all the French Quarter has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Quite satistied”
Reviews.Author: elmasgrande
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and very good staff. This is my second trip to New Orleans and it was rewarding to find a good hotel in the French Quarter, after the big dissapointment with the "Astor Crowne Plaza" -where I had one of the worst and most bizarre experiences in my life (anyone can read my review to it in Tripadvisor, together with several others in the US and Europe). An important aspect to bear in mind is that this Holiday Inn is perfecly located if you want to party. Not if you attemp to rest -at all. But I guess that happens with all of the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “SATISFACTION”
Reviews.Author: ray0421
Reviews.Content: Linda Johnson and staff was a great help with getting us on our way. She help get the audubon experience package for us so we could start our trip,and directions to and from each place ,that was a great help.And Linda mention a nice place to eat it was not to far and the street cars was a big help

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here again!!!”
Reviews.Author: lacour
Reviews.Content: Not a nice place to stay if you are looking for clean! Front desk clerks are ok-management-all levels- not so good....This is not your tipical Holiday Inn....they don't have a clue about customer service!!!!! This is evident in the previous reviews!!!

Reviews.Title: “The staff were friendly and courteous”
Reviews.Author: penniebaby4422
Reviews.Content: My stay at this holiday inn was very pleasant. Check-in time was at 5pm but I got there at noon and the staff checked me in with no problems. The girl behind the desk, Arlesha, was so friendly and gave me some great advice on what to see and do on my first trip to New Orleans. I ate at Deanie's seafood and had so much food leftover I brought her some back! The second day my room was serviced but I had no towels but when I called down for some they apologized and brought them right up.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: djnovick
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Hotwire and I have to admiit I was very scared when I found out we were staying at this hotel. The reviews were very bad. I was pleasantly surprised. The room was remodeled and in good shape with a nice view. The staff was nice and provided good service. The location was very good and you cannot beat the price for what you get. The only issues I had was the hallway on our floor was not air conditioned and the pool was cold and murky. The fitness center could use more equipement. But hey we did not have time to work out anyway. Some people said the elevators were slow. I would not say they were super fast but I did not have a problem. Overall a very good stay

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of Negatives, not very many positives!”
Reviews.Author: Breakpoint
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through a convention plan. The location is convenient, being in the French Quarter, and only a block from Canal St. The problem with this hotel is not location it is the facility and staff. I was given a room on the 19th floor. As it turns out the 19th - 21st floor cannot be reached by the 3 main elevators. You need to travel to the 18th floor, exit, go to a single elevator to access the upper floors. This one elevator is slow and unairconditioned. If you like the smell of sweat and mold this elevator will be perfect for you. The elevators in general operated so poorly that there was a regular queue in the lobby just to go to your room. I can't speak for the other floors, but the 19th floor was an oven. Thank God, the air conditioning worked in my room. As far as the service, it was atrocious. On my second morning I discovered that I had one bath towel, that's it. There were two people staying in the room, so I called down to get more towels. The next day, I came back to the room, and had no towels, I complained, received no apology, but got about 4 sets of towels. That night the housekeeper didn't clean the coffee pot or mug. The next day I still had the leftover towels, but only one coffee mug, and the garbage cans weren't emptied. I wish I could say that at some point the staff got my room perfect, but I can't. I never received an apology, and once when I requested towels they hung up on me, after saying "ok." I never lost my temper, and was polite at all times, I wish I got that in return.

Reviews.Title: “What a deal for a place to sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Wife_Kneeland
Reviews.Content: Look, I honestly can't complain about this hotel and it be fair of me! I got 2 nights in this hotels for WAY under the published price.... so really, I was happy with everything for the price. Now objectively, here is what I would say: Positives: --Great location --Really decent rooms-- nothing special but definitely not gross --Good restaurant --Friendly staff --Parking on site --HOT HOT HOT water --Pool on site --In-room air conditioning worked REALLY well Negatives: --We had a room on the 20th floor... which meant we had to ride an elevator up to the 18th floor, get off that elevator and take another up two more flights! Honestly, it does get old to do that every time you go ANYWHERE --The 18th floor, where we changed elevators was always SOOOO hot, just a note for anyone who gets the 18th floor --The pool floor, where my parents stayed, had a strong chlorine smell --The rooms and decor and everything was nothing to write home about like some of the smaller, older, more charming hotels

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal - Smokers Beware!”
Reviews.Author: eedwards
Reviews.Content: I spent several days researching hotels in New Orleans to find one that had smoking rooms. I finally found the Holiday Inn French Quarter and reserved a smoking room through Travelocity. I also called the hotel to verify that smoking rooms were available. Upon arriving at check in we were told that the smoking floor was in the process of being renovated. I showed the managers on duty my reservations which clearly said SMOKING. I also told them that I had called less than a week prior to verify that they had smoking rooms available during my stay. The managers were extremely rude and unhelpful. I asked them if they could give me a room with a balcony, (to step outside of the room and smoke), and they also refused this request stating that those rooms were also being "renovated." They finally told me that, although it is against their policy, they would agree to refund my money if I called Travelocity and explained the situation. The joke was on me....I waited on hold for 20 minutes only to be greeted by a rude woman with a strong Indian accent , (we couldn't understand each other). I was "informed" that smoking rooms are not guaranteed through Travelocity even though it is a specific option when requesting a room. I was also advised to "read the small print" and told that no refund would be given! I obviously did not want to lose my money and reluctantly agreed to accept a non-smoking room. The managers proceeded to tell me that I could smoke outside and across from the front entrance, (I was on the 18th floor). They also informed me that I would have to pay $2,500.00 if there was any evidence of smoking in my room. The Good - Room was clean and adequate - AC worked well - Location The Neutral - No remote to television, (replaced after calling front desk). - Used towels\wash clothes removed and not replaced with clean ones - Someone kept stealing the "Do not Disturb" sign from our door The Bad - Uncaring\Sarcastic hotel management - Parking, ($26.00 per day) - Misleading advertisement of smoking rooms The room was OK for the price but the managements rude treatment of guests will definitely prompt me to stay somewhere else if I am ever return to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, and that's about it”
Reviews.Author: Marichikogirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Holiday Inn while we were in town attending a wedding which just so happened to fall during the French Quarter Festival. My friend booked it on Expedia, so I really didn't know what to expect as I had never been to New Orleans and wasn't certain what the location would be like. I have to say, we were thrilled to see that we were within walking distance of everything. The checkin was sluggish but the person at the counter was very nice. The room itself was a bit dingy and while clean, could really use a fresh coat of paint. The bathroom was clean, but not very attractive. We were up on the 18th floor, so we had no problem with noise. The first morning I was shocked to discover that there was no continental breakfast. (Do yourself a favor and walk a block up to the Hotel Monteleone for one of their delicious offerings.) Overall this hotel was a "no frills" adequate place to stay, but I'll be certain to try a new place the next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Honey Moon”
Reviews.Author: Neworleansbound10
Reviews.Content: My Husband I had just gotten married and we went to New Orleans on our honeymoon. I Booked this hotel on Hotwire for $45 dollars a night. I did not know it was this hotel till we got there. I loved it, it was perfect. When we got there we parked on the second floor and went to the lobby to check-in it took all of 5 mins. The staff was very helpful. If we needed anything we got it. We were a block over from Bubon St. and the Hotel is practaly on the corner of Royal and Canale st. We could walk anywhere we wanted. The Only thing that we had a problem with was the parking we paid $26 a night and stayed for three nights, so that was kind of pricey. We also had a problem with the pool, it was freezing, and u would think that if they had an indoor pool that it would be heated but you are way wong, but if I had the option to do it again I would. You can get to everything. Food, Shopping, Burbon, Ect. I had a great time and would recomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shame about the staff.”
Reviews.Author: CardiffDewi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location and the rooms are more than acceptable. However the majority of the staff are dedicated to apathy and doing the minimum amount of work possible to complete thier day. Also be aware that they took unauthorised payments from my credit card and although after chasing them for two weeks they have not had the courtesy to formally respond to my complaint or even apologise. My thanks to Expedia for resolving this problem.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Buckeye582
Reviews.Content: We booked on Hotwire for $54/ night. It's location is perfect. You can park your own vehicle for $26 per night, and you can come and go as you please. The A/C was cold (that's a good thing), the room clean, plenty of towels, etc. We stayed 3 nights and never heard a sound from the hallway or another room. If you want "fancy" pay 5 times the amount and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “No more Holiday Inn's again!”
Reviews.Author: lovinlife0901
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in New Orleans but not in our hotel. Besides the location, there's nothing good I can say about this Holiday Inn. The parking was very expensive ($26 a night) and they did not help with bags. We parked on the 4th level and had to carry our bags down to the lobby and then back to our room (I was on crutches, so when I say we, I mean my husband). Not only that but we were on the 9th floor in a room at the end of the hallway which was very oddly shaped. Once we got there, our keys did not work, so we had to go back to the lobby again. The a/c did not work in our room or in the hallways (it was 90 degrees the whole week). We had to call multiple times for more towels before we actually got some. The pop machine did not work on our floor. The pool was small and very cold. The ladder was wrapped with caution tape and there was no hot tub. The fitness center only had 3 pieces of equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, so-so service”
Reviews.Author: dpenta
Reviews.Content: I too was a bit apprehensive based on the reviews and the reports of rude staff and long check-in times. I didn't experience rudeness as much as so-so service. When I checked in there was no wait (admittedly it was about 10 p.m.) and check-in was efficient if not particularly welcoming. Room 1912 was large, non-smoking with king bed. Took 2 elevators to get to room. Room was fairly clean, somewhat worn, small window with excellent river view. Housekeeping made up bed but stocked supplies haphazardly (no new shampoo on last night and I had to leave a note to please restock coffee). Batteries from TV remote were missing. Wifi was spotty but free. Bathroom had old tile but curved shower rod and great water pressure from "rain" showerhead. Fitness center was a lone treadmill and 2 bikes. I did not use the pool. Bottom line, the hotel is a fairly typical Holiday Inn meaning that it is perfectly fine. Not super fancy, looking a bit worn around the edges. However, the location is excellent (next to Monteleone) and the price was great! I would be upset if I had paid rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: figgy33
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was a little apprehensive staying here. We drove an H3 Hummer and fit (barely) in the parking garage. Took the elevator to the lobby, checked in without waiting (approx. 3:30pm). Went directly to our room- there were three of us- we booked a double and had plenty of room for a third bed. We called the front desk and asked for a roll-a-away and it was brought to us within 10 minutes. Bathroom was clean, carpets were clean. The window was glue shut, but the a/c was COLD so we had no problems with ventilation. I think this room was perfect for us. We were'nt there to camp in the room, it was there for us when we got in that night! I never heard noises from the streets, the hallway was quiet as well. Good place to stay and very close to Bourbon St.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about it!”
Reviews.Author: cstelm
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn in New Orleans' French Quarter should be gutted and rebuilt and the staff replaced. It is filthy, unkempt, and smells of urine. It is so not worth staying in!

Reviews.Title: “Smelly, noisy, unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: AntonJoe
Reviews.Content: On the first night we came in late. The room had a moldy smell, but we were tired and did not pay too much attention. After a not-so-good night we realized the room had bugs (like tiny cockroaches). We were given another room, this one much nicer (no smell, no bugs). Unfortunately, the door was right in front of the elevator. We were in a hurry to go out again, so we figured it would be OK. We were wrong. We spent a sleepless night, with people walking in and speaking loudly until 3 or 4 am, and the elevator ringing so loudly each time that I kept thinking it was the alarm clock. To crown it all, in the process of changing rooms, we lost one item. I realized that only late in the night, and called reception. They told me it was not their job, and that room service would not come before our departure the following day. The person on the phone wasn't sorry at all, and would not make the least effort to help. Terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Not elegant, but serves its purpose”
Reviews.Author: WaltWinton
Reviews.Content: I'll be honest, when traveling, I look for a cheap, reliable hotel in a convenient location. In a city like New Orleans, I figured that I wouldn't be spending too much time in the hotel anyway. So this one left me with a "meh" feeling. It's in a great location (right in the French Quarter), and it was the cheapest one I could find. It's just not very nice. It's not especially clean, our chain-lock was broken, and our toilet spontaneously sudded over (which was really bizarre). We did find that we spent more time in our hotel than we expected (we'd often come back for a siesta to charge our batteries for a night on the town). It suited our needs, but we're not picky. Take it for what it is - a cheap hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience in Years”
Reviews.Author: DFWRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: I travel constantly for work. I don't have a huge expense account therefore I am not accustomed to luxury on the road. All I ask is a clean, safe room, reasonable parking facilities, and staff that don't treat you as if you are bothering them. Wow. This hotel was an eye-opener. The ONLY reason to stay there is the location, and that would not be enough for me. Parking is between $24-$26 a day (can't remember exactly) and the parking garage "procedure" is complicated and cumbersome. Twice the parking attendant simply let me in the garage without charging me because the ticket machine didn't work. I wonder what would have happened if I had tried to park while they were on their break? The elevators are a nightmare. All times of the day and night people were standing in the lobby, in the hotel halls, and in the garage waiting for one of three very slow elevators. The stairwells were disqusting and the perfect locale for a murder. I was there for a conference when the hotel was completely booked. The staff in no way prepared for the deluge of attendees. The tiny lobby was stuffed with people trying to check in and one lone lady ran the counter. My group and I stayed for two nights and one lady came back from the event late the second evening to find her room key no longer worked. She had to stand in line for half an hour at midnight to get the key changed. Rooms are absolutely nothing special. Not overtly unclean, but there were hairs on the floor of the bathroom and there was a fungus growing behind the faucet. The air conditioner was bone-shaking loud, but provided little cool air. The room was stuffy the entire time I was there. I admit I did not approach the staff about this because I did not want to stand in a thirty minute line. Check out was a total time-warp. You have to kick it old-school here. Either call downstairs the morning you leave and they manually check you out or stand in line and turn in your key. I haven't done that in years. When you give them a credit card, you should simply be able to walk out the door with your stuff and leave the key in the room. All in all, a horrendous stay. Unless you plan on staying so hammered that you don't care about safety, cleanliness, or service, steer clear of this relic.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: ACGE
Reviews.Content: Visited New Orleans with my family 4 & 5 April 2009. Booked and paid well in advance only to discover after standing for nearly an hour in line to check in that the hotel has only smoking rooms available for us. Room was clean however toilet seat was broken, TV remote was missing and hair dryer broken. After third attempt the above-mentiond were replace. Staff not very friendly. Worse Holiday Inn I stayed in ever.

Reviews.Title: “Stay on floors 18-20”
Reviews.Author: bbBB_8
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend stay at this hotel. My room was on the 19th floor and it was newly remodeled and very clean. A friend who was staying in a yet-to-be remodeled "Executive Suite" on a lower floor had a very different reality - a dirty, smelly, moldy room. The hotel staff was not helpful at check-in, but I didn't have any special needs so it was not a major problem. My advice would be to reserve a room that has been remodeled. If the hotel won't make that guarantee, stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great location great city”
Reviews.Author: sapperGazInBlackpool
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel with a large British tour group and not one of them had a bad thing to say about the hotel.In the French quarter, a minutes stroll from Bourbon. Easy walking distance from other attractions including the WW2 museum where I discovered how the Americans won the war! The staff in the hotel are friendly and very helpful.The french quarter is very raucous but without that underlying threat of violence you tend to get in UK city centres.

Reviews.Title: “Take a Pass, Not at all for the well heeled traveler”
Reviews.Author: barry_silverstein
Reviews.Content: The room was large, but the Hotel a disaster. It is very close to Bourbon Street, so if you're into that seen; loud, raunchy, dirty, and not nice at all that's fine. But to begin with, the toilet in the bathroom doesn't have a toilet seat cover. What's up with that? Single sink, cultured marble, nothing special. The crowd is very over weight and middle class, the pool was quiet the first day but over run with kids the second (15 kids) and not clean. The staff was friendly and helpful, but this hotel misses the mark by a long shot. If you enjoy a little bit of luxury while you're on vacation, take a pass on this place because its not for you, at all. Even though the location is good, it needs on hands management who want the hotel to be more than it is.I would instead stay at; the Sheraton, the Hilton, the Hotel Monteleone, the Double Tree, the Loews. There are so many better places to stay, and all in the same area. Sorry but that's the truth. Also, when I called for a spoon to be sent to my room so I could eat some ice cream, the hotel connected me to the Parrot Resturant that is in the Hotel. After they told me they don't give out spoons, I heard the management say to the person speaking to me that they should tell me to hang up and don't bother them! Some service! Well the hotel manager got me a plastic spork... Pass on this place unless you are really on a budget and really want to go to NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Room, Bad Service, and came away Physically Sick”
Reviews.Author: edwardsdna
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel I have stayed at in a while and I hope I never stay at another this bad. Don't waste your time or money. The rooms are dirty to include mold on the shower curtain, staff is unhappy and rude, and there are no windows you can open in the room so you have to run the air conditioning constantly and it is dirty unfiltered air which will make you sick. I am still under my Dr's care for chest congestion due to the dirty moldy room and bad air quality. I didn't even bother going to the pool area because it looked dirty and old too and the internet connection was unreliable at best

Reviews.Title: “Not glamorous, but certainly adequate”
Reviews.Author: Publius2003
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights upon a return trip to NOLA. Looking to save money, we booked this as part of a package deal through Hotwire. While this place wasn't filled with fountains or marble, it served its purpose well. It is located just within the Quarter, a half block up from Canal St. It is difficult to find, as the signage is very small. The service is helpful, but not smothering. The lobby is small as well, with just enough room for the front desk and a concierge off to the side. This hotel is well worn, but clean. When we checked in, we were candidly told by the front desk that as a hotwire guest, we aren't reserved any particular room, but get whatever is available at the time of check-in. So, we ended up with a handicapped accessible room directly across from the elevator. It actually wasn't bad, however; as the room was very deep. We only heard commotion from the elevator once or twice. The elevators are very slow and the hallway carpeting is well-worn. This is a high traffic hotel, and as it is not the W or Omni, it is not afraid to show its wear a little more than those hotels. The rooms are acceptable. The bed is a little more "broken in" than other Holiday Inns where I have recently stayed, but it was fine. The furniture was also acceptable. The pool was my only complaint. The water was an unnatural shade of green (think Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles), so I never used it. However, the fitness room was fine. I never saw cockroaches, either. However, I have seen them quite often when walking out on the Quarter, so as these buildings are old, that may have been a product of the neighbors. I would return; especially if I get the rock bottom Hotwire rate.

Reviews.Title: “Mardi Gras stay”
Reviews.Author: limdulk2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Holiday Inn for just one night, Fat Tuesday. The price was what other Hotels were charging per night. The young lady at the service desk that night was wonderful and very friendly. That is the kind of person businesses need in this economy. Even if something was not right I am sure she would have smooth things over. The security was great. There was extra security so that we would not have any strangers roaming the motel. Our son lives in New Orleans and because we were going to march in a parade that day we did not take any thing but the clothes on our backs. We did not want to find a way back to his house in the middle of the night. They did not think twice about giving us toothpaste, razors and things. Good Job on a busy night Royal Street Holiday Inn

Reviews.Title: “Worked exceptionaaly well for us”
Reviews.Author: dm7b5
Reviews.Content: We didn't think we could afford to stay in a decent hotel in the French Quarter, and had planned on staying out of town and commuting in to see the sights. Stopped at the Visitors center coming in from Mississippi and picked up a coupon ( not in a book) that advertised $59/night. I called and they said they had rooms. I asked if there was free parking and they woman said she "thought so with our coupon" When we arrived and were checking in, were told that it was $26.night for parking. I explained very tactfully that this is not what we were told, and when I asked to see the manager, was immediately given free parking coupons. We had a lovely room, never had much of a wait for the elevators, were far above the noise, and were extremely glad we stayed downtown. Right across the street from the St Charles line with access to the garden District. For the price for 3 nights in the quarter - perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain on hotwire with good service”
Reviews.Author: andre711
Reviews.Content: First of all, I was scared to death after reading the reviews. I got my room off of hotwire for $50 per night and I stayed 3 nights. It was a really good deal. If you want to be near the action, you are literally a block or two from bourbon street and everything else. I have seen people say the rooms were full of cockroaches, however, during my stay, I did not see anything like that. My room was very clean and kept clean every day by the maid service. The bathrooms had hot water, almost too hot times, and the service help was excellent. For $50, I thought this place was a great bargain. My only complaint was that I did not have any batteries in the remote control but spent a couple of bucks at the walgreens next door for some batteries, besides who wants to watch TV in that area!!!

Reviews.Title: “STINKS..literally & figuratively”
Reviews.Author: ezmisery
Reviews.Content: Stinks almost as bad as Bourbon Street, staff stinks in customer service, front desk manager stinks so no wonder the staff has stinky attitudes.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Comfortable No Frills Stay”
Reviews.Author: lizzie1nc
Reviews.Content: I was also afraid of what we might get when we checked in after reading all the negitive reviews but was pleasantly surprized and relieved... Location is good. On the corner of Canal and Royal about 2 blocks from all the action of the French Quarter. Close to Harrah's and the Canal and St. Charles trolleys. Rooms weren't supposed to be ready until 5PM but we checked in at 11:30AM with no problem. The front desk was very helpful and friendly. The elevators are slow and small but you still get to your room. We were on the 18th floor and when the elevator doors opened the first time I was alittle worried about what the room would look like. The halls are not attractive - kind of beat up and ugly. Our room was much better. Two nice double beds - clean sheets and very comfortable pillows. TV wasn't new but it worked. Broken floor lamp that was propped up against the wall. Windows hadn't been cleaned in years but you could still see the beautiful riverfront. Bathroom was clean, towels were thick and plenty of towel bars. Shower wouldn't stay in shower position very well and wasted a lot of water. Toilet lid keep falling down - little frustrating things that will keep this hotel from getting better reviews. I guess I expected the worst and got OK. We booked this room for a spur of the moment trip through lastminute.com and didn't go for luxury - just wanted to get away with my son for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good value & location”
Reviews.Author: 4jworld
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried after seeing the negative reviews for this hotel. I was taking six 12-year olds on a historic trip, and was pleasantly surprised. The staff was very friendly. The rooms, while not luxurious, were clean and comfortable. Everything was within walking distance. It was a good room at a good price, in the middle of it all.

Reviews.Title: “dog house”
Reviews.Author: mama425
Reviews.Content: The hotel was filthy. There wasn't a t.v in the first room. Th etoilet seat was fallen apart. The 2nd room there wasn't any hot water., the bathroom door could not be locked . The rooms were not properly cleaned. Th etowels were dingy looking. Housekeepers were lazy. Hotel staff smoke in the hallways. Some of the staff are rude. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “bring your own service”
Reviews.Author: seetheusa007
Reviews.Content: We don't recommend this hotel at Christmas. Housekeeping didn't happen Christmas Eve or Christmas Day. The adjoining restaurant closed unannounced and reopened Dec. 27th. No morning cup of coffee! No room service! The location made this hotel stay okay rather than terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, ok service, but the elevators didn't work!”
Reviews.Author: KHar007
Reviews.Content: First of all - DO NOT GET A RENTAL CAR when visiting New Orleans. Our car sat in the hotel parking lot for $26 a day for NO reason. There is no reason to get a car. Get a shuttle from the airport to the hotel for $15 that's all you need. Everything is within walking distance, there's taxis and street cars, and the tours all pick you up at the hotel. SAVE YOURSELF A FEW HUNDRED BUCKS and skip the rental car. Now on to the hotel - I loved the room, it was clean and perfect and comfortable, the location was GREAT, the bed linens were nice and clean and fresh and the down comforter was warm and cozy, lots of towels, fast room service, friendly hotel desk. Really no complaints there. My one complaint is - the elevators SUCKED!!! We were on the 16th floor and had to walk down a few times after waiting over 15 minutes for the elevator and losing our patience. They were "working on it" but a lot of people were complaining at the front desk when we were checking out. We didn't really mind walking down but there were a few older/handicapped people that were very unhappy with this situation.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: boisebrady
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn was great for a weekend getaway. It was my first trip to New Orleans. This hotel was the hotel chosen as part of a football game trip organized by a travel agency. The location is perfect. It is near Canal Street and everything in the French Quarters in within walking distance. The Holiday Inn is not new by any means, but I found it to be clean and comfortable. The bellman was also very friendly and helpful in directing us to good restaurants and taking care of our luggage to and from the bus. There is a small indoor pool; it didn't seem to get used much. There isn't a continental breakfast, but there is a McDonald's right across the street. If I had one small complaint it would be that the A/C was a bit noisy and wasn't very powerful so it had to run all night. I'm sure there are fancier hotels, and this hotel didn't really stand out much, but it didn't detract from a good experience in New Orleans. If you are looking for a clean, comfortable place with the French Quarters at your doorstep - this place will work just fine.

Reviews.Title: “this place is so bad”
Reviews.Author: gogoDodo
Reviews.Content: this place is so bad first of all there was a huge cochroch under my pillow sheet and the pool water was very cloudy. the person behind the front desk didnt know anything. the rooms smelled like pee and smoke even though it wasnt a smoke room, there were nail clippings on the floor , the paint was chiping. this place was just offale. i woule never stay there again!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay - No Problems”
Reviews.Author: Shekitty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with two other couples stayed in this hotel Nov. 12 through the 16th. After reading the reviews, I was very concerned that we may have some problems, but that was far from the truth. We have been visiting NO for years and have stayed in some fine hotels, such as the Monteleone and we found the Holiday Inn on Royal to be as good as any other. Maybe not as fancy, but it was certainly clean, the staff was exceptionally friendly and there were no issues with bugs or slow elevators and the hotel was completely full. The location is perfect for a French Quarter experience. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a moderate priced hotel in the Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good for a few nights”
Reviews.Author: SantanaDavid
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its location right bang slap in the middle of the French Quarter which is, after all, the only place to be in New Orleans. Itâ€™s certainly not the finest Holiday Inn Iâ€™ve stayed in by far but itâ€™s very adequate with comfortable rooms and reasonable service, if a touch impersonal although the bell captain was extremely helpful and friendly as we needed to get our luggage quickly stored away whilst leaving our rental car just waiting for a ticket outside! The other plus factor was that the Budget Car Rental drop off was just a few blocks up the road so in all senses the location was perfect. For a few nights in New Orleans, a comfortable hotel to sleep in at a reasonable price and a location which is unbeatable, then this hotel is just fine!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: A1Globetrotter
Reviews.Content: Well if location is everything, this property is it. Slightly more than adequate, clean rooms and facilities right in the middle of the (relatively safe, only place to be) French Quarter. And the price is about right, too. In New Orleans (THE 24 hour entertainment city) people don't usually spend much time in their own hotel rooms anyway and neither will you! I recommend this property for a few nights stay. In this case adequate is A-OK!

Reviews.Title: “Great for price & location”
Reviews.Author: mshplover
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn prior to Hurricane Gustav hitting NOLA. I booked the hotel through hotwire for around 63 bucks a night. With the mixed reviews I was a bit worried but I found the hotel to be a great stay. The rooms were clean--did not see any roaches as stated in other reviews. The location was great could easily walk to Bourbon or the casino/Canal Street. The staff was great considering all the prep for the Hurricane hitting, we actually had to cut the stay a day short due to the evacuation but checked with the front desk and they were very helpful in informing us on what to do. Overall this is a descent hotel--great for the price/location.

Reviews.Title: “A step above "Dive"”
Reviews.Author: Doolie1
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying Im a Priority Club Gold member and have stayed at more than a few holiday Inn/Crowne Plaza/Hotel Intercontinental Hotels, but this has to be the worst decorated hotel in the chain. The hotel stays busy and the elevators are always full(often have to wait and wait for an elevator thats empy enough for you to squeeze into. The bathrooms and everything about the place is cheap-o. Fairly clean, good location, its just something of a lower tier motel 6 type place thats CRAZY crowded....NO charm, NO character..more of a target+walmart decorated place. Can do MUCH better for your money in NOLA...

Reviews.Title: “It's true--Roaches”
Reviews.Author: pat099
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from June 26-30th. Unfortunately I read the reviews of this hotel after I was locked into a package deal and couldn't change. Let me say that I found the hotel to be clean, public areas and rooms. First night there came back to room and turned on bathroom light only to find roaches, some dead some alive. Immediately went to the front desk and believe me they did not seem surprised by my problem. They offered to take care of it right away (not sure what that meant) or I could move to another room. I chose to go to another room and didn't have a problem, although I never shut the bathroom light off my entire stay. Another downside to this hotel is that they do not have safes in the rooms. They had safety deposit boxes in the lobby but we were told on the first day none were available and that they would put us on a list for the first available. We checked everyday and there was never one available even though people were checking out all day long. The location is great but we won't be going back. If you decide to stay here leave the lights on!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “NO Roaches, NOT Dirty...just fine.”
Reviews.Author: ptgrd14
Reviews.Content: FACT: I was super nervous after reading the reviews on this website. FACT: I had no problems at all with bugs. The staff was indeed a little gruff at first, but after being there for 4 days they were actually quite helpful. Usually if you are nice to people, they will be nice to you. When we got to the hotel and our room, our shower didn't work. They immediately sent someone up and when they couldn't fix it moved us to another room. So, problem averted. It is a little run down hotel wise but definitely NOT dirty, the way it was described earlier. It's just an older hotel that has a little wear (the way a lot of places in New Orleans do). The location was great, and even though there was a townie hang out across the street (a 24 hour liquor store). The hotel workers made sure people didn't loiter in front of the hotel. We had rain as well while we were there, but saw no roaches..and if the rain is what brought them out, I'm not sure they would be ROACHES anyway...probably just water bugs, which most people don't know the difference. Would I stay there again? Yes. The location was great, and the price was right...so I see no problem staying there again. I will say the hotel restaurant/bar closes at 11PM so if you were wanting to go there and drink or play pool later...you'd definitely be surprised! Also. Mr. B's Bistro across the street is fantastic!!!! Ask for Harold!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, no problems”
Reviews.Author: littlebit0863
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel. I did stay there in April 2007, so maybe roaches moved in since then (per the other reviews) but I didn't see any. I didn't have an exactly smooth booking.l booked 3 months in advance, and was told my credit card would be charged immediately, but it wasn't charged until after my stay. It was kind of a pain, because for 3 months I had to keep that extra money in the bank, which is hard for a girl who wants to know to the penny the amount of money I have. Numerous calls to the hotel asking them to go ahead and charge me were not returned. That was my one and only problem. The hotel was very nice looking. I was worried about going to New Orleans post Katrina, but our hotel seemed secure and made me feel safe. We were one street away from Bourbon Street, which was VERY convenient, especially walking home at night. I love how you can walk everywhere in the French Quarter. Our hotel room was actually in a tiny alcove off the hotel that had a private staircase that led from the pool to our balcony. I wandered around the hotel and didn't see any other rooms like it. The pool was nice and pretty, but it was a little too cold to swim. Our room was clean and nice looking. I had no problems with it whatsoever. We were blocks away from world class restaurants so I didn't eat at the hotel, but the restaurant looked full each night so I guess it was good. All in all, good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Roaches everywhere”
Reviews.Author: pzbear
Reviews.Content: I got a really good price on Hotwire and it had a 3 star rating (not) so I booked it. When I found out it was a Holiday Inn I was happy as Holiday Inn used to be a good brand of hotel. What a dive! My room smelled awful, the elevators were so slow and overcrowded that it would take 30 minutes to go from the lobby to your room. The worse part was when we came back to room around midnight we were horrifed to find roaches everywhere, on the bed, on the walls on the phone, etc. There was no way I was going to sleep there. I called management and was told there was no open rooms but they would put us in the Holiday Inn Express down the street. So we loaded up our luggage and went into the night to find the Holiday Inn Express. I was scared to death. Here we were walking in unlit streets with our luggage not knowing for sure where this hotel was (we were given bad directions). I thought for sure we were going to get mugged. I will say the Holiday Inn Express is not in the best location, but the rooms were great. I would never stay at the Holiday Inn French Quarter again. It might be ok for the young kids wanting just a bed to crawl into at the wee hours, but not for anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty accomodations”
Reviews.Author: kimFortWayne
Reviews.Content: This was probably the dirtiest room we have ever stayed in. There were nail clippers on the floor when we got there, and they were still there when we left. The plaster on the walls and ceiling was peeling off. The balcony next to us had a used tampon there for almost the entire time we were there. Housekeeping were more interested at being on their cell phones rather than cleaning. We sure thought for being a Holiday Inn, it did not live up to its name.

Reviews.Title: “Roaches Roaches Roaches”
Reviews.Author: mswiz007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn on Royal St. What a horrible experience!! !! I along with 2 of my girlfriends stayed in New Orleans to have a great night out since none of us had ever been to new orleans. Wasnt sure where to stay but with the Holiday Inn always being a great experience for us that is where we stayed or tried to stay. After a great night out in New Orleans we go back to the room to find that we were not the only occupents in the room. The room was infested with ROACHES of all sizes. The sad part was that there were so many they (the roaches) didnt even mind that we were there! They were even in the BED! When we packed up and went to the lobby to complain the manager on duty said that they had that problem and quickly refunded our money. Needless to say that at 3 in the morning we had to drive 2 hours back to my house in Mississippi. Our trip cut in half and VERY VERY disappointed. My friends drove down from Ohio to have a great time and was very disappointed! Have pictures of the roaches if you would like to see them.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Portland_MaineMjchan
Reviews.Content: Having read many reviews of this hotel, I was a little nervous as to what to expect especially since we got a very good rate thru Hotwire. But I can say it was a terrific value. The location is perfect ; a short walk to everything in the French Quarter, Harrahs, and even the warehouse district. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Check-in was a breeze and parking (in/out) was easy. The room was clean and we had a great view of the river, riverboats, and shipping. Beds were comfortable, linens clean and good quality. We were there during Jazzfest and the noise in the hotel was minimal. They are redoing some floors but this didn't present any problems. Overall we had a wonderful stay, I will probably stay there next year for Jazzfest.

Reviews.Title: “Not The Best”
Reviews.Author: debsohio
Reviews.Content: 4/10 - 4/14 -The only thing good about this hotel is the location. We were on the 10th floor. It was noisy at night because there was a street behind our room. The bathroom was very small. The room could use a update of carpet and paint. The staff at the front desk seemed very confused. They had us down as hotwire customer, I booked thru the hotel directly. Then the woman at the desk had us under another name. Good thing I brought my confirmation from home. Then another younger woman helped us out at the desk. The restaraunt next door was terrrible. The waiter dropped his tray and I ended up with salsa all over my back. The manager finally came over and gave me 20% coupon....(at home I would receive a free meal) The bell boys at the hotel were the only staff that seem friendly since they work on tips. There was a nice restaraunt a block away for breakfast called Mela. Ate there twice and would definately recommend. I would definately pay more to stay elsewhere in the quarter than the Holiday-inn.

Reviews.Title: “great location ..If you can catch a deal!”
Reviews.Author: tothemoon1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great deal, if, you can get a deal. I booked it for 54.00 a night with Hotwire and so it was well worth it. Otherwise I think I would have overpaid. The location is fabulous, but there are a lot of charming spots to find in the French Quarter for the same amount as a regular night here. Because we arrived near midnight on a Saturday night, we could not get the room we had booked and had to accept a smoking room. They were happy to switch us for the remaider of our stay though. Our room was decent enough, however the first one was a bit shabby. The hotel reception was often busy in the middle of the day, but were as accomodating as they could be. The pool was O.K. too. The Monteleone down the street looked like an nice upscale alternative, with a great location. New Orleans is a blast! We had a great vacation for 8 days, the end of March. The weather was wonderful, high 70's and just right for sight seeing. I spent hours just roaming the French Quarter streets enjoying the atmosphere there. Meals were always an adventure! There is some great food to be found in this city! We often tried Frommers' inexpensive recommendations and we were always happy. (can be found online at Frommers' site.) These spots weren't fancy, but they were often interestingand had great food! Central Grocery for a muffelatta is a must, and if you are in the Garden District slip in to Slim Goodies Diner for interesting atmosphere! We loved the tours that we took and recommend Tours by Isobel, for an authentic and personal touch. The Cajun swamp tour was fabulous, with the swamp part being guided by a honest to goodness, bayou living,Cajun alligator farmer, among other things. The passenger vans were really packed, though. It's great to see that this city is still rebuilding and has a positive attitude after so much heartache. There is still lots to be done though! Take the Katrina tour to learn so much about this disaster.

Reviews.Title: “Bah to service”
Reviews.Author: theresajones15
Reviews.Content: I was not impressed with this hotel, the rooms were given to us supposedly at a group rate of 129.00 for courtyard rooms. I couldn't get a courtyard room, because the ran out. then one of our party cancelled I tried to book the room, they couldn't change my reservation at the reservation center, the hotel told me to call the reservation center, finally I called the manager 3 times, they never called back. When we got there early (at 11am) they told us our rooms wouldn't be ready till at least after 12, it wasn't ready till 4 and then they booked us on the 11th floor when everyone else in our party was on the 9th floor, we had to wait another hour till 5 to get a room. The people at the front counter didn't seem to know what they were doing, they said they couldn't get a time out of housekeeping, but when we asked house keeping ourselves, they told us 45 minutes, and it was ready in 45 minutes. Housekeeping seems to be much more pleasant then the front desk. At one point I called down and they were very rude and snapped at me. The so called courtyard, was a giant cement patio, with some halfhearted fake trees and stone benches. crappy place not worth the money. every other member of our party had microwaves and fridges and we did not. They didn't even know another person from our party had checked in, showing his room as not occupied when he went to get an extra key, even tho he had already checked in. aside from the concierge who was very nice, but didn't know all that much about what was open and when. the front desk staff all needs training on politeness.

Reviews.Title: “not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: puffery
Reviews.Content: We were there during Mardi Gras.The room was cleaned everyday.The beds were comfortable and the pillows terrific.Shower had poor water pressure in the mornings when everyone using water.Concierge was very helpful, the got us reservations to Emerils.Front desk on the evening shift was very nice and helpful.The best thing about this hotel is the location.It is steps away from Bourbon St and Canal St.Really we cannot complain for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: JM_sacramento
Reviews.Content: Not up to typical Holiday Inn standards and that is not saying much! This place is worn out, fixtures are broken, desks are missing. Yes, it has new paint but it needs so much more. The only good thing I can say is the maids worked hard to keep the room clean. Leave this place to students on spring break and party animals that never stay in the room.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: abbo1963
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2/21 thru 2/25 Hotel is basic lodging with great location. 5 blocks Casino/ 1 block to Bourbon st./ 6 blocks to River front. If checking in on a friday night beware long wait . Restaurant food not good other then breakfast. 24 hour store across the street for water,soda , snacks etc. Must do things to do in NOLA. Pat O'Briens piano bar, Carriage rides from Jackson Square, Paddle boat cruise,Acme Oyster house,Street car down St. Charles, Drago's for grilled Oysters(at the hilton by Casino), Bar at Hotel Montelone,Irene's restaurant. Relax and enjoy the Big Easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: adkmommy1
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel stay on Hotwire. We were a little nervous at first because it was the first time we had used Hotwire. It turned out to be a great deal. We got our room for $59/night. It is only one block from Bourbon Street and you can walk to everything! The rooms are average size and they were clean. There were only two things I did not like - one being the beds seemed really small and two the bathroom floors were sticky. It may have been what they cleaned it with, but we didn't have a floor mat to step on after we bathed. Other than that, it was worth the money. I will return to this hotel in the future. The only thing that seemed a little expensive is the parking....$26/night. But I think that is pretty standard at most hotels in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Stay”
Reviews.Author: xxdjxx
Reviews.Content: Our stay this year for Mardi gras almost ruined the entire trip. The hotel was turned into a frat house â€“ dirty rooms, grimy floors that never got vacuumed, piled up trash in the halls, overwhelmed and confused staff, and non-existent security. One elevator broke on Friday night and the staff never fixed it, causing 10-20 minute lines at the elevators for the entire weekend. Drunk kids screaming all night. On Saturday night someone pulled the fire alarm at 2 am, causing us to walk down 20 floors of stairs only to wait 20 minutes for the elevators to return to the room. I wish I had thought to take pictures of this dump. Terrible, terrible hotel â€“ stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay 2 Years in a row now!”
Reviews.Author: piscean-delusions
Reviews.Content: 2008 marked the 2nd year in a row we stayed at this hotel - had a blast last year, this year the staff was even better. Always friendly and courteous, nice clean rooms, and very tolerant during the Mardi Gras celebration. We had to wear wristbands to get into the hotel, which seemed like it may be an inconvenience, but as the nights wore on, it began to feel more like we were VIP guests. The staff in the lobby that handles crowd control for the elevators is very patient and understanding and really helped keep things moving good. I'm extremely satisfied with both years we stayed here and unless we rent a balcony room right on Bourbon street, we'll probably continue to come here every year.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel, Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: LABAYMEDIC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Jan. 20, 2008 and it will be the last time I stay here. Waited in line for 1hr and 40 min to check in. Once I checked in got a room and went up to it. Walked into a half naked man on the bed. Seems as though they gave him the same room they gave me. I went down and tried to get another room and they said they didn't have any more. When I asked them to cancel my reservation and I would go to another hotel they said they could do that but the hold for the room would still remain on my debit card for another 1-2 weeks. Told them this was not acceptable and asked for a manager. They then miraculously found a room for me. Room was small and bed was not comfortable at all. Remote control for the T.V didn't work and the carpet was torn in many places. There was a hude stain on the chair and the showerhead was old and scumy. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location, hotel is pretty good too!”
Reviews.Author: Susonka
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the bad reviews about this hotel, we were a little scared! However, we were pleasantly surprised. The decor definitely is tacky, but our room was clean and quiet which is really what matters to us. The lobby area is nice. The location of this hotel is great. It is a block from Bourbon st, close to the streetcars on Canal st. and everything in the french quarter is in easy walking distance. We were very worried about noise, and this was not an issue at all. Also, our room was cleaned daily. No problems there! Also, the front desk people were very nice. We were able to check into our room at around noon time which was great and several hours early! No hassle whatsoever! We did not eat at the restaurant at this hotel and it did not look like many other people did either but it may be good? A nice surprise was when we opened our window we could see the river from our room. I liked watching the barges and tug boats. Oh, the coffee in the room tasted like mud, but it is hotel coffee! Your are in New Orleans so I highly suggest visiting some of the great coffee shops instead! Also, we booked through Hotwire at around $54 a night - with fees/tax this came to about $65 a night! Fantastic deal! Also, we noticed on the weekend, you needed to use your hotel key card for the elevator to work. I think this is a security measure so party people cannot invade the hotel? Anyway, we were not in the crazy Mardi Gras crowd which occurs closer to Fat Tuesday, but even on the weekend in January - still carnival time - it was quiet at night in our room. Hope everyone has a pleasant experience and visits beautiful New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “A great place from which to see New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: hen-cymro
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Bourbon street is one block away.It is in walking distance of all the sights. The Natchez river boat is 15 minutes away (go and make your own reservations).Our room was good ( comfortable bed, hot showers, no street noise, good room service). There are lots of places to eat close by. You can buy cheap wine or beer in the shop across the road from the hotel. We had a brilliant time in New Orleans!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cheap, great location”
Reviews.Author: dreamvac
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn French Quarter is fine for those looking for a clean, functional room in a great location for a reasonable price. We booked the room on hotwire at a rate of $54 per night. Check in was fine and we were upgraded to a king executive room. The lobby, room and public areas appear clean and recently painted. The room was large with a sitting area. It is nothing fancy. The bed was firm, but the linens could use an upgrade as they slipped off the bed as we slept. Maid service was prompt and adequate. This is not a romantic hotel but an adequate place to rest your head after a day in NOLA. The hotel appears to have adequate security as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, excelent location”
Reviews.Author: Ricardamus
Reviews.Content: The hotel presents a terrific location (one block from Bourbon Street and Canal Street), excelent and clean rooms. No complains, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed with my services I received.”
Reviews.Author: Lidigri
Reviews.Content: The stay was not terible but it was the worst hotel stay I have had with any hotel and we have stayed at quit a few. We had to walk a block to get to the hotel because it was not bus accessible. The room had a smell, the coffee pot had a dirty coffee filter left in the pot, there was not a dirty plastic laundry bag and bits of toliet paper that were previously wet and let in the corner of the floor as well as some hairs left on the tub, The breakfast was fair but not worth the price and even after paying cash for it an incorrect bill was left under the door for (4) when it was only (2) persons eating an already paid cash for buffet at the front desk and given a coupon to present.. After returning home and checking our bank statement there was a charge to my/our card for $19.60 when the card was never use for any services in the hotel. We talked with a lady at the front desk and she said the card would not be charged for any service this was said and cleared by Ashley Mart she signed the bill as the guest . She stated the card would not be charged and was not charged for any services that we were clear. This was after she came back from talking with her manager in the back, She also that the lady draw was messed up yesterday. I don't remember her name (the lady that waited on us) but she had 11 Stars on her name tag. We were not the only one who received a bill and it was already paid for before we went up to the breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service/Good Location”
Reviews.Author: RainLake
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal Street HI for a short weekend get-a-way. Check in time advertised as 4:00 P.M. Did not actually get checked in until 6:00 P.M. Counter staff very unfriendly and did not care that rooms were not ready. Booked a King Executive Room got a standard. When this was brought to the attention of the staff their response was "Sorry...nothing we can do now". Rooms were O.K. did not notice anything out of the ordinary except some hair left in the shower from one of the previous occupants. The only positive thing I can say about this HI is that it is only 1 block from Bourbon. If your travel plans require you to stay more than one night or you need to actually work DO NOT STAY HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Value conscious travelers would approve”
Reviews.Author: Scott M
Reviews.Content: Location was one block from Bourbon Street and two doors from Canal St in French Quarter, so it's very convenient. I would assume parking is expensive, but the free in-room wireless is a big plus. For the $49 I paid on Hotwire, I was more than satisfied. Be prepared when visiting New Orleans that you should always be aware of your location, watch the people around you and never leave luggage more than 5 feet from you. There is a criminal element all around in this city. I highly recommend the GreyLine Tours Katrina Bus Tour, especially tour guide/driver named Sylvester...he is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Good Room for Great Price”
Reviews.Author: travelhappy1
Reviews.Content: After Hotel Monteleone screwed up our reservations royally, we were forced to get another room at the last minute. Fortunately on our drive into NO we had stopped by the welcome center and pulled some hotel cards. One of the ones we happened to pull was the Holiday Inn Royal street. The staff was incredible. The location was great (one block to Bourbon), one block to Canal etc. We got a rate that included parking. Our room was huge the only draw back was the decor which I overheard one guest comparing to a cruiseship. LOL. We stayed two nights and the room was comfortable. My only complaint is that they had apparently recently painted our room and the lingering light scent of paint was still in the air. For the amount of time we were in the room, it didn't matter too much since it wasn't overpowering. For $69 bucks I think we made out like bandits.

Reviews.Title: “Uninvited Guests”
Reviews.Author: Critic10
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn - French Quarter 124 Royal St. New Orleans, LA Different types of rooms Normal clean rooms vs. the scary, old rooms I recently attended the Essence Music Festival and I was initially given a room on the 18th floor. This room was totally unacceptable. There was a huge rip in the rug as soon as you walked in the door. If someone is not paying attention, they would trip and bang their head on the dresser which was pulled away from the wall. Someone had ripped the cable from the wall which was connected to the tv. One of the curtains was hanging unattached to a couple of hooks, there was a stain on the seat of the arm chair and the mattresses were very old until they had lost their shape. I called the front desk, they were very accommodating and moved me to a room on a different floor. This room was better but only one drawback, we had some uninvited guests. Roaches! I called and complained and the maintenance guy came and sprayed the room (after we left of course). That didn't help, the roaches showed up the next day and the next day. The hotel also had a restaurant. They offered a breakfast buffet and I saw a roach on the fresh fruit bowl display! I made it through the weekend but I would not go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Party Place”
Reviews.Author: GiggaMan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, has a courteous staff, and allowed us to be as loud as we wanted. The people at the front desk never hasseled us ( we had six people in our room but paid for two). The room is what it is, a Holiday Inn in New Orleans. How much can you really expect?

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Peachy16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this for 6 nights, and had a great stay, with only one - very minor- issue to speak of, one day we had a hard time trying to connect on to the internet, but our issue was easily remedied when we spoke with the front desk staff. We were quite nervous as to what we were getting ourselves into after reading some of the other reviews on this site about the hotel, but were pleasantly surprised. The lobby was attractive, front desk staff was EXCELLENT, our room was cleaned everyday. We felt the room was a good size - not a great view - but again very minor issue as we really weren't in the room that much. The location was unbeatable, walking distance to pretty much anywhere we were wanting or needing to go. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the $$”
Reviews.Author: cddman
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean, hallways and public area kept very clean. Pool was cleaned daily. We did not experience any of the problems reported by previous customers at this hotel. Perhaps it was due to our visiting the area in mid-June (which is not a typically busy time for New Orleans), but I was very pleased with the room for the price. Desk staff were friendly and courteous and answered all of our questions cheerfully. Valet service was courteous as well as the bellman. If you do stay here, please be aware of the parking. Unless you book a package deal that includes parking, be prepared to pay $28/Day for valet parking at this location. There is no self-parking at this Holiday Inn - you must valet park.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Satisfied!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KarynNC
Reviews.Content: Not sure how some of the people come up with these negative reviews. My trip overlapped that of the previous poster. I was there for 6 nights. Never once did I see a line in the lobby, never once had to wait for an elevator, room was cleaned everyday thoroughly, clean windows, carpet was in no way "filthy" or "smelly," vending machines worked properly. We rented a car and used the parking garage one night but our final bill showed we were charged for two nights. I brought this to the attention of the front desk and they corrected the bill and apologized with no questions asked. For the price we paid I was very satisfied. Our room was clean, quiet, in a great location, and the staff was very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the value! Keep looking!!!”
Reviews.Author: xraygirl23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel April 29-30 just before leaving on a cruise. We chose Holiday Inn because it was inexpensive and has a great location. However, the money we saved was not worth it. The only positive is that the hotel is exactly one block from Bourbon Street. We tried to check in at 4PM but our king room was not reeady nor did they have any available. We were 2 of about 50 people waiting in the lobby for our room. One group of guests said they had already been waiting an hour. The management was not helpful with their situation either. So we decided to take the 2 queen room instead so we could enjoy the city of NO. The room had a dirty toilet, USED TOWELS on the bathroom floor, and a musty smell filled the room. The hotel is VERY OLD, DIRTY and SMELLY. The windows were covered in dirt. The elevators are old, slow and unreliable. The soda machine on our floor was out so we had to keep trying other floors until we finally found one that TOOK MONEY AND HAD SODA in it! Go figure!! I am not sure how dirty other hotels are compared to this one as the entire city is filled with the stench of urine. It was a real disappointment. The people of New Orleans were very friendly and eager to take our money. We will not be returning here.

Reviews.Title: “Shame on you, Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: WeloveParis
Reviews.Content: Went to New Orleans for Jazz Fest and paid $196.00 a night for a dirty room that had not been updated in years! Moldy smell, carpet was ripped and dirty and we could not walk barefooted because our feet were brown. My wife slept with her clothes on for fear of bet mites. We had a river view but could not see it because the window was filthy. Other areas of the hotel were dirty as well and people were complaining. The booking came with a free Deluxe Room Upgrade and if this was it, then the Board of Health needs to shut this place down. We travel alot and this was a motel at best - not for $196.00 a night!. We tried getting a room at the Marriot, Sheraton and W Hotel (our favorite) but they were all booked. The only good thing abou this trip was the wondeful people of New Orleans. They had such a great spirit despite everything they were thru with Katrina. Shame on you, Holiday Inn! Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: TNgirl122
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine and I stayed at the Holiday Inn over St. Patrick's Day weekend. We were on the 19th floor which apparently was added on after the hotel was built. The elevator goes up to the 18th floor, you get off on the 18th floor and take another elevator to the 19th and 20th floors. The elevator was slow and one of them did break down over the course of the weekend. We used the service elevator once. Our room was really nice, clean, big bathroom. The beds were relatively comfortable. The staff was kind at check in and check out. Overall I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, otherwise very mediocre”
Reviews.Author: gvr001
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights from 3/24-3/27 for a conference. The hotel is in a very good location, squarely situated in the French Quarter. It is one block West of Bourbon Street, and 1 block North of Canal Street. Jackson Square and Harrah's Casino are approximately 5-10 minute walks away, and the conference center is about a 15-20 minute walk from the hotel. Two Sisters Restaurant, Pat O'Briens, Brennan's, and Broussard's are all within a 5 mintue walk from the hotel. This hotel is for 2 types of people. Young couples/singles without children, who are interested in partying in the French Quarter, or individuals attending the conference center. Others should really consider looking elsewhere. I arrived at 3, and was told that I couldn't check in until 4, so I had to go to the gym (see below) to change, and then leave my stuff at the front desk. The hotel has a very worn feel about it. The carpetes, furniture, upholestery, all appear quite used. The exercise facility on the tenth floor( a small pool with greenish appearing water, 1 functional treadmill, 2 bicycles, was substandard for a Holiday Inn. The rooms are very average, although the mattress was comfortable. The AC worked well. The bathroom did not have a fan, and got quite humid. The elevators are slow at times. All things considered, I was disappointed, especially given what we paid; However, given that I was rarely in the room, it served its purpose.

Reviews.Title: “A Bad Idea”
Reviews.Author: j1570176
Reviews.Content: While not the worst possible experience -- most (!) of our group (5 of 6 rooms were there as reserved, and nothing was filthy, except some of the spring breaking guests.... 1. The elevators were a disaster. Our group was on the 17th-20 floors, featuring mediocre views and some real reliance on elevators. But the hotel -- which features 7 or so floors of public parking -- had only 3 old elevators, which were NOT up to the demands placed on them 24 hours a day. So intolerable waits really reduced the advantages of... 2. a genuinely great location and fairly economical prices. But given the terrible elevators and mediocre rooms and amenities (although the free wireless was nice), one should either consider a slightly lesser location to get better room value or springing for more money. The elevator situation here is NOT going to get better, my friends should NOT have been made to share a kings bed rather than get two separate ones, and another friends' reservation should NOT have been lost for a stressful hour.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, horrible hotel!”
Reviews.Author: vadnp1
Reviews.Content: aaah New Orleans, great place to visit but I would recommend sleeping in your car before staying at this hotel. I was here to attend a national Cardiac convention. The hotel staff was indifferent and rude at times. My room had absolutely no light bulbs in any of the lamps. They were not burned out, they were non existent! I called down to the desk and was told "Sorry, we're out" I actually had to go to a local store and buy a few myself (to which I intent to take with me when I leave). The room was dirty, fixtures were rusty and most did not work. ceiling was cracked and falling down. The shower head was actually held to the pipe with duct tape!!! I travel a lot in my business and have never had an experience like this. Holiday Inn should be ashamed to have this particular hotel brandish their name.

Reviews.Title: “Had a very good experience here!”
Reviews.Author: AJR61
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this hotel and the stay was excellent - lovely room with river view. We were part of a UK tour group and were all put in the top two floors which are beautifully decorated and much better than the other floors apparently! Breakfast was good but a lot of people caused mayhem so we were offered a buffet breakfast the next day! All in all an excellent location and very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Location only thig going for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jayy13
Reviews.Content: The location for this hotel is Great, the service and quality is not. Don't even think about calling the front desk, they won't answer. My 7:30 wake up call came at 8:00, my friends never came. The elevators are ALWAYS backed up, plus one broke down and they would not turn over the service elevator to passengers so the wait was as long as 10 minutes for an elevator. The rooms were bare minimum, barely cleaned each day. The indoor pool was FREEZING. I watched several people try to get in but just couldn't, all said way to cold. I mentioned it to the management but was basically told to [---] off (in a nice way).The lobby is very nice but don't be fooled. If you want a great location and don't care about the other things, this is the place. The price is a little high for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Bubba Perfect”
Reviews.Author: KansasBubba
Reviews.Content: Stayed on Valentines night before a cruise. Paid $69 on Hotwire. Be ready to pay $24 to park your car. This is OK because it is covered and attached to the hotel. We felt comfortable walking a block to Bourbon street. No taxi needed. Definitely gives you a feel of staying in New Orleans you would miss by staying in one of the larger new hotels. This is an older hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Precruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrendaB1
