Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night precruise stay at this property with a large group. Hotel was clean, Front Desk was nice & helpful. Rooms were available at all different times for early morning & midday arrivals.. Location was convenient to Bourbon Street, Harrah's, McDonalds, Walgreens, Riverwalk,etc. Nothing fancy but a clean, safe place to stay. Cabs were readily available to take us to the cruise teminal & free cruise parking was included in price for many in our group. Only negative I heard was housekeeping staff is still limited & rooms were not cleaned every day but clean towels were provided every day. Unless you are extremely messy....shouldn't be a problem. I had a reservation to stay at this location again at the end of my cruise but due to icy weather, I was forced to cancel & catch an earlier return flight. I visit New Orleans several times a year & would not hesitate to stay at this location again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - no so good hotel”
Reviews.Author: bkhuna
Reviews.Content: Problems: 1. I had a prepaid reservation (made through an "official" New Orleans tourist website) which stated that I was to receive free parking and an confirmed upgrade to a deluxe room. The desk clerk stated that the upgrade was based on availablilty. The booking website and email confirmation had no such disclosure. Since I paid such a low fare for the room, I didn't want to argue. I smiled and took the standard room. 2. The room was of average quality but the bathroom was tiny, dingy, and beat up. There was no counter space and the fixtures were rusty and dirty. The bed was small and the threadbare sheets did not cover my 6' 2" body. 3. There were wads of kinky hair balls on the carpet in the bedroom and in the hallway. One hairball was on the ceiling above our door. 4. Being on the corner of Royal and Canal puts you in one of the noisiest places in the city. Even though we were on the 15th floor, we heard all the street noise through the cracked windows of our room. There is a liqour store directly across the entrance from the hotel and our room's cracked window let in all of the interesting late night/early morning commotion. We did not however, hear any of the other guests. 5. The unsecured parking lot has direct elevator service to guest floors, creating a security hazard for the guests. I had one occasion early one morning when a drunk women (bottle in hand) and a pimply faced kid were drinking and smoking in the elevator while they rode it up and down looking for the pool. Although there are guest room card readers and signs that state thay you must have a guest key to enter guest floors, the hotel no longer enforces this. 6. There are three guest elevators and one service elevator. On many occasions, only one elevator was operable. It was very frustrating to have to stop on every floor because service carts and all the other guests had to share one elevator. Advantages: 1. Location, location, location. Being on the corner of Royal and Canal makes it easy to see both the French Quarter and locations uptown and in the Garden District. If you have a car, the location is a plus. Summary: Unless parking and ease of access to driving are a priority, I would stay away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!”
Reviews.Author: forecast07
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and two young children overnight during a car trip from Florida to Texas. From the indifferent front desk staff to the urine soaked smell of the dank, dingy parking garage to the room that had no clock or light bulb in the floor lamp our stay at this hotel was downright unpleasant. While the room had been cleaned it did not have a "fresh" feeling. I strongly recommend against staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and That is all”
Reviews.Author: Papawillie56
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn on Royal street in November, 2006. I was promised a free deluxe upgrade when I booked the room but on arrival was told that they had overbooked. The room I stayed in was cleaned but the walls was in terrible condition with the plaster in disarray. Only one elevator was working and it took an hour to get up to my room. The breakfast cost $13.00, it was better to go to the casino to eat. The only plus was the location right at Bourbon Street. I will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “decent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nurse50
Reviews.Content: Our group of five women stayed at Holiday Inn on Royal Street on Nov. 26 for one night prior to our cruise. We found the front desk staff friendly and helpful. The room was average, clean and so was the bathroom. Got a good rate on Hotwire for this room, and it was only one block to Bourbon Street. We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: davem60612
Reviews.Content: This is an average hotel. The rooms are just fine, the hotel is mostly quiet and the employees are nice enough. Nothing special, nothing bad. The things that make this place worthy of recomending to others is location and value. This hotel is in the Quarter close Canal and a block from Bourbon, a good location. The price that can be found online is fantastic! 50 bucks a night for a clean quiet room in this location is just great. A couple of tips for those considering staying here; insist on staying below the 18th floor, above this floor you must take 2 elevators to get to and from your room. To ease getting around use the Hotel Monteleone (sp?) cab stand right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, so your rate had better be!”
Reviews.Author: zski
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Holiday Inn French Quarter this weekend. I booked it on Hotwire and got a fantastic rate ($56/night) and I'll just say that the old adage "you get what you pay for" rang true. There was nothing particularly wrong with the hotel, especially for the rate that I paid, but the furnishings were very plain, the bed was adequate but not exceptionally comfortable, the bathroom was a little dingy and the entire place showed its age and the stress it must have gone through over the past year. Also, the high speed internet was not working and apparently hasn't been since about Sept 16 (I stayed on Oct 8), although a letter posted at the front desk states that they are "working as fast as possible" to get it operational once again. Despite (or maybe because of) the facility's shortcomings, the staff was exceptionally friendly and welcoming, which was definitely the hotel's major redeeming quality. The clerk I dealt with checking in and out, whose name is Georgie, personified the warm & welcoming spirit of New Orleans that I've come to know. The other 2 staff members that I talked to very briefly were also kind and courteous. I had a very cheap rate on this property; I'd say any rate up to about $80 would be a good deal, and perhaps up to $100 would be acceptable. If you're being asked to pay any more than that for this hotel it should only be for a period of peak demand, otherwise, I would look elsewhere for a hotel that is perhaps better maintained or with more amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: mikeh1966
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on this hotel on Hotwire. The Holiday Inn is located just inside the French Quarter on an unsightly block of Royal street filled with souvenir shops, a Subway restaurant and a convenience store. The lobby was very nice and the staff were very accommodating. We had a problem with our air conditioner and the maintenance man gave the problem his prompt attention. The hotel rooms (including the bathroom) are a bit outdated but I guess you get what you pay for. It was very evident the difference between a 4 star hotel (the Intercontinental, where I stayed a couple of months ago- plusher beddings, marble in the bath, etc.) and this 3 star.The proximity to all of the happenings in the French Quarter would be the only reason I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Holiday Inn on Royal”
Reviews.Author: MarigoldMolly
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in May 2006. We have been visitors to NO every year since 1994. An overall the Holiday Inn has been the best location,service,room size and cleanliness of all. We didn't want for anything. There are 2 stores directly acroos the street,Walgreens on the corner,Subway and other restaurants to the right of the hotel. We have stayed ther at the Fairmont,Comfort suites and in the french quarter. I'd recommend the Holiday Inn to everyone. The price was right since we went through Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Awful - A Place to Avoid”
Reviews.Author: PaulDallas_Texas
Reviews.Content: I would never have considered the Holiday Inn French Quarter but I agreed to be moved to it when the hotel where I was confirmed called to tell me they were oversold. My stay was during Jazz Fest, so there weren't a lot of options. I had been promised a non-smoking room with a king-sized bed but when I tried to check in, I was told the only non-smoking rooms left had only two double beds. However, the woman at the front desk said these were on one of their "premium" floors, the 19th. I accepted this and went to me room. The room was hardly "premium," as it was dim, tiny and directly across from a noisy ice maker. An hour later, I received a courtesy call from the manager on duty, asking if I needed anything. I told him I wanted a king non-smoking room, which he managed to locate after all. I was moved down a floor to the new room and from there things went down hill quickly. The "non-smoking" room smelled like a very dirty ashtray, the grimy bathroom had a cracked tub/shower wall and it looked as if someone had gone around walls of the room pulling off the plaster. When I tried to use the shower or sink, the water pressure would drop off dramatically after a few minutes, making it a chaollenge to shave or take a complete shower. I could not get out of that hotel and that room fast enough. I will never, never, never consider this hotel in the future. You have been warned!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: manshacktx
Reviews.Content: I had real misgivings about keeping my reservation at this hotel after reading postings. While our room was a little worn, especially the carpet, the staff could not have been better. They were the most friendly, helpful hotel staff I have ever encountered in my many (about 50) trips to New Orleans. While the hotel itself is standard Holiday Inn, the rooms are large, the beds comfortable and the location good. There are definitely more luxurious, attractive hotels, but no better staff anywhere. We had maintenance problem when we first checked in, and the repair person was at our door to fix it almost before we hung up the phone! The next day, I mentioned a small problem to the front desk, but told them I really did not need them to fix it - just wanted them to be aware. By the time we returned from breakfast, the maintenance staff had already taken care of the problem. I have never had service like that anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews, I was very unsure of booking the Holiday Inn. But I am extremely glad I did. We booked a room for Mardi Gras '06 and it turned out to be in the perfect location!!!!! We arrived early and they had our room already cleaned, which is something I have always had a problem with in New Orleans. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The accomidations were also on point. I will be staying there again (we frequent NO often)!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful stay at the Holiday Inn. I was travelling with my mother and the entire staff, even with their limited resources, went out of their way to make our stay memorable ! This hotel is not a luxury resort but is an above average Holiday Inn. There was no room service, but that was fine. There is a coffee maker in each room and the hotel restaurant served a fine buffet style breakfast. We had difficulty obtaining transportation from the French Quarter to the airport on Fat Tuesday. One of the staff, Ashley actually contacted a driver she knew personally who parked his taxi at the hotel overnight, so he would be sure to be able to transport my mother, her wheelchair and all of our luggage, door to door ! I can hardly wait to go back and will stay at no other hotel ! Thank You New Orleans and the Holiday Inn for having us !

Reviews.Title: “Never say Never”
Reviews.Author: MardiPartyGal
Reviews.Content: We stayed for MardiGras 2005. Normally we stay at the Marriott but we waited too late to book. Took a chance and paid more for the Holiday Inn French Quarter ($319 a night), hoping for the best. Checkin time is supposed to be 2:00. We arrived early, 10:00, to watch the parade and was told our room was available but not cleaned. No problem, we were early. We asked about restrooms and were told to use the restaurant located by the lobby (TGI Friday's). At 2:00, the room was still not available. Not a problem yet, enjoying the parade. At 4:00, room not available, new staff on and very rude, and the restaurant is charging $5.00 a person to use the restrooms. By 6:00, I am furious! The manager is called and he finds us a room. He then tells us that a restroom was located on the 4th floor that we could have used, (the staff never mentioned it) and gives us a credit on the room. The room was at the top of the hotel, you have to take two elevators to get to it, but the room was large and by this time we're just ready to unpack. I'm so upset over the hotel that it's hard to relax and let go, but once we unpacked and hit the streets and restaurants, we were able to enjoy the rest of our four night stay. The manager made a point to ask how we were doing when we saw him. Oh! and once while we in the elevator, way too many partying people crowded in and we were stuck between floors in the dark for it seemed like 20 minutes. Very scary with a drunk crowd. They started jumping to make it move!!! We had to be lifted up and crawl through a two foot space to exit. I swore I would NEVER book here again, but I just called the Marriott and due to hurricane Katrina they are not booking until the first of the year. I don't want to not have a room at a great parade and French Quarter location, SO HERE I GO AGAIN, booking for MardiGras 2006! The location is excellent, you want to have access to the French Quarter during the long parades, because you are not allowed to cross Canal Street while they are in progess.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: markcos
Reviews.Content: Price and location mean nothing if the hotel is no good. This hotel exceeded all expectations. The staff was friendly and available. The location made renting a car a mistake since all was within walking distance. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected...pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: happyme101
Reviews.Content: I must admit I was hesitant after reading the reviews and even phoned the manager directly because my reservation was incorrect...(thank God I called to confirm)! I made him aware of the mostly negative reviews on this site and he reassured me things would go smoothly during my stay. I have no idea what people are talking about when the say the front desk staff was rude. Either they changed the staff, had a "customer relations" seminar or some of us are hard to please..the staff was AWESOME. From the sweet girls who checked us in (Hi Ramona) to the bellman who took us up to our room, everyone was more than pleasant. I did request a high floor which I received and recommend. The building was added on to a few years back so the 18th and 19th floors are much newer and brighter. The hotel does have a darkness even dungeony feel to the hallways and the elevators are horrible. There is no A/C in the evlevators and when your in N.O. in the middle of summer ya knida need the A/C in small confined spaces such as these. Our room was around the level of a holiday inn...no better no worse. It was clean and comfy. The location of the place is really unbeatable. I grew up in N.O. and I will tell you the place this hotel is located is SAFE. I've read pthers talk about it being raelly scary and they are just not familiar w/ N.O. Many places in this beloved city can appear that way! We stayed for the pre-cruise deal and for the money you can't beat the price! Our car was waiting and was just as we had left it. Thanks to the staff for making our stay comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I, like some of the other reviewers was apprehensive after reading some the horror stories abut this hotel. I arrived after midnight and was checked in and in my room with out any fuss within 10 minutes after arrival. The room was clean and serviced as reqd throughout the week I was there. Fantastic location, requested and got a fridge for the room no problem. 16 Floor facing the Mississippi, great view. I must have struck a good week as staff were friendly and efficient,room tidy,all taps and shower worked ok. Would stay again but would try and get the same room. Restaurant next door ok for breakfast, some nice cafes further up Royal St as well.

Reviews.Title: “Must do better”
Reviews.Author: RagBag
Reviews.Content: Location great, service and cleanliness terrible. Although we never checked in until 5:30 PM, our travelling companions room was not serviced even though they were given the key, then it was a problem getting another room. One of the bath taps was hanging off the wall as was the hair drier. I cut my head on the towell rack when standing up after turning on the bath tap, a few drops of blood were around the hand basin and these remained for the two days we were there. The coffee maker and cups not cleaned on our second day. We had breakfast in the adjacent restuarant, the food was fine but again the service was terrible, the coffee wasn't topped up and it took over 1 hour just to get a omelette. There are a lot better and cheaper alternatives. The hotel would benefit from a complete make over along with the staff.

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I reviewed this hotel on your web site before travelling to New Orleans for the Jazz Fess. with a coach tour. As you can image, my thoughts were I would be visiting a dive, where the rooms were dirty, the food terrible, the service non-existent. What a surprise to find nothing like what I imagined, a new resturant, with great service and food, a spotless room, with very polite chamber maids, in fact the only thing I found to moan about was the extractor fans from other buildings and if you were in a different side of the building you would not even get that. The hotel was in a good place to walk to shops, the river front, and many other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at H.I French quarter for Jazzfest 2005. I was a bit worried after reading the reviews here on trip advisor. I don't usually scare easy, but I saw many bad reviews here. I was pleasantly surprised! First, the front desk could not have been nicer. They were very eager to please and the concierge were very friendly and helpful. I did get a room on the 16th floor and it was very nice with a view of the river. I don't know if it was a better room than on lower floors for sure, but it was nice and I had no problems with it. The location could not have been better and this should be the number one sell for this property. The only complaint I have is for the adjoining restaurant which recently changed names. The food was not that good and the bathrooms were disgusting even late in the day when noone was in the restaurant and they had time to go in and clean it up a bit. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Aussie40
Reviews.Content: Staff need a bit of a refresher in customer service...we couldn't get a safe and there were 6 of us - "sorry, none left" and not too helpful, the location was terrific but the staff let us down...no water to drink in the rooms - no bar fridge or coffee making facilities...there is a bar next door which is okay - serves breakfast & lunch & dinner...stay here only for the location

Reviews.Title: “Not worth your money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would definitely not recommend this hotel. We arrived in New Orleans on Friday and could not check in for four hours. Apparently they have a waiting list when you arrive. At check in time, there were literally 20-30 people standing in the lobby waiting for their name to be called. The bathroom was not clean, and the room smelled. The false fire alarm on Sunday morning was also a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Everything Else Fair at Best”
Reviews.Author: hoffman_david
Reviews.Content: We stayed there Jan 15-18, 2005. We found the staff to be friendly but practically useless. The requested rollaway bed was not there when the room was finally ready, so I called the desk. We went out for 4 hours, and when the kids were ready for bed, no rollaway. I called again and was told someone would be "right up." Half an hour later: "the manager will bring it up himself." An hour after that, I went down the desk again, was given vouchers for free breakfast for two days, and FINALLY the bed was brought up. The concierge didn't try to sell us any timeshares, so I don't know what the other reviewer was talking about. She wasn't a true concierge, though, but more of a ticket agency for area tours and attractions (she wasn't employed by the hotel). The room was clean, we could see the Mississippi from our room (barely), and the location on Royal Street was awesome. Overall, I wouldn't stay there again unless I got a rate significantly lower than other hotels in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you want to play games with the staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel at 10:00 p.m. the night of our stay. The concierge was unfriendly when we asked for directions to the nearest internet kiosk. We followed the directions, and there was no kiosk to be found, so we went back to ask again. He gave us direction to Cafe Dumonde, which we KNEW had no internet kiosk. It appears he was trying to get us off his back. Parking was an extra $22 onto our bill. Although this is a large hotel, they seemed to only be booking the 15th floor--there was a party of teenage kids along with other various travelers, all staying on the same floor. There was a lot of noise due to this booking. The television kept turning to static every 10 minutes or so, sometimes more frequently. Don't expect your room to be cleaned until after 7 p.m. if you are staying more than one night. If none of this stuff bothers you, I will add that the room itself was fairly clean. Also, the location is good--very close to restaurants and bars, and right in the middle of the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Double Charged”
Reviews.Author: GBains
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August 2004. The hotel was booked by Tourco so we had a pre paid voucher. When we arrived they had us booked for three nights but our voucher and the booking was for two nights. When we checked out they wanted to charge us for the room plus parking, to be honest a 6 year old could have done a better job than the reception staff. Eventually they found the voucher so we paid for the parking only. When we arrived home we found that they charged us for the room on our credit card without our agreement. Its now December and we are still trying to get this probelm resolved.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, location was convenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There was 6 of us in 3 rooms. We had all requested non-smoking, when we checked in we found out that we were in smoking. Our rooms where changed but 1 room as on the 20th floor while the other 2 were on the 10th. Supposedly this Holiday Inn had been recently remodeled but our top latch was broken off our door but that was minor. Our biggest complaint is the front desk. We asked for 2 extra pillows, never got them. They never seemed to be able to answer the simplest of questions and constantly referred us to the Concriege Desk which there wouldn't be anyone there or they wouldn't answer the phone. Service is something they really need to work on. But for the location, I guess you can't have ever right.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Money and Location”
Reviews.Author: KVR
Reviews.Content: We stayed November 12 - 15, 2004 Great location on Royal Street. Close to restaurants, shops and 1 block over from Bourbon Street. Within walking distance to all the area bars and attractions. We arrived at 10:00 am. Expected to just leave our bags with the front desk and start our day. Was surprised that our room was ready and we were given the key. Front desk personel very nice and accomendating. We were on the 10th floor. No direct view from the room except tops of the surrounding buildings. However, it was on the same floor as the indoor pool, so very convenient. The room had 2 double beds. (we would have preferred 1 king, but no big deal) Typical Motel 6 type acommendations. The room was clean and the maid service kept it that way. The toilet did overflow on the 2nd day, but we called and they came and fixed it/cleaned the bathroom quickly. The hotel could stand for some updating, but in all it was fine since the location and price was great. The indoor pool was nice. On the small side though. Rectangle shape. Heated, but could have been heated a little more. We never saw anybody use it or the connecting fitness room. We swam one evening for about an hour. Would have been better if it had a whirlpool. We wouldn't hesitate staying here again. We have pics on our web-site: http://community.webshots.com/user/kvrlvn

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good value”
Reviews.Author: spparkgrls
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel October 14th, 2004 through the 18th. I thought the location was perfect... just a block off Bourbon and right in the heart of the action. This hotel is a little older and nothing fancy but compared to some of the prices of hotels around Bourbon Street we thought it was a great value. There is a TGI Friday's attached to the hotel but with all the great food to be found in the city don't bother. All the staff were friendly and helpful. We felt safe in this area and often walked around (early in the morning) from Bourbon St. with no problems. Room was clean and overall had a great experience. We will stay here again for our next trip back to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Let the good times be so so”
Reviews.Author: GlenM442
Reviews.Content: Stayed Oct. 5 & 6. Great location in the Quarter. Had King suite with a rate of $199. for first night and $149. for second night. Experienced delayed check-in (room wasn't ready until 4:45 p.m). However, room was clean and I had no general complaints about room. Interior of hotel appears to be showing age, although work was progressing. Fitness room?? Forget it. One old treadmill (incline broken), recumbent cycle and old life cycle. Exercise room didn't open until 7:00 a.m. (I guess it is the "Big Easy). Adjoining TGIFridays was convenient, but this is the home of food. Save TGIFridays for some other time. Staff was reasonably helpful. Perhaps my expectations were just to high for a French Quarter Hotel (even if it is a Holiday Inn). Next time, for a few more dollars, I'd stay at something more upscale with more atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Lethallezzle
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights at the end of July with my husband and son. Receptionists were very helpful and friendly at all times and we were able to check in at 10.30am. Our room was very clean, apart from the air conditioning unit which was a bit grimy. Furnishings were lovely and bed was comfortable and we had a reasonably good view of the river. The only complaint was we could not get a hot shower but that wasn't really a problem as the temperature outside was stifling so it was nice to cool off! The pool was a bonus and it was very handy having TGI's next door. Would definitely return to this hotel if I was ever lucky enough to return to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but noisy a/c”
Reviews.Author: lektor
Reviews.Content: Had a room on 10th floor with fine view of the river. Clean, and not too much noise from outside. The aircondition was very disturbing, though, and kept me awake. With sealed windows and the hot and humid New Orleans summer climate, turning off the infernal machine for a whole night was really no option. Still, with the excellent location I would use the hotel again. Didn't feel unsafe at any time. The swimming pool was small but ok for kids. Staff courteous and professional, but really didn't bother them much either. Check-in and check-out was reasonably quick, but noticed several times during my four-day stay that there were unacceptedly long queues at the desk and lots of frustrated customers. Had two very fine day trips with Gray line, the swamp tour and the plantation tour. Both highly recommended not least because of the very knowledgeable, witty and serviceminded tour guides.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We checked in around 6:00 PM. Our room was ready. We had a executive suite with a king sized bed. It was nice. The hotel has a great location. A block and a half to Bourbon St. Half a block from a Walgreens. It was difficult getting to the hotel parking, because part of Royal St. was closed. We parked there for 6 nights. The car was fine. They added the parking fee ($22.00 a night) to the hotel bill, so we didn't have to pay when we left. Maid service was not real good. Once we had to call for towels, twice we had to call for coffee. Cable TV was minimal (I know you don't go to the French Quarter to watch TV, but when you get back to the room, it is nice to watch TV. Basically, there were local channels, the weather channel, TBS, USA, etc. Like I said, it was a great location. Couldn't hear Bourbon St. Just a few blocks from the casino. When we go back, we will stay there again. One problem with the bill when we checked out - they charged us for many phone calls on our first day. I told them I didn't use the phone, and they took off the charges. Like I said, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price”
Reviews.Author: Nachos
Reviews.Content: We ended up choosing the Holiday Inn because it had a combination of a low price and a really convenient location. It's close to some great restaurants and just far enough from Bourbon street so that it isn't noisy. The indoor pool on the 10th floor was nice, too. No complaints here.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn New Orleans French Quarter
HotelInfo.Address: 124 Royal St., New Orleans, LA 70130
